title: Senior Python Developer
description:
**Join Enhanza's Innovative Remote Team!** 




 Are you a highly experienced, self-managed, and detail-oriented Python Developer seeking a pivotal role where you can truly make an impact? Enhanza is looking for a talented individual to be our sole Python Developer, working closely with our CTO and Web Developer to build and enhance critical internal systems. This is an exciting opportunity to take ownership, drive innovation, and contribute significantly to our data infrastructure. While our company is based in Stockholm, our development team is spread across Europe, making this a fully remote position within the CET timezone.
 



  





**About Enhanza** 




 Enhanza is a dynamic company located in Stockholm, but our developer team thrives on remote collaboration across Europe. We are a close-knit team with a strong team spirit, having worked together for a long time. We believe in structure, simplicity, and thorough documentation, ensuring that our projects are well-maintained and easily understood. Projects are managed in weekly sprints using Jira, and our code is hosted on BitBucket.
 



  





**About the Role** 




 As our Senior Python Developer, you will be instrumental in two key areas:
 



  





**1. Custom Connectors Development** 




 You will be responsible for developing an internal ecosystem of custom connectors. This will involve:
 


* Designing, developing, and maintaining robust and efficient Python-based custom connectors.
* Collaborating closely with the Web Developer to integrate these connectors seamlessly with our existing web applications.
* Working hand-in-hand with our Data Analyst to understand data requirements and ensure connectors meet the needs of our data pipeline.



  





**2. New dbt Run Deployment Pipeline with Google Cloud Run** 




 You will spearhead the development of a brand-new dbt run deployment pipeline from the ground up, leveraging Google Cloud Run. Your responsibilities will include:
 


* Architecting and implementing a scalable and reliable dbt deployment solution using Google Cloud Run.
* Working in tight collaboration with the Web Developer to ensure smooth integration and operational efficiency.
* Partnering closely with the Data Analyst to optimize the pipeline for data transformation needs and performance.



  





 This role is initially a full-time assignment, with the potential to scale down to up-keeping and continuous improvements once the core projects are established.
 



  





**What We're Looking For** 



* **Extensive Python Experience** 
 : Proven track record in developing complex Python applications.
* **Self-Managed & Proactive** 
 : Ability to work independently, prioritize tasks, and drive projects to completion, understanding that you will be the sole Python developer.
* **Problem-Solver** 
 : Excellent analytical skills with a knack for finding creative solutions to technical challenges.
* **Collaboration** 
 : Strong communication and teamwork skills, with the ability to work effectively with cross-functional teams in a remote setting.
* **Structured & Organized** 
 : A deep understanding of the importance of structure, simplicity, and documentation for maintainability and easy onboarding (the "hit-by-bus-strategy").
* **Familiarity with Data Tools** 
 : Experience with or a strong understanding of data connectors and dbt is highly desirable.
* **Cloud Experience** 
 : Practical experience with Google Cloud Platform, particularly Google Cloud Run, is a significant plus.
* **Language** 
 : Fluency in English is essential for effective communication within our distributed team.
* **Location** 
 : Must be located in or close to the CET timezone to facilitate seamless collaboration with the rest of our European team.



  





**Why Join Enhanza?** 



* **Impactful Role** 
 : Be the key Python expert, shaping our internal data systems from the ground up.
* **Collaborative Remote Environment** 
 : Work closely with our CTO, Web Developer, and Data Analyst, contributing to a cohesive and innovative team spread across Europe.
* **Growth Opportunity** 
 : Take on significant responsibility and advance your skills in a dynamic setting with cutting-edge technologies.
* **Strong Team Spirit** 
 : Join a team that has a long history of working well together and values collaboration.
* **Modern Development Practices** 
 : Engage with weekly sprints in Jira and maintain code in BitBucket.

title: Fullstack Developer - AI-Enhanced Development
description:
Join Mitigram as a Fullstack Developer and help build our next-generation trade platform and AI-assisted products. We're looking for engineers who can hit the ground running in a modern, clean architecture and are eager to embrace AI as an integral part of the development workflow.
 



  





 If you're excited about the future of development—where AI amplifies your capabilities rather than replaces them — this role is for you.
 



  





**About Mitigram** 




 Mitigram is the leading digital platform for global trade financing. It is on a journey to build the largest and most comprehensive trade finance network, leveraging data to enable insights and accelerate the digitalisation of global trade and trade finance.
 



  





 As a growing company with a collaborative, innovative team, we offer an exciting opportunity to make a tangible impact on cutting-edge projects. Join us as we shape the future of Trade Finance!
 



  





**Why You’ll Love This Role** 




 We don’t just allow AI tools -we integrate them.
 



 You’ll collaborate with
 **AI-powered development agents** 
 like Claude Code that understand our architecture and workflows, enabling you to build faster, cleaner, and smarter.
 



  





  





**Our Tech Stack** 




  





**Backend** 



* .NET 8 with C# 13 (using the latest language features)
* Domain-Driven Design (DDD): aggregate roots, entities, value objects
* CQRS pattern via Mediator
* SQL Server + Dapper (high-performance data access)
* Redis for distributed caching
* xUnit and Test Driven Development



  





**Frontend** 



* Svelte 4, Typescript, Angular
* SASS/CSS and design system integration
* Vite for modern build tooling with HMR
* Testing with Vitest
* Collaboration through Figma



  





**Infrastructure** 



* Azure cloud-native deployment
* Docker + Kubernetes for containerization and orchestration
* JWT/OAuth/SAML for enterprise authentication



  





  





**What You’ll Bring to Succeed** 




  





**Must Have:** 



* Comfort using AI coding assistants (Copilot, Claude, etc.)
* Strong C#/.NET background with solid DDD understanding
* Experience with CQRS or similar architectural patterns
* Proficiency in a modern reactive framework - Angular + Typescript (or Svelte experience)
* Strong TypeScript and type-safe coding practices
* SQL expertise—you write queries, not just use ORMs
* TDD mindset—tests are part of how you think
* 5-7 years of professional experience in full-stack development
* Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a related technical field,
 *or* 
 equivalent demonstrated experience in full-stack software development.



  





**Nice to Have:** 



* Svelte experience (or eagerness to learn fast)
* Dapper or micro-ORM familiarity
* Hands-on experience with Azure cloud services



  





**The Mindset We’re Looking For** 




 🤖
 **AI-First Thinking** 
 – You treat AI as a collaborator that accelerates your output and quality.
 



 🏗️
 **Architecture Matters** 
 – You care deeply about clean code and maintainable systems.
 



 🧪
 **Test-Driven** 
 – You write tests to move faster and deploy confidently.
 



 🎨
 **Craft & Quality** 
 – You take pride in both backend elegance and frontend polish.
 



 🚀
 **Ownership** 
 – You ship features end-to-end, from database to UI.
 



  





**What You’ll Build** 



* Secure enterprise authentication (SSO, MFA, social login)
* User and organisation management features
* Security-critical, auditable systems
* Responsive, accessible frontends
* API integrations across Mitigram’s ecosystem
* Scalable microservices



  





**Our Development Culture** 



* **API-First Development** 
 – clear contracts and strong types
* **Code Review & Collaboration** 
 – we learn and grow together
* **AI Integration** 
 – specialised agents that understand our patterns
* **Continuous Deployment** 
 – ship fast, ship often



  





**About the Team** 




 You’ll join a team that values technical excellence, clean architecture, and pragmatic engineering. Together, we’re building critical infrastructure for Mitigram’s global trade platform—work that matters, done right.
 



  





**As a Mitizen** 



* You will be part of cutting-edge projects in Trade Finance.
* Have the opportunity to collaborate with a curious, open, and innovative team.
* You will enjoy career growth opportunities and professional development support.
* You will benefit from a learning budget, comprehensive health insurance, and a strong focus on work-life balance.
* You will make a tangible impact in a growing, fast-paced company.



  





**What happens next?** 




 If you believe this position aligns with your skills and career goals, we encourage you to apply as soon as possible! We will review applications on a rolling basis.
 



  





 At Mitigram, we’re open and curious, so if you are not entirely confident you meet our exact criteria, apply anyway —we value many other qualities as well. We're committed to building an inclusive and diverse team. We welcome applications from developers of all backgrounds who share our passion for technical excellence and innovation.
 



  





**Reference and Background Checks** 




 As part of the recruitment process, we will ask the final candidate for references and conduct a background check.

title: Dot Net Web Developer - Optimizely CMS
description: Develop, enhance, and maintain web applications using Optimizely CMS and .NET Core Translate business requirements into technical architecture and reusable components Develop integrations with external system Ensure the application adheres to performance, scalability and security standards Work closely with cross-functional teams in Agile environment Maintain technical documentation for applications, APIs, and systems. Hands-on experience in Optimizely Strong proficiency in C, ASP.NET MVC, and .NET Core for backend development Experience in developing and maintaining Optimizely templates, blocks, and content types Integrate Optimizely with external systems via APIs Manage deployment and hosting in cloud environments Implement caching, performance tuning and SEO optimization Participate in code reviews, debugging, deployment, and performance optimizationExperience with frontend frameworks Understanding of SEO optimization techniques for CMS-based websites

title: .NET Web Developer – Optimizely CMS
description:
**Job Title: .NET Web Developer – Optimizely CMS** 




  





 📍
 **Location:** 
 Stockholm, Sweden
 



 🕒
 **Contract:** 
 6-12 Months (Possible Extension)
 



 🏢
 **Work Model:** 
 Onsite
 



 💼
 **Experience:** 
 8–10 Years
 



 💰
 **Rate:** 
 As per Market Standards
 



 🗣
 **Language:** 
 English
 



  





**About the Role** 




 We’re seeking an experienced .NET Web Developer skilled in Optimizely (Episerver) CMS to design, develop, and optimize enterprise-grade web applications. You’ll work in a collaborative Agile environment, building scalable and secure digital solutions that align with business goals.
 



  





**Key Responsibilities** 



* Develop, enhance, and maintain web applications using Optimizely CMS, .NET Core, and C#.
* Translate business needs into technical architecture and reusable components.
* Build Optimizely templates, blocks, and content types; integrate with external systems via APIs.
* Ensure performance, scalability, and security standards are met.
* Manage cloud deployments, CI/CD pipelines, and technical documentation.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams in an Agile setup and participate in code reviews and UAT.



  





**Required Skills** 



* 8–10 years in software development with strong C#, ASP.NET MVC, and .NET Core expertise.
* 3+ years’ hands-on experience in Optimizely CMS development and customization.
* Experience with REST APIs, Azure, and frontend frameworks (React, Angular, or Vue).
* Knowledge of SEO optimization, caching, and performance tuning for CMS websites.
* Excellent communication and problem-solving skills.



  





**Nice to Have** 



* Experience with Optimizely DXP, headless CMS, or DevOps tools (Docker, Kubernetes).

title: Sr. Software Engineer - Mobile applications
description:
Meet
 
 Yubico
 
 : the creator of the most secure passkeys and leading provider of hardware authentication security keys. Our company’s mission is to make secure login easy and available for everyone. Yubico was founded in 2007 by Stina and Jakob Ehrensvard, and is public on Nasdaq Stockholm Main Market: YUBICO. Our customers include Fortune 500 companies, hundreds of government agencies and millions of individuals in over 160 countries that rely on Yubico technology to secure access to computers, online services and mobile apps. We  are a global company with a strong company culture and employees located in over 14 countries. Yubico’s  headquarters are based in  Stockholm, Sweden and Santa Clara, CA.  Aligned with our mission to make the internet more secure for everyone, Yubico donates YubiKeys to organizations helping at-risk individuals through our philanthropic initiative,
 
 Secure it Forward
 
 .
 




  





**At Yubico, we offer:**




  





**Yubico Values:
 
 We work to ensure that our employees have an open space to have their voices amplified to create a workplace where everyone feels like they belong. Aligned with this, our employees have created some pretty cool Employee Resource Groups: YubiPride, YubiBIPOC, YubiSustainability and YubiWomen. Additionally, Yubico donates YubiKeys to organizations in need all over the world (you can read more about our work here).
 

  





**Social Connection:
 
 Relationships and connectedness matter, and we love spending time with our team! Our virtual workspace keeps us connected day-to-day whether it's through Yubico celebrating wins or our buzzing Slack communities. Check out our
 
 Life at Yubico Page
 
 on LinkedIn and our awards
 
 here
 **.
 
  






 The Role:
 




  






 We are looking for a talented mobile app developer to join our team in Stockholm. You will be working with us to build mobile applications in Flutter, with native components interfacing with the platform at a lower level. While previous Flutter experience is not required, you should be motivated to learn. You should have a background in developing mobile apps for either iOS or Android, as you will also contribute native code for the platform you know best. An enthusiasm for cryptography, secure systems, and solving challenging technical problems will make you an excellent fit.
 




  






  




**Tasks & Responsibilities:** 
* Design, build, and maintain mobile applications (Flutter) with native components in iOS (Swift/Objective-C) or Android (Kotlin/Java)
* Participate in architecture discussions and contribute to technical decision-making
* Debug and resolve issues across devices and platforms
* Write and maintain unit and integration tests
* Continuously learn and apply new tools, frameworks, and best practices



  




**Basic Qualifications:** 
* Bachelor or MS in Computer Science or a relevant technical discipline, or equivalent work experience
* Experience in building mobile apps with rich user interfaces
* Experience with native app development on iOS and/or Android
* Ability to write code that is secure, readable, testable, and easy to maintain
* Able to take initiative, maintain a positive attitude, be self-motivated, and work effectively on projects with minimal direct supervision



  




**Bonus Qualifications:** 
* Experience with CI/CD pipelines (e.g. Github Actions)
* Experience working with NFC/USB/Lightning communication
* Experience with cryptography (PKI, digital signatures, etc)
* Experience working with open source and the open source community
* Experience with Flutter






  




  














  





 We are an equal opportunity employer, we value diversity and uphold an inclusive environment where all people feel that they are equally respected and valued. All applicants will be considered for employment without attention to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, marital status, religion, national origin, disability, protected Veteran status or any other characteristic protected by law. We'd love to learn about what you can add to our diverse team.
 



  





 Yubico does not accept agency resumes or referrals so please do not send them to our careers staff or employees. Yubico is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes or referrals.
 



  





 Personal data submitted through this form is used for managing Yubico’s recruitment activities, which include facilitating any application you make, setting up and conducting interviews and tests for applicants, evaluating and assessing results and selecting candidates, and as otherwise needed in our recruitment and onboarding processes. The use of your personal data may also be necessary prior to entering into a contract with you (that is prior to offering you a job with Yubico). Your personal data will only be used for the purposes for which it was collected and in accordance with the Yubico Privacy Notice. We only keep your personal data for as long as necessary and in compliance with Yubico’s record retention policies. If you have asked us to, we will keep you informed of other opportunities at Yubico. We do this in various ways, including email and by phone. If at any time you do not want us to contact you or use your information as described herein please contact us at jobs@yubico.com to let us know and we will delete all such information. Providing your personal data is voluntary, but necessary to join our talent community, and if you do not agree to provide your data, we will not be able to consider you as part of our talent community.
 



  





 As part of providing the requested service, we will transfer your data to be processed by Lever, Inc., a service provider contracted by Yubico AB and/or its subsidiaries that meets legally mandated privacy requirements. The Yubico Privacy Notice offers more information about Yubico privacy practices, including the lawful basis for processing of personal data, how to lodge a complaint with the supervisory authority, and how to contact Yubico to exercise your data subject rights. In this notice, when we refer to "Yubico", "us", "we" or "our", we mean the Yubico group company or companies that you apply to, or correspond with, and which are responsible for any personal data collected about you.  
 



  





  




  


 We may use artificial intelligence (AI) tools to support parts of the hiring process, such as reviewing applications, analyzing resumes, or assessing responses. These tools assist our recruitment team but do not replace human judgment. Final hiring decisions are ultimately made by humans. If you would like more information about how your data is processed, please contact us.******

title: Software Engineer - Front-end till Axfood IT, Stockholm
description:
Välkommen till Axfood IT, en av matbranschens största IT-avdelningar med drygt 350 medarbetare. Det är vi som ser till att Axfood, och alla våra kedjor, kan ligga i framkant vad gäller digital utveckling. Vi jobbar med att utveckla och förbättra allt ifrån e-handel till logistiklösningar och AI.
   

  

 Hos Axfood IT blir du del av ett sammanhang som utmanar och levererar lösningar som gör skillnad, både för våra kollegor och våra kunder. Här finns det alltid möjlighet att lära sig om ny teknik och växa, både som individ och tillsammans med kollegorna.
   

  

**Ditt nya team**
 Hämta kassarna i ett skåp, eller få maten hemkörd till dörren? I vårt e-handelsteam utvecklar vi digitala tjänster som gör det enklare och härligare för våra kunder att handla mat online, oavsett om det är via mobilen eller webben.
   

  

 I gruppen finns specialister inom bland annat test, design, agila metoder och såklart webb- och apputveckling, som jobbar tillsammans för att skapa de bästa lösningarna för hundratusentals kunder varje vecka. Vi arbetar med ett starkt fokus på användarupplevelse och tillgänglighet.
   

  

**Ett ax-plock – Kollegornas favoriter på jobbet**
* Chansen att delta i projekt som sträcker sig över hela Axfood-koncernen
* Att jobba med produkter och lösningar som gör skillnad i människors vardag, i hela landet.
* Ett team med stark teknisk kompetens som har kul tillsammans


**Om rollen**
 Du kommer att arbeta med både webb och app, i React och React Native och vara med och forma framtidens e-handelsupplevelse. Rollen innebär också att du tar ett naturligt ledarskap i teamet – genom att coacha kollegor, driva tekniska beslut och bidra till ett hållbart och effektivt arbetssätt.
   

  

**Dina arbetsuppgifter kommer att inkludera:**
* Designa, utveckla, testa och optimera stabila, skalbara och säkra e-handelslösningar
* Arbeta effektivt med arkitekter, UX-designers, och produktteam för att nå gemensamma mål
* Skriva automatiserade tester
* Delta i planering, prioritering och kontinuerlig förbättring av teamets arbetssätt
* Förstå och tillämpa verksamhetskunskap för att säkerställa att tekniska lösningar möter affärsbehoven och bidrar till organisationens övergripande mål


**Stämmer detta in på dig?**
 Vi söker dig som är en erfaren frontendutvecklare med passion för teknik och människor. Som person tror vi att du är nyfiken på ny teknik och gillar att hitta och driva nya lösningar. Du är prestigelös, kommunikativ och bidrar till en positiv kultur när du samarbetar inom det egna teamet, och med andra.
   

  

**För att lyckas i rollen tror vi att du:**
* Har god erfarenhet av React och/eller React Native
* Har jobbar med både webb och mobilapplikationer.
* Är van att skriva automatiserade tester
* Trivs i en agil miljö med högt tempo och stort ansvar.


 Det är extra meriterande om du också har erfarenhet av att jobba med e-handel eller i en annan frontendmiljö med hög komplexitet och stor mängd funktionalitet
   

  

**Ansökningsprocessen**
 Vi vill att det ska vara enkelt att söka jobb hos oss. Om du inte har ett CV redo räcker det med att du länkar en väl ifylld LinkedIn-profil. I din ansökan får du svara på de frågor vi behöver svar på i den här delen av processen, och personligt brev är därför inte obligatoriskt.
   

  

 Vi hanterar ansökningar löpande och tjänsten kan därför tillsättas innan sista ansökningsdag. Vår rekryteringsprocess innehåller tester, intervjuer, bakgrundskontroll och ID-kontroll. Observera att vi inte under denna rekryteringsprocess kommer be dig logga in med ditt Bank-id eller scanna någon QR-kod, men vi kommer be dig styrka din identitet i processens slutskede.
   

  

 Vid frågor om rekrytering på Axfood, kontakta Medarbetarsupporten på jobb@axfood.se. Läs mer: Så går det till när du söker jobb inom Axfood. Om du har frågor om tjänsten, kontakta elisabeth.wehlin@axfood.se. Av GDPR-skäl behandlar vi inga ansökningar eller annan personlig information via mail.
   

  

 Lyssna på en pod om att jobba på Axfood IT, på Spotify: https://open.spotify.com/episode/37BDOFjcKLkdyleKXLEKXZ?si=UVhPBFC4T96dy-tHa9uuDw

title: ServiceNow Developer
description:
**Job Description:** 




**Responsibilities:** 



* Develop and implement CSDM-aligned CMDB structures and relationships.
* Configure and manage Application Services, Business Applications, and Service Offerings.
* Support Discovery, Service Mapping, and integrations across other servicenow modules and discovery tool like ITOM and BMC Remedy.
* Develop scripts, workflows, and dashboards to improve data quality and automation.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to drive service visibility and data governance.



**Requirements:** 



* 5+ years of hands-on experience with ServiceNow CMDB and CSDM (v3.0 or later).
* Strong skills in JavaScript, Glide API, and ServiceNow configuration.
* Solid understanding of ITIL v4 and ServiceNow platform architecture.
* Experience in data modeling, CI class design, and CMDB health improvements.
* Excellent communication and documentation skills ,able to explain complex models in simple terms
* ServiceNow certifications (CIS–CMDB, CIS–Discovery, CSA) preferred

title: AI Fullstack Developer
description:
Hos oss på Modular Finance arbetar vi för att göra finansbranschen mer tillgänglig. Genom att bygga smarta, datadrivna verktyg skapar vi ökad transparens och effektivitet för över 8000 användare. Vår resa i Norden och Storbritannien går snabbt framåt, och därför har vi startat ett nytt team med en spännande vision: att med hjälp av AI väva in intelligenta och kreativa lösningar i alla våra produkter. Nu letar vi efter dig som vill vara med och forma den här resan från början, som den tredje utvecklaren i vårt växande AI-team!
 



  





**Om oss** 




 Vi är ett stabilt, snabbväxande och entreprenöriellt SaaS-bolag inom finans med drygt 85 anställda. Det innebär en fartfylld miljö, där du får växa med ett stort ansvar och har stor frihet att forma din egen roll och utveckling. På Modular Finance motiveras vi av att skapa värde för våra kunder, av att se egna initiativ bli verklighet och av att arbeta i en miljö där vi ständigt lär oss nya saker. Nya kollegor får även möjlighet att köpa in sig i bolaget och vara med på vår fortsatta resa.
 



  





**Om rollen** 




 Som en av de första i vårt nya AI-team får du en möjlighet att påverka både teamets arbetssätt och våra tekniska val. Tillsammans kommer vi att ansvara för hela utvecklingskedjan för våra AI-funktioner, från idé till färdig produkt. Ditt arbete kommer att inkludera allt från att utforska hur vi med hjälp av agenter och stora språkmodeller (LLM) kan hantera komplex finansiell data, till att designa och bygga de intuitiva gränssnitt där våra användare får nytta av insikterna.
 



  





**Dina ansvarsområden kommer bland annat vara att:** 



* Designa, utveckla och driftsätta AI-drivna system för att extrahera, strukturera och analysera finansiell data.
* Bygga och integrera lösningar med stora språkmodeller för att skapa nya produktfunktioner.
* Aktivt utforska och implementera nya tekniker inom AI för att hålla våra produkter i framkant.
* Arbeta i hela teknikstacken – från databaser och backend i Go till gränssnitt i React.
* Samarbeta nära med produktägare och andra utvecklare för att lösa utmanande problem och leverera verkligt kundvärde.



  





**Tekniker och koncept du kommer arbeta med:** 



* **AI/ML:** 
 Stora språkmodeller (LLM), Vektordatabaser, RAG
* **Backend:** 
 Go, Python
* **Frontend:** 
 React, TypeScript
* **Infrastruktur:** 
 Postgres, NATS, GCP, Docker, Kubernetes



  





**Din profil** 




 Vi söker dig som älskar att bygga saker och som drivs av en nyfikenhet på vad man kan åstadkomma med AI. Du är antingen nyexaminerad från en ingenjörsutbildning eller har några års erfarenhet av mjukvaruutveckling och vill nu satsa på en roll med AI-fokus.
 



  





**Vem är du?** 



* Du har en ingenjörsexamen inom datateknik, teknisk fysik eller motsvarande.
* Du har goda programmeringskunskaper och en vilja att lära dig nya språk och tekniker.
* Du har ett genuint intresse för AI och LLM-teknologier, och du följer aktivt med i vad som händer på området.
* Du är självgående, gillar att ta egna initiativ och är inte rädd för att testa nya idéer.
* Du trivs i en miljö där du får ta ansvar och arbeta tillsammans med andra för att lösa svåra problem.



  





 Om du är rätt person för teamet kommer du att få stöd av en mentor för att växa, både tekniskt och i din karriär.
 



  





**Vi blir extra imponerade om du har erfarenhet av:** 



* Praktisk integrering av LLM:er i applikationer
* Docker och Kubernetes
* Utveckling i en molnmiljö (GCP, AWS eller Azure)
* Finans- och aktiemarknaden – ett intresse här kommer göra jobbet ännu roligare!
* Egna projekt som du kan visa upp – länka gärna din GitHub-profil!



  





**Vad vi erbjuder** 



* En arbetsplats som främjar lärande och kunskapsspridning inom vårt område
* Vi växer snabbt och för rätt person finns goda möjligheter till spännande utveckling inom bolaget
* Stark teamkänsla och gemensamma bolagsaktiviteter såsom AW:s och större event
* Ett stabilt bolag med konkurrenskraftig lön, tjänstepension, friskvårdsbidrag, sjukförsäkring och vårdförsäkring
* Delägande i Modular Finance efter avslutad provanställning



  





**Anställningsform:** 
 Tillsvidareanställning med inledande provanställning om 6 månader
 



  





**Startdatum:** 
 Januari 2026, eller enligt överenskommelse
 



  





**Placering:** 
 På vårt kontor i centrala Stockholm. Vi tillämpar en hybridmodell med 8 valfria remotedagar i månaden.
 



  





**Är det du? Ansök nu!** 




 Du är varmt välkommen med din ansökan. Urvalet kommer att ske löpande, så vänta inte med din ansökan. Vid frågor kring tjänsten är du varmt välkommen att kontakta Agaton Sjöberg, AI Tech Lead, på agaton.sjoberg@modularfinance.se.
 



  





 Vi kommer att svara på alla ansökningar.

title: Senior Backedn Engineer [TypeScript] (Prisma ORM)
description:
At Prisma, we are building the data layer for modern applications. If you are fascinated by the leading-edge architecture and technology used in today’s data-intensive, highly scalable software systems, with distributed graph data on a massive scale, but you want the energy, challenges, and freedom that come with working in a small startup, then a job at Prisma might be for you.
   

  

 With funding from top-tier investors Amplify Partners and Kleiner Perkins, we are a small distributed team working on making the advanced data infrastructure developed at large tech companies accessible to all application developers around the world. Our hard work is paying off, with adoption and implementation of Prisma by some of the most successful and interesting companies out there today, and the fun is just beginning!
   

  

 At Prisma, we’re redefining how developers work with databases. If you’re fascinated by the cutting-edge data infrastructure powering companies like Twitter, Airbnb, and Facebook, but want the agility, ownership, and impact of a fast-moving startup, then Prisma is the place for you.
   

  

 Backed by top-tier Silicon Valley investors like Amplify Partners, Kleiner Perkins, and IVP, our small, distributed team is making advanced database technology accessible to developers everywhere. Our open-source tools are trusted by over 400,000 developers each month, with a thriving community on Discord and GitHub, where we’ve earned 43,000+ GitHub Stars.
   

  

 At the heart of our commercial offerings is Prisma Postgres, our flagship product designed to supercharge PostgreSQL with modern developer workflows, performance optimizations, and seamless scaling. Alongside it, Prisma Accelerate, and Studio, provide a world-class tookit for building with data.
   

  

 By combining the power of open-source with cutting-edge commercial solutions, we’re shaping the future of databases, one developer at a time.
   

  

 What would a Senior TypeScript Engineer at Prisma do?
   

  

 You Will Join a Team Of Skilled TypeScript Engineers Tackling Challenges Across The Stack To Deliver a Market-leading ORM. A Typical Day At Prisma Might Include
   

  

* Expanding the Prisma Client to support advanced database capabilities.
* 
+ Drive the process from technical design through implementation.
+ Continuously refine and harden the codebase to ensure stability, maintainability, and ease of contribution.

* Building new libraries and tools that serve as foundational components, both for our internal teams and for the developer community.
* Elevating the developer experience (DX) by shaping intuitive, high-quality tools that make database access a delight.
* Advancing TypeScript adoption by exploring and applying the latest language features, ensuring Prisma stays at the forefront of modern development.


 What does the candidate profile look like?
   

  

**Description**
**We believe that the right person will meet quite a few of the criteria below. If you don't fit the description perfectly, we'd still love to hear from you. Many of these can be learnt on the job:**
* 5+ years of professional experience as a Senior Software Engineer (or equivalent senior-level role) with a proven track record of delivering production-grade systems.
* Deep backend engineering expertise with JavaScript and TypeScript, writing clean, maintainable, and scalable codebases.
* Strong database proficiency:
* 
+ Hands-on experience with high-scale, data-intensive systems.
+ Skilled at query optimization, diagnosing performance bottlenecks, and managing indexes.
+ Direct experience tuning databases for reliability and speed in demanding environments.

* Excellent English communication skills, both written and verbal; able to express complex technical concepts with clarity.
* A mindset of continuous learning and feedback: proactively seek input, adapt quickly, and embrace collaboration.
* Team-oriented approach: value pairing, mentoring, and proactively supporting peers.
* Passion for building outstanding developer experience through sustainable, well-tested tools and infrastructure that empower developers and improve workflows.


 Nice-to-Have Skills
   

  

* Contributions to open source projects (as maintainer or active contributor).
* Experience with systems-level programming languages (e.g., C, C++, Go, Zig, or others) and an interest in low-level performance optimization.
* Experience with edge computing platforms (e.g., Vercel Edge, Cloudflare Workers).
* Exposure to or curiosity about WebAssembly (WASM) and its applications in backend systems.


 What's it like to work at Prisma?
   

  

 You are likely to be a great for the team if you:
   

  

* have an ownership mindset. As part of a small team, you'll have an outsize impact on decisions and the way things are executed.
* stay nimble. As a growing startup, the team and strategy evolves quickly. Be ready to re-calibrate often and stay flexible.
* be kind and collaborative. Come in ready to share your ideas and listen to feedback.


 What's in it for you
   

  

* The opportunity to push the boundaries of DX and TypeScript within a fast-growing, early-stage startup with roots in Silicon Valley and Berlin.
* We provide a competitive base salary in line with industry standards for similar positions.
* As an early-stage startup we also provide competitive stock-option grants with a exercise window of up to 10 years.
* 24 days paid vacation per year.
* 4 mental health days per year.
* Fully paid parental leave up to 20 weeks.
* Generous tech budget to make sure you have all the hardware that you need.
* Ergonomic chair subsidy.
* Access to your local co-working space if you prefer to work from an external location to your home.
* [US] Health, Dental, Vision + 401k Matching.


 Remote Work
   

  

 We are a remote-first organisation with an office based in Berlin, Germany. Whether you would like to work remotely, or from the office in Berlin is up to you! We are open to discussing relocation assistance if you would like to join us in Berlin.
   

  

 To ensure effective collaboration we can currently only accept candidates within the timezone GMT -5 to GMT +3.
   

  

 What is the process like?
   

  

**Our Recruitment Process Roughly Follows The Structure Below**
* Introductory Call with your future manager.
* Take Home Assignment followed by a Technical Interview based on the solution you submitted.
* System Design Interview with a senior member of our engineering team.
* Interview with our Head of Engineering.
* Final Interview \*\*with our CEO.
* Offer


 What do I do now?
   

  

 If this sounds like an interesting opportunity, please apply via our website, and include your LinkedIn profile (or Resume), Github repos, or anything else that you think might give us a good sense of who you are.
   

  

 We will generally be in touch within 7 business days to let you know the outcome
   

  

**Prisma is an equal opportunity employer. We value and celebrate diversity and do not discriminate against any applicant on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, genetic information, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by applicable law. We are committed to creating a fair and inclusive workplace where all individuals have the opportunity to contribute their skills and talents. Applicants from all backgrounds are encouraged to apply.**

title: Platform Engineer - Developer Experience
description:
**TL;DR** 
 We are seeking a Platform Engineer to enhance and scale Lovable's developer experience. In this role, you will be responsible for critical components of our stack, ensuring our engineering workflows are faster, smoother, and more
 **Lovable** 
 .
   

  

**Why Lovable?**
 Lovable lets anyone and everyone build software with plain English. From solopreneurs to Fortune 100 teams, millions of people use Lovable to transform raw ideas into real products - fast. We are at the forefront of a foundational shift in software creation, which means you have an unprecedented opportunity to change the way the digital world works. Over 2 million people in 200+ countries already use Lovable to launch businesses, automate work, and bring their ideas to life. And we’re just getting started.
   

  

 We’re a small, talent-dense team building a generation-defining company from Stockholm. We value extreme ownership, high velocity and low-ego collaboration. We seek out people who care deeply, ship fast, and are eager to make a dent in the world.
   

  

**What We’re Looking For**
* You have strong programming skills and a track record of improving developer velocity and system reliability.
* 7+ years of experience working in a platform team supporting developer experience (o11y, CI/CD, application frameworks, productivity tooling, etc).
* You’ve written code and tools to support growing engineering orgs in scale-ups.
* You have experience with Docker, Kubernetes and modern infrastructure practices.
* You’re a problem-solver who thrives on challenges and ships high-leverage systems fast.
* You’re comfortable navigating ambiguity and solving problems as they arise.
* You care about security, stability, and speed and know when to make trade-offs between them.
* You’re based in Stockholm or ready to relocate - this is an on-site, 5-days-a-week role.


**What You’ll Do**
**In one sentence:** 
 Own and scale the developer experience at Lovable, making our engineering teams the most productive in the world.
   

  

* Bring order and structure to our code base.
* Integrate or build application frameworks to support a growing engineering organization and code footprint
* Own and develop our observability stack, from code instrumentation through ingestion to presentation.
* Integrating tools for AI driven development.
* Identify and drive reliability improvement efforts across all engineering teams.


**Our tech stack**
 We're building with tools that both humans and AI love. Lovable platform engineers are capable of working across the whole stack. Examples of tech in our stack include:
   

  

* Frontend: React and Typescript.
* Backend: Golang and Rust.
* Cloud: Cloudflare, GCP, AWS, Modal.
* Data: Clickhouse, Firestore, Spanner, BigQuery.
* DevOps Tooling: CI/CD pipelines, OTEL, Grafana, kubernetes, terraform.
* Local Tooling: Nix, DevEnv.


 And always on the lookout for what's next!
   

  

**About Your Application**
* Please submit your application in English - it’s our company language so you’ll be speaking lots of it if you join
* We treat all candidates equally - if you’re interested please apply through our careers portal

title: Experienced Backend Developer - Tracking Information Team, Solna
description:
*Are you ready to make an impact on millions of lives every day? Join us at PostNord, where your work will help shape the future of logistics across the Nordics!*
*In our team, we build and run the central event manager - the engine that handles millions of events every day. What we do is at the heart of PostNord’s digital ecosystem, enabling everything from parcel tracking to future innovations. We care deeply about quality, ownership, and making life easier for our users - whether they’re customers, colleagues, or developers in other teams. You’ll join a group of curious, collaborative people who enjoy solving real problems together.*
**Be part of the Tracking Information Team**
* We deliver services that impact millions of customers and recipients in the Nordics daily, ensuring they are accessible through platforms like our website and the PostNord app.
* You’ll help build backend solutions that keep things running smoothly for millions of people — making deliveries more reliable and everyday life a little easier, one package at a time. We care about quality and user experience, and you’ll play a key role in making sure our systems live up to that.
* We develop microservices in Kubernetes.
* Our infrastructure is hosted on AWS.
* We prioritize quality and robustness in our deliveries, as they directly affect our customers.
* We take full ownership of our services—from design and development to security, monitoring, and business metrics. With DevOps, we ensure quality at every step.
* We deploy multiple times a week, seeing the value of our work immediately.
* Our team takes responsibility for optimizing our work processes, using practices like mob and pair programming to enhance collaboration, quality, and collective knowledge.
* We collaborate closely with IT teams at PostNord, as well as production units, management, customers, and partners, to capture requirements and ensure our deliveries meet expectations. We’re passionate about what we do, and we want you to join us in shaping the future of logistics!


 ,
   

  

**Who are you?**
 You're a developer with a solid foundation — whether that comes from formal studies or hands-on experience - and you're always looking to grow. You like solving real and complex problems, working in agile teams, and building things that actually help people.
   

  

* You’re into backend development and curious about building robust systems with a great user experience.
* You’re interested in cloud technologies (like AWS) and Java is one of your go-to languages — or one you’re excited to learn more about.
* You take ownership of what you build — from first commit to production and beyond.
* You’re driven by making everyday life simpler for customers, colleagues, and users.


 You’re someone who communicates clearly and openly — whether it’s in code reviews, standups, or just helping a teammate out.
   

  

**Valuable Skills And Experience**
**AWS:** 
 Sound/Basic experience with AWS components such as DynamoDB, Lambda, S3 bucket and CDK/Cloudformation. SQS/Kinesis will be bonus.
   

  

**What we value:** 
 Hands-on experience is great, but a willingness to learn and build serverless solutions is just as important.
   

  

**Java:** 
 We work with Java 21/SE+ and Spring Boot, and we emphasize writing stable, well-tested code.
   

  

**What we value:** 
 Basic knowledge is essential, and we’ll support you in deepening your expertise. Good understanding of Java 21+ and Spring Boot for developing backend applications. I am eager to learn and grow skills for developing cloud native applications using AWS.
   

  

 Kafka (or real data streaming tools) will be bonus
   

  

**Github/Docker and (AWS EKS):** 
 These tools help us scale and orchestrate our applications.
   

  

**What we value:** 
 Some familiarity is helpful, but not required—we’ll help you get up to speed.
   

  

 Basic knowledge will suffice from the task completion via code development till production deployment
   

  

**REST API Services And OpenAPI Documentation (aka Swagger)**
 We use REST APIs and Swagger for defining and documenting secure web services.
   

  

**What we value:** 
 If you’ve worked with APIs before, great! If not, we’ll guide you through it.
   

  

**Prometheus And Grafana**
 Monitoring and visualization tools that help us ensure performance and reliability.
   

  

**What we value** 
 : No prior experience needed—we’ll provide on-the-job training.
   

  

 Knowledge of prometheus/grafana will be bonus
   

  

 You’ve probably studied something like Computer Science or Information Systems — or maybe you’ve picked up your skills in other ways. What matters most is that you know your stuff. You’re comfortable communicating in both Swedish and English, whether it’s in writing or in conversation.
   

  

**What We Offer**
* Step into a dynamic hybrid workplace where collaboration, creativity, and innovation are at the heart of everything we do.
* Grow with us! We support your development with opportunities for career advancement—including sponsorship for AWS certifications.
* Feel secure with comprehensive insurance and pension plans that have you covered.
* Stay healthy and energized with a wellness allowance to Arkens gym and pool.
* Enjoy exclusive perks through PostNord Plus, giving you access to a wide range of employee benefits.


**Making everyday life easier**
 PostNord is the leading provider of communication and logistics solutions to, from, and within the Nordics. We ensure postal services for individuals and businesses in Sweden and Denmark. Our goal is to make everyday life simpler and more sustainable for everyone in the Nordics.
   

  

 We are accountable, courageous, and committed, effectively leading change for ourselves and others. We value teamwork, honesty, and positive relationships in the workplace. By embracing diversity, we create better outcomes for the business.
   

  

**Apply Now**
 What are you waiting for? Take the next step in your career and join us in creating extraordinary solutions for millions across the Nordics! Selections and interviews are conducted on an ongoing basis, so apply as soon as possible. If you have any questions about the position, feel free to email robert.svensson-eshraghi@postnord.com

title: Senior Automotive Function Developer – 14138
description:
**Assignment Description:** 




 We are looking for a Senior Automotive Function Developer to join our dynamic team.
 



  





**What you will work on:** 



* Develop advanced vehicle functions for energy optimization, including smart cruise controllers and related systems.
* Identify and design new functionalities to enhance energy efficiency in trucks and buses.
* Implement and validate innovative solutions through both simulation and real-vehicle testing.
* Conduct vehicle tests in real-world and simulated environments to ensure functionality and performance.
* Take ownership of the full development lifecycle — from concept and implementation to documentation, testing, and evaluation.



  





**What you bring:** 



* Strong passion for the automotive industry and interest in vehicle energy optimization.
* Master’s or PhD degree in a relevant engineering discipline.
* Experience in embedded software development, preferably with MATLAB, Simulink, and C.
* Skills in simulation, modelling, and data analysis are advantageous.
* Driver’s license for passenger cars (required)

title: Senior Fullstack/Webb-utvecklare
description:
**Om företaget** 




 Vi är Delorean, en prisbelönt digital byrå som hjälper företag och organisationer att utveckla innovativa strategier, digitala tjänster och kreativa kommunikationslösningar. Vi är stolt vinnare av Årets Digitala Byrå 2024 och har ett härligt gäng medarbetare som brinner för att skapa digital framgång. Vi har en stark teamkänsla där du får vara med och påverka både din egen arbetssituation och företaget. Vi tror på att lära oss tillsammans och utvecklas med nya tekniker som kommer. Vi jobbar bland annat med kunder som 7-Eleven, Pressbyrån, Vogue Scandinavia, Nationalmuseum och Statens Konstråd.
 



  





**Om tjänsten** 




 Vi söker nu efter senior fullstack-utvecklare.
 



  





 Arbetsuppgifterna varierar mycket. Vi jobbar med flera lite större utvecklingsprojekt som ofta har en digital affär. Men vi skapar även kundspecifika verktyg, andra CMS-baserade lösningar, datadrivna prestandaförbättringar med mer.
 



 Vi värdesätter en glad personlighet och ett stort intresse för webbutveckling. Ägnar du dessutom en del av din fritid till att förbättra din kompetens och undersöka nya ramverk och tekniker har vi mycket gemensamt.
 



 Vår teknikfilosofi är att använda rätt verktyg till det utmaningen kräver. Därför är vi inte rädda att både testa och utvärdera nya tekniker, samt att implementera dessa i skarpa projekt. Vi undviker att välja verktyg enbart på popularitet eller gammal vana.
 



 De flesta av våra projekt är headless i React där det finns en eller flera backends i Node, PHP eller .Net
 



 Det som är viktigt för oss är inte att du är fullärd, utan att du har en positiv attityd och ett intresse för att lära dig nya saker.
 



  





**Din roll i teamet** 



* Programmera front- och backend.
* Ansvara för och driva olika webbprojekt.
* Ta fram tekniska strategier och koncept med vårt team av utvecklare, UX:are och projektledare.
* Ha kundkontakt och svara på frågor relaterade till projekten.
* Ha code reviews med utvecklingsteamet.
* Pratar och skriver svenska flytande, då detta ett krav från våra kunder.



  





**Vi tror du har erfarenhet av** 



* Minst 5+ års erfarenhet av fullstack webb/app-utveckling
* Någon form av backend-programmering, exempelvis något av: .NET, Node.js, PHP, Python, Ruby, Go, C#.
* HTML, CSS och JavaScript.
* Versionshantering i GIT.
* JavaScript-frameworks så som React, Angular, Vue
* Att utveckla integrationer och kopplingar till andra system via API:er.



  





**Extra meriterande** 



* Umbraco, Episerver / Optimizely
* Bra koll på Devops-relaterade verktyg och processer, Nginx, Docker, CI-lösningar osv.
* Wordpress
* Erfarenhet av Google Cloud Platform
* Erfarenhet av GraphQL
* SASS/LESS eller liknande-CSS preprocessors.
* Erfarenhet av funktionell programmering.
* Erfarenhet av Google Tag Manager, Google Analytics, DataStudio, Optimize.



  





**Varför ska du jobba på Delorean?** 




 När du jobbar hos oss kan vi bland annat erbjuda följande:
 


* Vi är kollektivanslutna: För dig innebär det att du garanteras bra villkor och att saker som betald föräldraledighet, semester, tjänstepension, rätt till löneförhöjning och mycket mer är självklarheter.
* Du får tjänstepension: En vacker dag går du i pension. Som kollektivanslutet företag betalar vi in till din tjänstepension från att du fyllt 25 år.
* Du får friskvårdsbidrag: Alla som jobbar hos oss ska få de bästa förutsättningarna för att hålla sig friska och krya. Vi erbjuder bidrag på 5000 kr per år som du kan använda till din personliga träning.
* Kompetensutveckling och delaktighet: Vi har regelbundna medarbetarsamtal samt tar fram individuella utvecklingsplaner. Och vi vill att våra medarbetare är med och påverkar både arbetsplats och hur vi arbetar.



  





 Välkommen att skicka in din ansökan!

title: Shopify Lead Developer
description:
**About Lybe** 




 We are a team of seasoned e-commerce consultants headquarters in Stockholm (Sweden), transforming the e-commerce landscape with innovative solutions and cutting-edge technology. Our goals are set high, and we offer a friendly, open and including work environment where everyone's opinion counts. Our culture is driven by high ambition, and you will be expected to have the same high dedication to provide seamless online shopping experiences for our customers as your co-workers have.
 



  





 Join our dynamic team and help us unlock the full potential of digital commerce!
 



  





**Job Description** 




 We are looking for a skilled and passionate Shopify Developer to join our development team in
 
 Stockholm
 
 or
 
 Lisbon
 
 . You will be an essential part of our strategy to grow our business with B2B projects on Shopify Plus. You will be developing, maintaining, and optimizing our client's project on Shopify and Shopify Plus. This role requires a strong blend of front-end development expertise, deep knowledge of the Shopify ecosystem, and a commitment to performance and code quality. Our ambition is to find a candidate that will set the standards of this role and be a key piece in a growing Shopify development team.
 



  





**What We Offer:** 



* Environment with experienced developers that will push you to grow as a professional
* Competitive salary, benefits & time for self-development.
* Opportunity to work on exciting and challenging projects.
* Flexible working hours and remote work options.
* Professional growth and development opportunities.
* A collaborative and inclusive work environment.
* Yearly "workation" where we get together in a city around the world.



  





**Key Responsibilities:** 



* Design, develop, and maintain custom Shopify themes and functionality using Liquid, HTML, CSS (Sass/SCSS), and JavaScript.
* Continuously optimize site speed, mobile responsiveness, and overall site performance to meet Core Web Vitals and enhance SEO.
* Integrate and manage third-party apps, APIs, and services (e.g., ERP, payment gateways, marketing tools) to extend store capabilities.
* Work closely with our UI/UX designers and marketing team to translate design mockups and business requirements into flawless, user-friendly features.
* Identify, diagnose, and resolve technical issues, bugs, and platform-related problems across all areas of the e-commerce platform.
* Uphold coding standards, participate in code reviews, and maintain clean, well-documented, and scalable codebases using Git for version control.
* Stay current with Shopify platform updates, e-commerce best practices, and emerging web technologies to recommend and implement innovative solutions.



  





**Requirements:** 



* Experience: 6+ years of proven experience as a Shopify Developer, specifically working on high-volume e-commerce stores.
* Experience with Shopify Plus and custom checkout/scripts.
* Experience developing and maintaining private or public Shopify Apps.
* Expert proficiency with the Shopify platform, including the Admin interface, theme structure, and key objects/APIs.
* Strong, demonstrable experience with Liquid, Shopify's templating language.
* Mastery of core web technologies: HTML5, CSS3, JavaScript (ES6+), and modern front-end frameworks (e.g., jQuery, React, or Vue.js exposure is a plus).
* Experience consuming and working with the Shopify Storefront API and Admin API (REST/GraphQL).
* Comfortable using Git/GitHub/GitLab in a team environment.
* Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills with meticulous attention to detail.
* Strong verbal and written communication skills to collaborate effectively with technical and non-technical team members.



  





**Preferred Qualifications:** 



* Familiarity with modern tooling like Webpack, Gulp, or Shopify CLI.
* Knowledge of accessibility standards (WCAG) and SEO best practices.
* Experience with other e-commerce platforms (e.g., BigCommerce, Magento).



  





**How to apply** 




 If you feel like you are a good match for this position, please apply and attach your
 **resume** 
 and a
 **cover letter.**

title: Senior Golang Developer
description:
**This is Coody**
 We’re one of Sweden’s fastest-growing tech consultancies, expanding in both people and revenue. We attribute our growth to our simple yet powerful approach to Gravity-Free Consulting, combining the freedom and flexibility of freelancing with the security of traditional employment.
   

  

 At Coody, we believe in freedom, trust, and ambition, which means you’ll feel like a freelancer with free rein on assignments that excite you, while enjoying the benefits of being employed by a company that invests in your growth.
   

  

 Our senior sales team has built a vast, carefully curated client network, enabling our consultants to work with some of the most innovative companies in Sweden, Finland, the US, and the UK across Gaming, Fintech, Medtech, AI, SaaS, Aviation, and Automotive, tackling real technical challenges while shaping their own career paths.
   

  

 We’re a
 **diverse community of ambitious tech professionals** 
 , representing more than
 **14 nationalities** 
 .
   

  

**Coody is more of a** 
**platform than a traditional consultancy** 
 . Everything we do is designed to help you work and live according to your own priorities and ambitions. If you’re curious to see how this works in practice,
 **explore our Employee Handbook** 
 and discover a company that truly puts consultants first.
   

  

**Why Coody**
 At Coody, we cut out everything unnecessary to give more back to you as a consultant. And we have done it in the package of a lean and efficient organization, meaning no overpaid managers, no fancy offices and no extravagant conferences. Instead we give you:
   

  

**Maximized Compensation.** 
 Typically a +40% salary increase.
   

  

**Freedom & Flexibility** 
 . No bosses. All digital. Fully remote for those who prefer.
   

  

**Employment Security.** 
 Fixed salary, pension, insurance, paid vacation and a big educational fund.
   

  

**Shape the Future.** 
 Projects and assignments for digital game changers like Spotify, Hemnet, Visa, Tobii, Toca Boca, Mojang, Flightradar24, SJ, and exciting startups and scaleups.
   

  

**What You’ll Be Doing**
 As a
 **Senior Golang Developer** 
 at Coody, you’ll help build and scale new and existing products with real end-to-end ownership of the service, the code, and the outcomes. Assignments are typically 6–24 months, and as a consultant you’re expected to ramp up quickly and deliver value from day one. While your home base is Go, you’ll sometimes work across the full tech stack (e.g., frontend, integrations, cloud infrastructure, CI/CD, data flows) to ship complete solutions. You’ll design and build scalable, robust applications in cloud environments, contribute to architecture and testing/automation, and play an active role in a high-trust, high-performing team.
   

  

 Who you are
   

  

 We are seeking a
 **Golang Developer with at least 4+ years of experience** 
 . You must have a proven ability to get things done. Here’s what we’re seeking:
   

  

* 4+ years of experience using Golang
* A cloud native background using Docker, Kubernetes, CI/CD, AWS / GCP / Azure and Terraform - or such.
* Skills and experience from additional tech stacks and tools are appreciated.
* A degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, or a related field.
* Based in Sweden: You must have Swedish citizenship, a valid work visa, or permanent residency.
* Fluent in English (spoken and written).


 How to apply
   

  

 Are you excited to take your career to the next level and meet the criterias? Apply now, and we'll be in touch shortly.

title: Sr Software Engineer – Build the Future of Health with Apotea | Stockholm
description:
**Senior Software Engineer – Build the Future of Health with Apotea 🚀**
 At
 **Apotea** 
 , Sweden’s leading online pharmacy, we’re reshaping how healthcare reaches people — smarter, faster, and more sustainably. Every system we optimize and every line of code we write brings us closer to a society where better health is accessible for everyone.
   

  

 Now, we’re looking for a
 **Senior Software Engineer** 
 to take a leading role in developing and scaling the systems that power our entire operation — from seamless customer experiences to world-class logistics.
   

  

 This isn’t a role for someone who wants “just another dev job.” This is your chance to be part of a purpose-driven tech journey where your impact goes far beyond code.
   

  

**💡 Why this role matters**
 At Apotea, technology isn’t a support function — it’s our competitive edge. You’ll be joining the
 **core of Apoteas tech team** 
 , where uptime, performance, and innovation meet real-world impact. You’ll help us design and evolve the complex systems that keep millions of deliveries moving, pharmacies stocked, and customers cared for every single day.
   

  

 As a Senior Software Engineer, you’ll lead by doing — combining deep technical skill with curiosity, initiative, and collaboration.
   

  

**👩‍💻 What You’ll Do**
**Design, build, and evolve** 
 high-performance systems that keep Apotea running at scale.
   

  

**Lead technical direction** 
 within projects and mentor other developers through complex problem-solving.
   

  

**Drive innovation** 
 through automation, modernization, and new integrations — from logistics partners to sister companies.
   

  

**Collaborate across teams** 
 to bridge business needs and technical execution.
   

  

**Strengthen reliability and scalability** 
 across our .NET ecosystem — keeping millions of transactions flowing seamlessly.
   

  

**Shape the future** 
 of Apotea’s tech landscape — your ideas will influence how we grow.
   

  

**🧠 Who You Are**
 You’re an experienced engineer who loves tackling complexity and turning it into clarity. You thrive in fast-paced environments where real impact is visible every day. You’re both hands-on and strategic — equally comfortable writing elegant .NET code as you are leading architectural discussions.
   

  

**You’ll Fit Right In If You**
* Write clean, maintainable C#/.NET code with a focus on performance and scalability.
* Understand system architecture, distributed systems, and data flow in complex environments.
* Have strong problem-solving and debugging skills — you stay calm under pressure and focused on solutions.
* Enjoy mentoring, sharing knowledge, and lifting others around you.
* Communicate effectively across technical and non-technical teams.


**🌟 Extra kudos if you bring**
 Experience in
 **logistics, e-commerce, or ERP/WMS systems** 
 .
   

  

 Familiarity with
 **cloud infrastructure** 
 ,
 **DevOps** 
 , or automation tools.
   

  

 A background in
 **integration projects** 
 or migration work.
   

  

 Swedish language skills — a plus, not a must.
   

  

**What Apotea Offers You**
 ✨ A role where your code impacts millions of people.
   

  

 ✨ The chance to work in Sweden’s most sustainable e-commerce company.
   

  

 ✨ An agile, flat organization where ideas matter more than titles.
   

  

 ✨ Growth opportunities: training, mentorship, and conferences.
   

  

 ✨ A collaborative, transparent culture where your voice counts.
   

  

 ✨ A meaningful mission – making healthcare more accessible while caring for the planet.
   

  

**❤️ About Apotea**
 Apotea.se is Sweden’s largest online pharmacy, with the country’s broadest range of over 32,000 non-prescription items and over 19,000 prescription drugs for humans and animals. Recognized as Sweden’s most sustainable e-commerce company (Sustainable Brand Index 2021), we simplify everyday life for our customers with fast deliveries and expert advice. In 2024, Apotea reached a turnover of SEK 6.5 billion and currently employs about 1,000 people across Stockholm, Årsta, Lidingö, Morgongåva and Varberg.
   

  

 Follow us on social media to stay up to date on everything that's happening at Apotea
   

  

 LinkedIn
   

  

 Instagram
   

  

 Apotea is an inclusive employer that values diversity. We welcome all applicants and strive to create a work environment where people, regardless of background, gender, age, religion, or disability, can thrive and grow.
   

  

**Recruitment process**
* Apply
* Screening interview
* Technical interview
* Culture fit interview
* Background check (mandatory in pharmacy industry)
* Offer 🎉


 📍 Location: Sveavägen 168, Stockholm
   

  

 🏢 Work model: We work on-site
   

  

 👤 Reports to: Head of IT Operations
   

  

**Ready to join the journey?**
 Don’t wait – interviews happen continuously, and the role may be filled quickly. Apply today and be part of building something bigger than just software.
   

  

*Welcome to Apotea – where technology meets health, and your work creates real change.*
 Apotea är Sveriges största nätapotek med fokus på hållbarhet och snabba leveranser. Vår logistik är hjärtat i verksamheten, och vi har som mål att bli Nordens största apotek och Sveriges mest hållbara företag. Tillsammans med våra kunder har vi samlat in över 100 miljoner kronor till välgörenhet, och vi fortsätter att växa varje år – med våra medarbetare som den drivande kraften bakom framgången.

title: Backend-utvecklare
description:
Vi har nu ett nytt behov och söker därför en konsultkollega med nedan kvalifikationer. Tjänsten är en del av vår konsultverksamhet vilket innebär att du blir anställd av oss och arbetar hos kund alt. interna projekt och åtaganden.
   

  

**Utbildning och erfarenhet:**
* Minst 5 års erfarenhet av att arbeta som .NET-utvecklare.
* Bör ha en kandidatexamen inom datavetenskap, mjukvaruteknik eller relaterat område.
* Certifieringar inom .NET-utveckling är önskvärt.
* Finansiell eller regulatorisk erfarenhet är meriterande.
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta i Agile/Scrum-liknande miljöer.


**Teknisk kompetens:**
 Mycket stark kunskap och erfarenhet av
   

  

* C# och .NET Core/Framework
* ASP.NET Core/MVC
* Visual Studio
* T-SQL, SSMS
* CI/CD pipelines
* RESTful APIs
* Git


**Meriterande**
* QA/Test
* System Migration
* Dynatrace, Splunk
* Octopus Deploy, TFS, Azure DevOps
* xUnit/NUnit
* WCF
* EF, Dapper, LINQ
* JWT, IdentityServer
* React, NextJS, JavaScript
* Solace, Docker, S3 Storage Grid
* Event Driven Architecture
* Domain Driven Design


**Sista ansökningdatum:** 
 17-11-2025
   

  

**Om Oss**
 Att jobba på Deploja är något helt annat än att arbeta på ett vanligt konsultbolag – och det är vi riktigt stolta över. Vad är det då som gör oss unika?
   

  

 Vi erbjuder helt enkelt mer än bara hög lön och större frihet, det är bara början. Hos oss hittar du den arbetsmiljö och de möjligheter du förtjänar. Här påverkar du din egen lön som helt och hållet som baseras på ditt timpris mot kund.
   

  

 Vår lönemodell är en hybridlösning mellan en fast månadslön och en provisionsbaserad ersättning. Det innebär att din månadslön baseras på ditt timpris, fast om du mot förmodan skulle stå utan uppdrag så behåller du en grund lön fram tills vi hittat ett nytt uppdrag, bra va?
   

  

**Vi erbjuder dig följande, Valet är ditt!**
 🚀 Spännande uppdrag hos våra många kunder. Vi fokuserar på långsiktiga uppdrag, vilket ger dig möjlighet att skapa värde för kunden samtidigt som du utvecklas själv.
   

  

 🌟 En trygg månadslön – tillsammans bestämmer vi en grundlön baserad på dina uppdrag.

title: Systemutvecklare
description:
Vi har nu ett nytt behov och söker därför en konsultkollega med nedan kvalifikationer. Tjänsten är en del av vår konsultverksamhet vilket innebär att du blir anställd av oss och arbetar hos kund alt. interna projekt och åtaganden.
   

  

**Rollen:**
* Leder design och utveckling av komplexa backend-lösningar i Java/Spring Boot.
* Bygger och vidareutvecklar API:er och mikrotjänster med fokus på prestanda, säkerhet och tillgänglighet.
* Skapar och vidareutvecklar en robust arkitektur som binder samman frontend, BFF och backend-tjänster, med tydliga gränssnitt och skalbarhet i fokus.
* Cochar, stöttar och inspirerar kollegor för att höja teamets tekniska nivå.
* Säkerställer stabil drift genom monitorering och incidenthantering.
* Driver förbättringar i arkitektur, kodkvalitet och metodik.
* Bidrar till teknisk strategi och samordning mellan team.
* Aktivt deltar och samarbetar tvärfunktionellt i en skalad agil miljö.


**Ska-krav:**
* Erfarenhet av att designa och bygga arkitektur som binder ihop front-end och backend-tjänster.
* Utveckling och arkitektur: Java, Spring Boot, API-utveckling, relationsdatabaser.
* Kunskap om molnteknik och infrastruktur: Azure PaaS, IaC, Kubernetes/Docker.
* Erfarenhet av DevOps/CI/CD, automatisering och dokumentation.
* Förmåga att leda tekniska initiativ, stötta teamet och coacha andra utvecklare.
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta i en skalad agil miljö (t.ex. SAFe eller motsvarande).
* Erfarenhet av .net


**Meriterande:**
* Betallösningar (t.ex. Swish, Paynova).
* Data och molntjänster (PostgreSQL, KQL, Azure PaaS).
* Test och metoder (JUnit, Cucumber, OSDM).


**Sista ansökningdag: 13-11-2025**
**Om Oss**
 Att jobba på Deploja är något helt annat än att arbeta på ett vanligt konsultbolag – och det är vi riktigt stolta över. Vad är det då som gör oss unika?
   

  

 Vi erbjuder helt enkelt mer än bara hög lön och större frihet, det är bara början. Hos oss hittar du den arbetsmiljö och de möjligheter du förtjänar. Här påverkar du din egen lön som helt och hållet som baseras på ditt timpris mot kund.
   

  

 Vår lönemodell är en hybridlösning mellan en fast månadslön och en provisionsbaserad ersättning. Det innebär att din månadslön baseras på ditt timpris, fast om du mot förmodan skulle stå utan uppdrag så behåller du en grund lön fram tills vi hittat ett nytt uppdrag, bra va?
   

  

**Vi erbjuder dig följande, Valet är ditt!**
 🚀 Spännande uppdrag hos våra många kunder. Vi fokuserar på långsiktiga uppdrag, vilket ger dig möjlighet att skapa värde för kunden samtidigt som du utvecklas själv.
   

  

 🌟 En trygg månadslön – tillsammans bestämmer vi en grundlön baserad på dina uppdrag.
   

  

 🚗 Tjänstebil – vi uppmuntrar dig att välja en elbil för en mer hållbar framtid.
   

  

 💼 Tjänstepension och stora möjligheter till löneväxling.
   

  

 🌴 Semester - Önskar du mer än 30 dagar semester, kanske 60 dagar?
   

  

 🏥 Privat sjukvårdsförsäkring, olycksfallsförsäkring och livförsäkring för ökad trygghet.
   

  

 📚 Kompetensutveckling – du får själv sätta din budget och välja vilka utbildningar du vill delta i.

title: Fullstack Utvecklare
description:
**Vi söker en vass och erfaren fullstackutvecklare.** 




  





 Memlist befinner sig i en spännande och expansiv fas och vi söker nu en fullstackutvecklare som vill vara med och stärka vårt utvecklingsteam.
 



  





**Om oss** 




 Memlist Medlemssystem är ett verksamhetssystem som används av tusentals organisationer. Systemet hanterar bland annat:
 


* Medlemsbetalningar och aviseringar
* Nyhetsbrev, kommunikation och SMS
* Dynamiska och anpassningsbara enkäter
* Verktyg för myndighetsrapportering (till exempel E-hälsomyndigheten, Försäkringskassan, MUCF och Skatteverket)
* Skräddarsydda rapporter, import- och exportverktyg
* Kundspecifika anpassningar
* Medlemskortsappar för iOS och Android



  





 Läs mer om våra funktioner på memlist.se
 



  





 Vi arbetar ständigt med kontinuerlig förbättring och söker dig som trivs i en miljö där förändring, flexibilitet och eget ansvar är en naturlig del av vardagen.
 



  





**Dina arbetsuppgifter** 




 Som utvecklare hos oss kommer du att:
 


* Arbeta i ett agilt team och vara en ambassadör för effektiva och moderna arbetsmetoder
* Utforma, dokumentera och implementera utvecklingsprocesser
* Ta egna initiativ och bidra med värdeskapande idéer
* Vara lyhörd för våra kunder och komma med konkreta lösningsförslag
* Skriva tydlig, välstrukturerad och fungerande kod
* Konfigurera miljöer i
 **Linux**
* Administrera och utveckla databaser i
 **SQL**
* Optimera källkod och identifiera brister eller teknisk skuld
* Utveckla frontend i
 **Vue.js**
* Utveckla backend i
 **Node.js / TypeScript**
* Bidra med djup förståelse för systemutveckling, mikrotjänstarkitektur och moderna verktyg
* Utvärdera och föreslå nya verktyg med för- och nackdelsanalys
* Arbeta med CSS och återanvända befintliga komponenter effektivt
* Följa definierade
 **SDLC-principer**
* Vara en konstruktiv och positiv teamspelare som bidrar till en god teamkänsla
* Känna sig trygg i både nyutveckling och underhåll av befintlig kod



  





**Kvalifikationer** 



* Minst
 **5 års erfarenhet av Node.js**
* Minst
 **3 års erfarenhet av SQL**
* Minst
 **5 års erfarenhet av agila metoder**
* Examen från
 **universitet eller högskola** 
 (ej yrkeshögskola) inom
 **systemutveckling eller motsvarande område**



  





**Meriterande** 



* Certifiering inom Azure DevOps
* Certifiering inom Linux säkerhet, administratör eller liknande
* Utveckling inom React Native för iOS och Android
* Erfarenhet inom ISO 27001 certifiering
* Erfarenhet inom ISO 9001 certififering
* Erfarenheter inom säkerhet
* Tillgänglighetsanpassning
* Intresse eller involvering inom idéella verksamheter och föreningar

title: SQL-utvecklare
description:
**Att jobba som SQL-utvecklare**
 Här blir du en del av ett team på 11 drivna kollegor – SQL- och .Net-utvecklare, testare, mjukvaruarkitekt, systemansvarig, product owner och teamcoach – som tillsammans bygger smarta lösningar för att ge våra kunder den bästa möjliga upplevelsen. Vi arbetar nära både IT och verksamheten och ser till att rätt data finns på rätt plats i rätt tid.
   

  

**Om Rollen**
* Utveckla och förvalta effektiva lösningar för datainsamling och kundkommunikation.
* Vara en nyckelspelare i hela kedjan – från databas till verksamheten som jobbar med datan.
* Arbeta i en hybridmiljö med balans mellan kontoret på Kungsholmen och distansarbete.


**För att lyckas i rollen**
* Några års erfarenhet av MSSQL och stora databaser.
* Vana vid SSIS-projekt, integrationer och datatransformering.
* Stor erfarenhet av T-sql och skriva Stored Procedures.
* Kommunikativ, prestigelös och en lagspelare med eget driv.
* Flytande svenska, både i tal och skrift.


 Hos oss får du inte bara möjlighet att växa i din roll – du får också vara med och skapa långsiktigt värde för våra kunder och samhället.
   

  

**Vad händer nu?**
 Vi jobbar med löpande urval så tveka inte att skicka in din ansökan redan idag. I ansökan kommer vi att ställa ett antal urvalsfrågor som ligger till grund för första urvalet. För att göra rekryteringsprocessen så rättvis och objektiv som möjligt kommer det att ingå intervjuer, tester, bakgrundskontroll samt digital referenstagning.
   

  

 Om du har frågor kring rollen, vänligen kontakta rekryterande chef Fredrik Othberg på mailadress: fredrik.othberg@skandia.se
   

  

 Vi kommer att återkoppla till alla som söker oavsett om du går vidare eller inte.
   

  

 Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!
   

  

**Mer om IT**
 Vi på Skandia IT är stolta över att vara en kundorienterad enhet som levererar effektiva och säkra lösningar för våra kunder. Med cirka 600 engagerade medarbetare är vi mitt i en spännande transformationsresa, där vi utvecklas tillsammans och har kul på vägen. Framåt tillsammans är vårt motto!
   

  

 Vi arbetar agilt och har sedan 2017 använt oss av SAFe (Scaled Agile Framework) ramverket, där leverans och kundvärde alltid står i centrum. Våra tågledningar och team, jobbar verksamhetsbaserat med aktiviteter som sprintplanering, daily stand-ups, team-synk, code reviews och retrospektiv.
   

  

 Var 12:e vecka samlas vi alla i vår ljusa och inspirerande Ljusgård på kontoret i Stockholm för 2 planeringsdagar. Planeringsperioden består av 6 tvåveckorssprintar, där den sista sprinten är en innovationssprint. Här får du chansen att, själv eller tillsammans med ditt team, utveckla och förfina våra system.

title: Developer
description:
**Join our Team**
**About this opportunity:**
 Are you a recent graduate ready to dive into a world where innovation, cutting-edge technology, and teamwork come first? At Ericsson we accelerate product development with fresh thinking, challenge traditional workflows, and actively contribute to open-source communities. We combine the strength of a global company with a start-up mindset – and now we want you on our team!
   

  

 We are now looking for a Software Developer to join one of our development teams responsible for Carrier Resource Management, within Product Engineering Unit RU Software in Kista, Stockholm. This opportunity will provide experience in realizing Ericsson strategy of Openness and delivering RU software for ORAN architecture.
   

  

 Here, you’ll work in agile teams where everyone contributes their expertise and drives products from concept to delivery, with collaboration, creativity, and open communication as the keys to success.
   

  

 This is an opportunity to leverage upon your skills in AI to innovate, improve and evolve together with our products, software development practises, workflows, and mindset.
   

  

**What you will do:**
* Develop exciting new features.
* Maintain and improve existing products.
* Collaborate closely with stakeholders and other teams.
* Participate in creative meetings and brainstorming sessions.
* Document and share knowledge.
* Bring your own perspective and innovative ideas to the team.
* Work in an agile environment practicing CI/CD principles while participating in operational responsibilities.


**The skills you will bring:**
* Bachelor’s degree or Master's degree in Computer Science, Information & Communication Technology, or similar field.
* Good communication and collaboration skills.
* AI enthusiasm.
* Positive mindset, curiosity, and a can-do attitude.
* Programming skills (preferably in object-oriented languages such as C++, Java).


**Why join Ericsson?**
 At Ericsson, you´ll have an outstanding opportunity. The chance to use your skills and imagination to push the boundaries of what´s possible. To build solutions never seen before to some of the world’s toughest problems. You´ll be challenged, but you won’t be alone. You´ll be joining a team of diverse innovators, all driven to go beyond the status quo to craft what comes next.
   

  

**What happens once you apply?**
 Click Here to find all you need to know about what our typical hiring process looks like.
   

  

 Encouraging a diverse and inclusive organization is core to our values at Ericsson, that's why we champion it in everything we do. We truly believe that by collaborating with people with different experiences we drive innovation, which is essential for our future growth. We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply and realize their full potential as part of our Ericsson team. Ericsson is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. learn more.
   

  

**Primary country and city:** 
 Sweden (SE) || Stockholm
   

  

**Req ID:** 
 775866

title: App-utvecklare med backend/devops-kompetens
description:
Vi bygger inte ännu en budget-app. Vi ska ge alla människor full koll på sin ekonomi – och hjälpa till att förbättra den.
   

  

 Vi söker en utvecklare som vill vara med och bygga den tekniska grunden för en ny fintech-produkt som snart lanseras i beta på den svenska marknaden – med målet att snabbt skala i Europa.
   

  

 Produkten är byggd i React Native (Expo) med Firebase och Google Cloud Platform som backend, och använder open banking och AI för att hjälpa människor förstå och förbättra sin ekonomi.
   

  

 Du kommer att arbeta med att:
   

 – Driva app-utvecklingen framåt
   

 – Bygga och underhålla Firebase Cloud Functions i TypeScript/Node.js
   

 – Integrera Open Banking-API:er
   

 – Strukturera datamodeller i Firestore
   

  

 Vi söker dig som har:
   

 – Erfarenhet av Node.js och TypeScript
