title: Senior .NET-utvecklare med expertis inom AI och ML
description:
*Är du en passionerad utvecklare med en stark vilja att utforska och få till innovation med den senaste tekniken? Vi söker en erfaren utvecklare som vill vara en del av ett nydanande och explorativt team inom GenAI, Agenter och Maskininlärning. Om du är redo att ta nästa steg i din karriär och arbeta med banbrytande teknik, då är detta möjligheten för dig!*
**Om jobbet**
 I rollen som Senior .NET-utvecklare med expertis inom AI och ML kommer du att ha en nyckelroll i att forma och driva utvecklingen av våra tekniska lösningar. Du kommer att arbeta i en dynamisk miljö där innovation, snabbhet och kundfokus är i centrum. Ditt arbete kommer att vara både strategiskt och operativt, med ansvar för att säkerställa att våra system är robusta, skalbara och framtidssäkra.
   

  

 Hos oss får du möjlighet att utforska och implementera avancerade teknologier inom AI och maskininlärning, där särskilt fokus ligger på naturlig språkbehandling (NLP), utveckling av intelligenta system, chatbotar och språkmodeller. Du kommer även att arbeta med bildigenkänning och bidra till att skapa skräddarsydda AI-lösningar som kan revolutionera vår verksamhet.
   

  

 Du blir en viktig del i att bygga en affärsagil organisation där IT och affärsverksamhet samverkar för att leverera innovativa lösningar med hög kvalitet. Rollen innebär nära samarbete med andra utvecklingsteam för att säkerställa att våra lösningar hänger ihop i en helhet, både frontend och backend.
   

  

 Dina arbetsuppgifter kommer bland annat att vara:
   

  

* Fullstack-utveckling med .NET (version 8/9) för Azure
* Utveckling med C#
* Användning av React, TypeScript, microfrontend
* Testdriven/testfokuserad utveckling
* Integration med synkrona och asynkrona mönster
* Mjukvaruarkitektur
* Bygga och optimera CI/CD-pipelines med Azure och Azure DevOps
* Automation och användning av Bicep
* Utveckla och implementera avancerade AI-lösningar med fokus på NLP, intelligenta system och bildigenkänning
* Bygga och optimera chatbotar och språkmodeller
* Använda Python och dess ekosystem för att skapa skräddarsydda AI-lösningar
* Samarbeta med andra utvecklingsteam för att säkerställa en integrerad lösning mellan frontend och backend
* Delta i projekt som kombinerar IT och affärsverksamhet för att leverera innovativa lösningar med hög kvalitet


**Vem är du?**
 Vi söker dig som har erfarenhet av generativ AI och erfarhet av att ha deployat applikationer i produktion. Följande kommer göra dig framgångsrik i denna tjänst:
   

  

* Erfarenhet av fullstack-utveckling med .NET (version 8/9) för Azure
* Kunskaper i C#
* Erfarenhet av React, TypeScript, microfrontend
* Erfarenhet av testdriven/testfokuserad utveckling
* Erfarenhet av integration med synkrona och asynkrona mönster
* Kunskaper i mjukvaruarkitektur
* Erfarenhet av att bygga CI/CD-pipeline med Azure som målplattform
* Erfarenhet av automation
* Kunskaper i Bicep
* Erfarenhet inom Naturlig språkbehandling (NLP) och AI-utveckling.
* Erfarenhet av att bygga och implementera chatbotar och språkmodeller.
* Kunskaper inom bildigenkänning och relaterade AI-tekniker.


 Meriterande är även om du har:
   

  

* Erfarenhet av att leda utvecklingsteam operativt
* Försäkringskunskap
* Förståelse för försäkringsverksamhets behov av följsamhet mot regelverk
* Erfarenhet av AI/ML/NLP/Agenter
* Kunskaper i Langchain, Semantic Kernel, OpenAI Swarm eller motsvarande


 Som person är du drivande, resultatfokuserad och nyfiken. Du har förmåga att arbeta självständigt och i team, och du utmärker dig genom gott självledarskap och stark samarbetsförmåga. Du har ordning och reda och kan dokumentera på en lagom nivå.
   

  

**Om oss**
 Hos oss på Agria blir du en del av gruppen Kompetenscenter, där vi tillsammans skapar en arbetsmiljö som främjar trivsel, lärande och personlig utveckling. Kompetenscenter ansvarar för bemanning och kompetens i vår virtuella leveransorganisation, med skickliga utvecklare, produktägare, affärsanalytiker, kravledare, QA-testare och Scrum Masters. Vi arbetar på vårt nyrenoverade kontor på Gärdet i Stockholm, där vi erbjuder en flexibel arbetsmiljö för att balansera arbete och vardag.
   

  

 Vi erbjuder unika förmåner som aktiviteter med vår kamrat-, konst- eller idrottsförening, träning i vårt fullt utrustade gym, och god mat i vår personalrestaurang till subventionerat pris. Dessutom har vi ett hundkontor! Som en del av Länsförsäkringsgruppen får du även förmånliga bankerbjudanden, rabatter på djur- och sakförsäkringar och personlig pensionsrådgivning.
   

  

 Vi ser fram emot att välkomna dig till vårt team och tillsammans skapa trygghet för fler djur och dess ägare.
   

  

**Mer information**
*Låter det spännande? Då vill vi veta mer om dig! Välkommen med din ansökan redan idag. Vi arbetar löpande med denna rekrytering och kan komma att tillsätta tjänsten innan sista ansökningsdag.*
**Sista ansökningsdag: 2025-11-28**
*Välkommen till Agria Djurförsäkring – en plats där vi skapar trygghet för djur och människor. Allt vi gör, gör vi för djuren. Det genomsyrar hela vår medarbetarkultur och märks i alla beslut vi fattar. Vi tror på att människor med en genuin passion för djur är nyckeln till att förmedla vårt erbjudande och att upprätthålla våra mål, mission och löften.*
*Vi vill bidra till en kreativ och lärande miljö där du som vill utveckla dig själv och verksamheten ska kunna göra det. En miljö där vi som arbetsgivare ger dig rätt stöd och ledarskap. Tillsammans skapar vi en inkluderande arbetsplats att trivas i och vi välkomnar alla, oavsett bakgrund.*
*Agria växer i Europa och har idag verksamhet i Sverige, Norge, Finland, Danmark, Storbritannien, Tyskland, Frankrike och Irland. På Agria arbetar cirka 650 medarbetare. I koncernen ingår även dotterbolaget Agria Vård Guide som erbjuder digital veterinärrådgivning.*
*Var med oss på resan att skapa Europas största och mest valbara djurförsäkringsbolag för att skapa trygghet för fler djur och människor.*

title: Master Thesis: Explainable Conflict and Feasibility Resolution in Product Configuration via LLM
description:
**Join our Team**
**About this opportunity:**
 Configuring complex telecom products means encoding intricate business rules and technical constraints. At Ericsson, two complementary approaches are common:
 **SAP SSC** 
 for guided, stepwise selection of product‑defining characteristics, and a
 **constraint‑programming backend (e.g., MiniZinc)** 
 to solve sub‑problems and validate configurations. These systems can detect conflicts and infeasibilities—but operators and even configurators often lack
 **clear, actionable explanations** 
 for
 *why* 
 choices fail and
 *how* 
 to resolve them.
   

  

 This thesis explores how
 **large language models (LLMs)** 
 can augment existing conflict and feasibility resolution by leveraging
 **structured annotations** 
 attached to constraints and conflict events. The goal is to generate
 **accurate, context‑aware, and actionable** 
 explanations and prioritized resolution strategies—
 **without compromising solver correctness, privacy, or performance** 
 .
   

  

**What you will do:**
* Discovery & analysis: Map current conflict/feasibility mechanisms in SAP SSC and MiniZinc pipelines; catalog common conflict types and resolution patterns from historical logs or domain interviews.
* Annotation schema design: Define a lightweight, extensible JSON/YAML schema for constraint‑level and conflict‑event annotations (intent, provenance, user‑facing semantics, human‑readable labels, typical failure modes, resolution heuristics, severity/priority, affected features).
* Prototype pipeline: Build a mediator that collects solver outcomes (e.g., unsat cores, violated constraints, conflict sets), enriches them with annotations, and prompts an LLM to return faithful explanations and ranked next steps aligned with system state.
* Integration & data flow: Minimal integration with SSC guidance flows—on conflict, display an annotated explanation and ranked resolution strategies mapping back to SSC UI steps or characteristics.


 For MiniZinc, extract and align unsat cores/conflict sets with annotations.
   

  

* Evaluation:


*Faithfulness* 
 : expert review against ground‑truth constraints/conflict sets and counterfactual tests (flip a constraint; explanation must change accordingly).
   

  

*Usefulness* 
 : user study measuring task success rate, time‑to‑resolution, and perceived clarity (Likert scales).
   

  

*Efficiency/overhead* 
 : latency from annotations+LLM; apply caching/streaming.
   

  

*Robustness* 
 : ambiguous or multi‑cause conflicts.
   

  

* Guardrails & validation: Use an LLM library such as Guidance (or equivalent) to constrain outputs to schemas (e.g., JSON objects citing constraint IDs), apply runtime validators (JSON Schema/Pydantic), parse‑then‑verify with retry/repair loops, and CI checks—block unvalidated outputs from affecting SSC/MiniZinc state.
* Documentation & handover: Provide best‑practice guidelines, reference implementations, and a result presentation for the Ericsson team.


**The skills you bring:**
* Master’s studies in Computer Science, Data/AI, Software Engineering, or related fields.
* Python proficiency; experience with data modeling and APIs.
* Familiarity with constraint programming (MiniZinc/CP‑SAT/ILP) and/or business rule systems (e.g., SSC concepts).
* Understanding of LLM prompting/RAG and evaluation methods (human studies, faithfulness tests).
* Clear communication, structured experimentation, and documentation skills.
* Suitable for 1 or 2 students.


**Why join Ericsson?**
 At Ericsson, you´ll have an outstanding opportunity. The chance to use your skills and imagination to push the boundaries of what´s possible. To build solutions never seen before to some of the world’s toughest problems. You´ll be challenged, but you won’t be alone. You´ll be joining a team of diverse innovators, all driven to go beyond the status quo to craft what comes next.
   

  

**What happens once you apply?**
 Click Here to find all you need to know about what our typical hiring process looks like.
   

  

 Encouraging a diverse and inclusive organization is core to our values at Ericsson, that's why we champion it in everything we do. We truly believe that by collaborating with people with different experiences we drive innovation, which is essential for our future growth. We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply and realize their full potential as part of our Ericsson team. Ericsson is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. learn more.
   

  

**Primary country and city:** 
 Sweden (SE) || Stockholm

title: Observability Specialist
description:
**Job Description**
 De säger att "det är inte raketvetenskap." Vi håller inte med.
   

  

 Välkommen till SSC – Swedish Space Corporation, den perfekta arbetsplatsen för dig som brinner för teknik i allmänhet och rymden i synnerhet.
   

  

 Med rymdorganisationer, forskningsinstitut, institutionella och kommersiella aktörer som kunder, erbjuder vi specialistkompetens inom satellitkommunikation, rymdkonsulttjänster, raket- och ballongsystem, flygtesttjänster, framdrivningssystem för satelliter och mycket mer.
   

  

 SSC har dessutom ett av världens största globala nätverk av markstationer för satellitkommunikation. Vi äger och driver rymdbasen Esrange i Kiruna i norra Sverige, med sikte att i närtid kunna skjuta upp satelliter.
   

  

 Är du driven av en passion för människor och med ambitionen att skapa en fantastisk arbetsplats? Är du redo att ge dig ut på en spännande resa med oss för att hjälpa jorden att dra nytta av rymden?
   

  

 Om du svarar ja på dessa frågor, uppmanar vi dig att ta chansen att göra verklig skillnad som vår Observability Specialist.
   

  

 Vi söker en driven person som delar våra kärnvärden: Kundfokus, Omtanke, Samarbete, Nyfikenhet och Mod.
   

  

 På SSC är observability inte bara en lyx – det är avgörande. Våra system stödjer tidskritiska uppdrag och vetenskapliga operationer, och vi behöver full insyn för att säkerställa att de fungerar pålitligt och säkert.
   

  

 Vi söker nu en Observability Specialist som kan hjälpa oss att se allt från loggar, mätvärden och spårningar till alla dolda signaler som håller våra plattformar friska, både lokalt och i AWS. Det här är en unik möjlighet att ta ett helhetsgrepp om SSC:s övervakning genom att forma strategin, välja verktygen och bygga upp en modern observability-plattform som blir en gemensam tjänst för hela organisationen. Här får du stort inflytande över både teknik och arbetssätt, och en central roll i att bygga en funktion som används av både IT och våra tekniska divisioner. Du äger området observability och driver det framåt tillsammans med kollegor som delar ditt engagemang för tillförlitliga system, utveckling och långsiktiga lösningar.
   

  

**Job Requirements**
 DIN ROLL
   

  

 Som Observability Specialist utvecklar och implementerar du de verktyg och ramverk som gör våra system observerbara. Från loggar och mätvärden till spårning och dashboards ser du till att våra plattformar är väl instrumenterade, övervakade och optimerade för prestanda och tillförlitlighet.
   

  

**Vad Du Kommer Att Göra**
* Designa och drifta övervakningslösningar (t.ex. Grafana, Prometheus, OpenTelemetry, CloudWatch)
* Definiera standarder för loggning, mätvärden och spårning
* Skapa dashboards och larm som verkligen gör skillnad
* Stötta team i att instrumentera tjänster för observability
* Undersöka incidenter med hjälp avobservability-data och verktyg
* Vägleda bästa praxis för loggstruktur, lagring och kostnadshantering
* Stötta efterlevnad och revision kopplat till övervakning
* Samarbeta med DevOps och SecOps för att integrera observability i leveranspipelines
* APM –Application Performance Monitoring
* Implementera Incident Management-processer inom O11Y-stacken, t.ex. Prometheus, JIRA, PagerDuty.


**Job Responsibilities**
 VEM DU ÄR
   

  

 Du är nyfiken och vill förstå hur system fungerar i detalj och trivs med att analysera vad som händer när något går fel. Du arbetar praktiskt och söker alltid förbättringar bortom "good enough". Du bygger observability inte bara för att övervaka, utan för att förstå och agera. Du bidrar med struktur, samarbete och tydlig kommunikation i det dagliga arbetet, och är bekväm med att navigera både på svenska och engelska i en professionell miljö.
   

  

**Vad Vi Söker**
* Minst 3 års erfarenhet av övervakning och loggning i moln-eller hybridmiljöer
* God vana vid att konfigurera AWS-tjänster inom detta område
* Erfarenhet av verktyg som Grafana, Loki, Prometheus, Cloud Watch eller ELK
* Förståelse för principer kring mätvärden, loggar och distribuerad spårning
* Bekantskap med SLO:er, larmstrategier och incidenthanteringsprocesser.


**Vi Värdesätter Erfarenhet Inom**
* OpenTelemetry eller andra observability-ramverk
* Bakgrund inom SRE,DevOpseller plattformsutveckling
* AWS-certifiering(ar).


**Job Benefits**
 VI ERBJUDER DIG
   

  

* En av världens mest spännande och snabbast växande branscher inom rymdbranschen.
* En spännande och dynamisk arbetsplats med medarbetare och kunder över hela världen.
* Utrymme att utvecklas i takt med företagets tillväxt och framtidsmål.
* 30 dagars semester samt traditionella helgdagar – vi erbjuder dessutom extra lediga dagar.
* Utöver semester och traditionella helgdagar erbjuder vi extra betald ledighet under året, såsom ledigt mellan jul och nyår,Kristi himmelsfärdsdag– totalt 6–11 extra dagar beroende på kalendern.
* Friskvårdsbidrag (5 000 SEK/år).
* Attraktiv tjänstepension (ITP) och möjlighet att löneväxla till pension.
* En internationell arbetsplats som präglas av en öppen atmosfär och ett utmanande arbetsklimat i ständig utveckling.


 PLACERING
   

  

 Detta är en tillsvidareanställning på 40 timmar/vecka, med placering på vårt kontor i Solna Strand.
   

  

  

  

 MER INFORMATION
   

  

 Vid frågor som rör anställningsvillkor eller fackliga frågor är du välkommen att kontakta våra fackliga representanter:
   

  

 Sveriges Ingenjörer: af@sscspace.com
   

  

 Unionen: unionen@sscspace.com
   

  

  

  

 NÄSTA STEG
   

  

 Om denna möjlighet väcker ditt intresse så är du varmt välkommen med din ansökan! Vi går igenom ansökningar löpande och intervjuer genomförs under processens gång. Vänligen bifoga ditt CV i samband med ansökan. Du har möjlighet att komplettera med ett personligt brev, men vår bedömning kommer i första hand att utgå från din kompetens och erfarenhet som framgår av CV:t, i syfte att säkerställa en rättvis och objektiv rekryteringsprocess.
   

  

 Observera att annonsen kan komma att stängas i förtid om vi får in ett stort antal ansökningar, för att kunna säkerställa en effektiv process och ge varje kandidat rättvis uppmärksamhet.
   

  

  

  

 Detta är en säkerhetsklassad position och kommer att kräva en bakgrundskontroll före anställning.
   

  

 Välkommen med din ansökan till och med 2025-12-08.
   

  

  

  

 VI HJÄLPER JORDEN ATT DRA NYTTA AV RYMDEN
   

  

 Swedish Space Corporation (SSC) är en ledande global leverantör av avancerade rymdtjänster med mer än 50 års erfarenhet. Vi hjälper rymdorganisationer, forskningsinstitut, kommersiella och institutionella aktörer från hela världen att få tillgång till rymden.
   

  

 Med lokal närvaro på alla kontinenter och cirka 700 engagerade medarbetare erbjuder vi specialistkompetens inom satellitkommunikation och satellitkontrolltjänster, rymdfarkostoperationer, raket- och ballongsystem, uppskjutningstjänster och flygtesttjänster, samt ingenjörs-, drift- och konsulttjänster för rymduppdrag.
   

  

 We help Earth benefit from space. Läs mer på sscspace.com

title: Master Thesis: AI Benchmarking for Telecommunications Configuration
description:
**Join our Team**
**About this opportunity:**
 AI tools are increasingly integrated into professional workflows, but existing benchmarks focus mainly on general logic and knowledge. There is a lack of evaluation frameworks that measure how AI performs in practical, economically valuable tasks specific to telecommunications—such as solution configuration. This gap makes it challenging for telecom companies to make informed, data-driven decisions regarding AI adoption, R&D investment, and governance. Ericsson seeks to address this by developing benchmarks tailored to telecom-specific functions, enabling strategic business decisions and risk management.
   

  

**What you will do:**
* Measure and compare AI model performance on key configuration tasks versus human experts.
* Quantify the business and strategic implications of AI adoption in telecom configuration.
* Identify and select key configuration tasks relevant to Ericsson’s business.
* Collect representative examples and solutions from both AI models and human experts.
* Conduct blind evaluations with experts ranking the quality of AI and human outputs.


**The skills you bring:**
* Master’s level education in Industrial Engineering and Management, Business Analytics, or a related field.
* Strong analytical skills and experience in business modelling and data-driven strategy.
* Familiarity with AI concepts and their impact on business value and operations.
* Interest in emerging technologies and their strategic implications for telecom.
* Suitable for 1 or 2 students.


**Why join Ericsson?**
 At Ericsson, you´ll have an outstanding opportunity. The chance to use your skills and imagination to push the boundaries of what´s possible. To build solutions never seen before to some of the world’s toughest problems. You´ll be challenged, but you won’t be alone. title: Master Thesis: Automated Test Case Generation for MiniZinc Models with Large Language Models
description:
**Join our Team**
**About this opportunity:**
 MiniZinc is widely used to model complex configuration and optimization problems, especially in telecom systems. These models can be very large, and creating good test cases for them is time-consuming and often done manually. With recent progress in Large Language Models (LLMs), there is now an opportunity to explore whether AI can help automate this process.
   

  

 This thesis explores how LLMs can be used to generate test cases for MiniZinc models. The focus is on understanding how well AI can interpret constraints, produce inputs and output, and support testing. Different approaches, prompting strategies, and model setups can be investigated to understand what works best in practice. The results can help Ericsson evaluate the potential of AI-assisted testing for constraint-based systems.
   

  

**What you will do:**
* Review relevant research on AI for code generation, automated testing, and constraint programming.
* Study a large MiniZinc model and understand the structure and purpose of its key constraints.
* Develop and test methods for generating MiniZinc test cases using LLMs.
* Build a workflow where the LLM creates test cases and the MiniZinc solver checks them.
* Explore and compare different ways of using LLMs for this problem (e.g., different prompting strategies, workflows, or training approaches).
* Evaluate the generated test cases in terms of correctness, coverage, usefulness, and practicality.
* Document the work and present results to the Ericsson team.


**The skills you bring:**
* Currently pursuing a master’s degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, AI/ML, or a related field.Interest in AI and its applications in engineering workflow.Some knowledge of MiniZinc or constraint programming is reqsuired.Comfortable working with code, experiments, and technical problem solving.Curious, self-driven, and willing to explore different approaches and compare results
* Interest in AI and its applications in engineering workflow.
* Some knowledge of MiniZinc or constraint programming is reqsuired.
* Comfortable working with code, experiments, and technical problem solving.
* Curious, self-driven, and willing to explore different approaches and compare results.
* Suitable for two candidates, 30 ECTS credits each.


**Why join Ericsson?**
 At Ericsson, you´ll have an outstanding opportunity. The chance to use your skills and imagination to push the boundaries of what´s possible. To build solutions never seen before to some of the world’s toughest problems. You´ll be challenged, but you won’t be alone. You´ll be joining a team of diverse innovators, all driven to go beyond the status quo to craft what comes next.
   

  

**What happens once you apply?**
 Click Here to find all you need to know about what our typical hiring process looks like.
   

  

 Encouraging a diverse and inclusive organization is core to our values at Ericsson, that's why we champion it in everything we do. We truly believe that by collaborating with people with different experiences we drive innovation, which is essential for our future growth. We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply and realize their full potential as part of our Ericsson team. Ericsson is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. learn more.
   

  

**Primary country and city:** 
 Sweden (SE) || Stockholm
   

  

**Req ID:** 
 775785

title: Senior Systemutvecklare inom utvecklingsplattformar
description:
Vi söker dig som har tekniska kunskaper och intresse av att fortsätta driva Trafikverkets utveckling mot en högre automationsgrad på vår påbörjade digitaliseringsresa. Sök redan idag!
   

  

**Arbetsuppgifter**
 Som senior utvecklare med inriktning mot utvecklingsplattformar kommer du att vara en viktig spelare i vår ALM-funktion. Funktionen ses som en expertgruppering inom Trafikverket IKT och stödjer alla systemutvecklingsteam.
   

  

 Du ansvarar för utveckling och drift av Trafikverkets gemensamma utvecklingsplattformar, plattformar för CI/CD, pakethantering, kodkvalité, IT-infrastrukturkomponenter samt support mot våra intressentgrupper. Du kommer också att arbeta både med operativa frågor samt strategisk planering inom området. I vårt dagliga arbete behöver vi kontinuerligt ta i beaktande och ha en god förståelse för interna arkitektur- och säkerhetsprinciper när vi utvecklar och anpassar våra förmågor.
   

  

 Det finns en medveten strategi i våra val av verktyg där vi idag främst arbetar med Azure DevOps Server, ProGet och SonarQube men allt efter att behoven ökar och vi kommer längre tekniskt så utökar vi portföljen. Vår strategi framåt är att driftsätta fler applikationer i Trafikverkets OpenShift-plattform.
   

  

 Du kommer att ta en ledande roll kring vår arkitektur med stor handlingsfrihet inom ramen för vårat uppdrag och rekommenderar och deltar i beslut med stor resultatpåverkan på verksamheten. Du får med andra ord vara med i utvecklingen framåt och det finns stora möjligheter för dig att påverka arbetet.
   

  

**Kvalifikationer**
 Vi söker dig som är en lagspelare och skapar goda samarbeten genom tydlig och öppen kommunikation. Du är flexibel och trygg i att snabbt kunna anpassa dig till förändrade omständigheter, samtidigt som du tar ansvar för dina uppgifter och driver arbetet framåt på ett självständigt sätt. Med din problemlösningsförmåga hittar du effektiva och konstruktiva lösningar som bidrar till både teamets och organisationens utveckling.
   

  

 Vi söker dig som har
   

  

* universitets- eller högskolexamen om minst 180 hp inom IT, exempelvis systemutveckling/datavetenskap alternativt annan utbildning och erfarenhet som vi bedömer likvärdig
* flerårig erfarenhet av Azure DevOps Server eller liknande kodhanteringsplattform och dess förmågor både ur ett utvecklings- och driftperspektiv
* flerårig erfarenhet av att sätta upp automatiserade byggen och releaser med hjälp av Azure Pipelines eller GitHub Actions
* erfarenhet av att arbeta med Containerteknik
* goda kunskaper i svenska i tal och skrift


 Det är meriterande om du har
   

  

* erfarenhet av att arbeta i en tekniskt ledande roll, exempelvis lead developer


**Övrig information**
 Placeringsort för tjänsten är Borlänge, Gävle, Uppsala eller Stockholm.
   

  

 I denna rekrytering används webbaserade tester som en del i urvalet. Intervjuer är planerade att genomföras via skype vecka v. 50.
   

  

 Vill du ha en flexibel vardag med möjlighet att arbeta hemifrån? I den här rollen kan du jobba på distans upp till två dagar i veckan.
   

  

 Du är varmt välkommen att höra av dig till rekryterande chef Peter Olofsson (peter.olofsson@trafikverket.se) om du har frågor om tjänst, verksamhet etc.
   

  

 Vi använder främst mail (från mejladress: noreply@heroma.se) för att göra utskick och kallelser. Kolla din inkorg och även skräppost/SPAM regelbundet under denna tid för att vara säker på att du får all information från oss!
   

  

**Ansökan**
 De frågor som du får besvara när du skickar in din ansökan kommer att ligga till grund för det första urvalet vi gör. Om det inte står något annat i annonsen vill vi att du bifogar ditt CV. Vi har slutat begära in personligt brev eftersom vi inte har med det som del av urvalsunderlaget. Om du har skyddade personuppgifter ska du kontakta ansvarig chef för rekryteringen så att din ansökan blir hanterad enligt särskilda rutiner. Du hittar namn och kontaktuppgifter till chefen i annonsen.
   

  

 Inom vår IT-organisation är du med och utvecklar Sverige med hjälp av moderna och innovativa lösningar. Vi är mitt i en spännande förändring där vi försöker ta vara på digitaliseringens möjligheter till fullo. Digitaliseringen ställer allt större krav och vi vill därför anpassa oss vad gäller kompetens, arbetssätt och organisation i takt med utvecklingen. Vi har ett helhetsansvar för IT och telekom, en verksamhet som pågår dygnet runt, året om - precis som Sveriges transportsystem.
   

  

 På Trafikverket jobbar vi med att göra Sverige närmare. Vi tror på att en förening av olika erfarenheter, bakgrunder och perspektiv är den bästa grunden för att bygga en arbetsplats fri från diskriminering och en miljö där alla trivs och gör sitt bästa. Vi tror på mångfald där den gemensamma nämnaren är pålitlighet, engagemang och mod. För det är så vi bäst representerar vårt samhälle.

title: Senior Golang Developer
description:
**This is Coody**
 We’re one of Sweden’s fastest-growing tech consultancies, expanding in both people and revenue. We attribute our growth to our simple yet powerful approach to Gravity-Free Consulting, combining the freedom and flexibility of freelancing with the security of traditional employment.
   

  

 At Coody, we believe in freedom, trust, and ambition, which means you’ll feel like a freelancer with free rein on assignments that excite you, while enjoying the benefits of being employed by a company that invests in your growth.
   

  

 Our senior sales team has built a vast, carefully curated client network, enabling our consultants to work with some of the most innovative companies in Sweden, Finland, the US, and the UK across Gaming, Fintech, Medtech, AI, SaaS, Aviation, and Automotive, tackling real technical challenges while shaping their own career paths.
   

  

 We’re a
 **diverse community of ambitious tech professionals** 
 , representing more than
 **14 nationalities** 
 .
   

  

**Coody is more of a** 
**platform than a traditional consultancy** 
 . Everything we do is designed to help you work and live according to your own priorities and ambitions. If you’re curious to see how this works in practice,
 **explore our Employee Handbook** 
 and discover a company that truly puts consultants first.
   

  

**Why Coody**
 At Coody, we cut out everything unnecessary to give more back to you as a consultant. And we have done it in the package of a lean and efficient organization, meaning no overpaid managers, no fancy offices and no extravagant conferences. Instead we give you:
   

  

**Maximized Compensation.** 
 Typically a +40% salary increase.
   

  

**Freedom & Flexibility** 
 . No bosses. All digital. Fully remote for those who prefer.
   

  

**Employment Security.** 
 Fixed salary, pension, insurance, paid vacation and a big educational fund.
   

  

**Shape the Future.** 
 Projects and assignments for digital game changers like Spotify, Hemnet, Visa, Tobii, Toca Boca, Mojang, Flightradar24, SJ, and exciting startups and scaleups.
   

  

**What You’ll Be Doing**
 As a
 **Senior Golang Developer** 
 at Coody, you’ll help build and scale new and existing products with real end-to-end ownership of the service, the code, and the outcomes. Assignments are typically 6–24 months, and as a consultant you’re expected to ramp up quickly and deliver value from day one. While your home base is Go, you’ll sometimes work across the full tech stack (e.g., frontend, integrations, cloud infrastructure, CI/CD, data flows) to ship complete solutions. You’ll design and build scalable, robust applications in cloud environments, contribute to architecture and testing/automation, and play an active role in a high-trust, high-performing team.
   

  

 Who you are
   

  

 We are seeking a
 **Golang Developer with at least 4+ years of experience** 
 . You must have a proven ability to get things done. Here’s what we’re seeking:
   

  

* 4+ years of experience using Golang
* A cloud native background using Docker, Kubernetes, CI/CD, AWS / GCP / Azure and Terraform - or such.
* Skills and experience from additional tech stacks and tools are appreciated.
* A degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, or a related field.
* Based in Sweden: You must have Swedish citizenship, a valid work visa, or permanent residency.
* Fluent in English (spoken and written).


 How to apply
   

  

 Are you excited to take your career to the next level and meet the criterias? Apply now, and we'll be in touch shortly.

title: Cross Media Manager - 12 Month Parental Leave Cover
description:
**About WPP Media**
 WPP is the creative transformation company. We use the power of creativity to build better futures for our people, planet, clients and communities. For more information, visit wpp.com.
   

  

 WPP Media is WPP’s global media collective. In a world where media is everywhere and in everything, we bring the best platform, people, and partners together to create limitless opportunities for growth. For more information, visit wppmedia.com
   

  

**Role**
 At WPP Media, we believe in the power of our culture and our people. It’s what elevates us to deliver exceptional experiences for both our clients and each other. In this role it will be critical to embrace WPP & WPP Media’s shared core values:
   

  

* Be Extraordinary by Leading Collectively to Inspire transformational Creativity.
* Create an Open environment by Balancing People and Client Experiences by Cultivating Trust.
* Lead Optimistically by Championing Growth and Development to Mobilize the Enterprise.


**Role Summary And Impact**
 As a Cross Media Manager, you will be the strategic architect driving integrated media campaigns from concept to execution within our dynamic and collaborative agency environment. You'll translate client briefs into holistic, cross-channel strategies (online and offline), optimizing budget allocation across diverse media and leveraging new formats to maximize impact for a diverse range of clients. Your passion for media will ensure continuous optimization and innovative solutions, utilizing cutting-edge media strategies.
   

  

 Working closely with clients, Client Directors, and specialists, you'll ensure seamless campaign execution and act as a trusted advisor. You'll oversee budget allocation, monitor performance, and ensure the successful delivery of approved media strategies, all while staying abreast of market trends and contributing to agency revenue goals. You'll also benefit from support and guidance from Senior Cross Media Managers or Client Directors, depending on your client portfolio.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Understanding the agency's sources of revenue across media and the agency's own non-media functions
* Broad understanding of primary product areas and the tasks they solve for clients within the agency.
* Responsible for evolve briefs into recommendations for budgeting, audience selection, channel/platform ecosystem selection, creative design recommendation, cross channel media planning (both linear- & addressable media) reco and measurement framework.
* Responsible for delivery of approved media strategy and address if delivery criteria are not met.
* Responsible for overlooking that time spent (own time and specialists time) matches the fee and the planned hours.


**Skills And Experience**
* 2-5 years of relevant work experience, ideally from an agency or client-side media role.
* Degree or equivalent in Marketing, Business Administration, or Media.
* Proven media strategy experience across both online and offline channels.
* A passionate, strategic, and collaborative approach to media.
* Naturally curious about new formats and opportunities, with a proactive and structured mindset.
* Client-focused with strong advisory skills.


**Life At WPP Media & Benefits**
 Our passion for shaping the next era of media includes investing in our employees to help them do their best work, and we’re just as committed to employee growth as we are to responsible media investment. WPP Media employees can tap into the global WPP Media & WPP networks to pursue their passions, grow their networks, and learn at the cutting edge of marketing and advertising.
   

  

 In Sweden, our benefits include a SEK 3,000 wellness allowance, a 37,5-hour workweek, half-days and “klämdagar" off, 30 days of vacation, and two paid volunteer days per year. WPP Media Sweden is a member of Almega, and all employees are covered by a collective bargaining agreement (kollektivavtal), which ensures occupational pension, insurance, and other negotiated terms. We host regular team activities, knowledge-sharing sessions, and wellness initiatives throughout the year.
   

  

 WPP Media is an equal opportunity employer and considers applicants for all positions without discrimination or regard to particular characteristics. We are committed to fostering a culture of respect in which everyone feels they belong and has the same opportunities to progress in their careers.
   

  

  

  

 We believe the best work happens when we're together, fostering creativity, collaboration, and connection. That's why we’ve adopted a hybrid approach, with teams in the office around four days a week. If you require accommodations or flexibility, please discuss this with the hiring team during the interview process.
   

  

**Application**
 This is a full-time parental leave cover for approximately 12 months, starting as soon as possible. In addition to reviewing your CV and conducting interviews, our recruitment process includes a testing phase.
   

  

 Selection and interviews are ongoing, so please submit your application with your CV and cover letter as soon as possible.
   

  

 We believe that diverse perspectives make us stronger and encourage applications from people of all genders, backgrounds, and experiences.
   

  

**Contact**
 If you have questions about the position, feel free to contact Nadia Kapetanakis, Cross Media Team Lead, at nadia.kapetanakis@wppmedia.com. Due to GDPR, we do not accept applications via email.
   

  

 Please read our Privacy Notice for more information on how we process the information you provide.

title: Senior Account Executive - Growth
description:
Mentimeter is an engagement tool with a clear goal in mind. To turn presentations into conversations. Through real-time interactivity and clear visualizations, we get people to participate, engage and become more productive. Transforming all those passive meetings, airless classrooms and drawn out trainings into valuable and memorable moments.
   

  

 We truly believe that you achieve the best results by doing things together. And that successful leaders need to adopt a curious and collaborative mindset in order to get there. So with you at Mentimeter, you’ll be a big part of the ambition to help over 1 billion people listen, learn and work better together.
   

  

**What You Will Do**
 As a Senior Account Executive - Growth, you will play a key role in driving strategic revenue growth by deepening partnerships with some of Mentimeter’s most prominent enterprise clients. Your focus will be on identifying and capturing expansion opportunities within existing accounts, ensuring our solutions continue to create value and support their evolving needs.
   

  

 You will be responsible for a defined book of enterprise customers and work in close collaboration with a dedicated Customer Success Manager (CSM), Retention Manager (RM), and Sales Development Representative (SDR). Together, you will build and execute strategic account plans, drive cross-functional alignment, and strengthen our footprint across key business units to scale long-term success.
   

  

**Your Responsibilities**
* Develop and execute strategic account expansion plans for existing enterprise customers through analyzing usage data and aligning customer priorities with Mentimeter's value proposition.
* Deeply understand customer business models, organizational goals, and key pain points to generate qualified opportunities that position Mentimeter as a strategic partner.
* Build and maintain strong, trust-based relationships with senior stakeholders, including decision-makers and influencers across multiple functions and business units.
* Lead the full expansion sales cycle — from demand generation and opportunity identification to deal strategy and close — with a clear focus on growing Annual Recurring Revenue (ARR).
* Apply value selling and solution selling methodologies to align Mentimeter’s capabilities with customer outcomes and secure long-term partnerships.
* Collaborate cross-functionally with Customer Success Managers (CSMs), Retention Managers (RMs), Marketing, and Product to ensure seamless handovers, high customer satisfaction, and retention.
* Own accurate forecasting and pipeline visibility for expansion opportunities using best-in-class CRM discipline and data hygiene.
* Act as a strategic advisor to customers, continuously educating them on best practices, new use cases, and how to maximize the value from Mentimeter across their organization.


**Some Of The Resources At Your Disposal**
* World-class lead generation from the Marketing and Product teams
* SDRs to support in lead qualification and opportunity generation
* Sales Operations and Enablement function
* An extensive sales tool stack, including professional CRM, sales engagement platform, and data tools.


**Skills & Requirements**
* Proven success in enterprise SaaS sales with several years of direct quota-carrying experience.
* Track record of expanding strategic accounts through opportunity identification, value-driven selling, and consistent execution from discovery to close.
* Experience engaging and influencing C-level stakeholders, using a structured, insights-led approach to initiate and sustain high-value dialogues.
* A growth-oriented team player — driven to exceed targets while fostering collaboration and knowledge-sharing across cross-functional teams.
* Exceptional communication and presentation skills, able to simplify complexity and tailor messaging to different audiences and personas.
* Strong commercial acumen and the ability to build and prioritize strategic account plans that unlock long-term customer value and revenue growth.
* Fluent in Business English, both spoken and written.
* Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Business, Marketing, or a related field.


**What We Offer**
* Enjoy 30 days of paid vacation.
* A dynamic work environment with a hybrid work model that gives you the flexibility you need.
* Be part of our inclusive community and benefit from continuous professional development opportunities to advance your career.
* Learn more about our benefits on our website.


**Why Mentimeter**
 At Mentimeter, we revolutionize the way professionals and educators interact by turning passive audiences into active contributors. Our mission is to empower leaders—from corporate executives to educators—by fostering engagement, participation, and meaningful conversations in any setting.
   

  

 We believe that every voice matters. Our platform provides a transparent, inclusive space where participants can confidently express their ideas, contribute knowledge, and engage actively. But we go beyond engagement—we help leaders listen, analyze, and make data-driven decisions. By collecting audience input and displaying it in real time, we enable organizations to gain invaluable insights, promote transparency, and foster open dialogue.
   

  

 If you're passionate about reshaping the way people communicate, collaborate, and lead, join us at Mentimeter—where every interaction counts and every voice is heard. 🚀
   

  

 Ready to make an impact? Apply now!
   

  

**What Mentimeter Can Offer**
 At Mentimeter we can offer a diverse and inclusive work environment supported by smart and driven colleagues. We believe in continuous professional development for all of our colleagues and therefore offer access to a leadership program (including external personal coach) and relevant education to ensure that we continue to be state-of-the-art when it comes to innovating and building Mentimeter. Your place will be in a growing company with lots of career opportunities, working on a beloved product used by more than 300 million people. It’s not all about work though, we also offer a very healthy view on work-life balance.
   

  

 All of this comes attached with a competitive compensation and benefits package, including pension contributions. Learn more about our benefits by visiting our Benefits & Perks page
   

  

**Culture at Mentimeter**
 At Mentimeter we believe in giving everyone a voice - regardless of who you are. So we build a platform that does just that. Our platform is not only our product but also our organization. A platform where people feel safe, where differences are embraced, a place where you can have fun. We strongly encourage applicants who are people of color, LGBTQ+, women, people with disabilities, and/or formerly incarcerated people, and a college degree is not strictly required. In order to give everyone a voice, we need to be as diverse as our users.
   

  

 Learn more about our culture by visiting our Culture page.
   

  

 Review our Privacy Policy for more information.

title: SAP Functional Lead - Sales and Distribution
description:
Do you want to work in a global company where you can contribute to a more sustainable food production? DeLaval is a leading developer, manufacturer and supplier of solutions for dairy farmers around the world. As a company built on innovation, we constantly work to find ways of helping our customers do more with less.
   

  

 Our operations and how we support our customers is undergoing a major business transformation – Programme one . A key role in this business and IT transformation journey is our Functional Lead for Sales & Distribution. You will be a key player in one of DeLaval’s biggest business transformation programs ever. As part of this greenfield program, we will replace many of our existing solutions and processes with new solutions from SAP.
   

  

**Purpose Of Role And Key Responsibilities**
 You will be our senior solution designer and business advisor, with a deep understanding of business processes and capabilities. Close cooperation with business and IT stakeholders, as well as with SAP and our implementation partner, is your natural way of working. You are a strong advocate and gatekeeper for our principles: standardization, harmonization & simplification.
   

  

**Specific Tasks Include**
* Translate business requirements into technical solutions by applying knowledge of business processes and best practices, ensuring alignment with agreed cost-levels (TCO perspective) and in compliance with development and operations guidelines.
* Keeping guidelines and instructions up to date and addressing deviations from agreed design principles and ways of working.
* Upon completion of our transformation program, continue to be part of the SAP CoE supporting the continuous business development and improvement journey.


**Qualifications**
 We are looking for a proactive team member who will add value to our program with their SAP, technology, and business competence.
   

  

 To be successful in this role, we believe that you:
   

  

* Have about 5 years of experience in a similar senior role, with a strong competence in the S/4 HANA SD-module. Experience of Subscription Billing, GTS and Variant Configuration is advantageous.
* Have been involved in large SAP implementations, preferably greenfield projects.
* Have a strong understanding of SAP software and its capabilities, as well as experience in designing and implementing SAP solutions.
* Are familiar with SAP’s solution landscape as well as best practices, methods and tools from SAP.
* Have a Master of Science university degree (technical faculty or similar) or equivalent through work experience.
* Are fluent in spoken and written English


 We are looking for someone with a genuine interest in business processes and how IT can drive improvements. You bring drive, leadership, and a positive attitude – you’re not afraid to speak up and share your opinions, supported by guiding principles, target architecture, and established ways of working. You are confident in making decisions and actively contribute to decision-making processes. You have strong communication and interpersonal skills, as you will work closely with both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
   

  

**Working at DeLaval**
 Our core values Passion, People, Professionals and Partnerships connect individuals across entities and geographies. Success is far more than knowledge – it is strongly related to behaviours. At DeLaval we are all guided by our three behaviours: Set Direction, Make things happen and One DeLaval.
   

  

 We offer you a workplace like no other, where state-of-the-art technology goes hand in hand with animal welfare. Work-life balance is important to us and as an employee at DeLaval you have a great benefit package.
   

  

**Additional Information**
 This position is based in Tumba (Sweden). Global travelling will be part of this position. You will report to the Director Enterprise Transformation.
   

  

 We review applications ongoing. We do not accept applications via email, however if you have any questions regarding the role or the recruitment process don’t hesitate to contact us.
   

  

**Contact**
 Hiring manager: Sophia Perneby, sophia.perneby@delaval.com
   

  

 Recruiter: Agnes Edbom, agnes.edbom@delaval.com
   

  

**About DeLaval**
 Our vision is to make sustainable food production possible. As a company built on innovation, we constantly work to find ways of helping our customers, dairy farmers, do more with less by providing world-leading milking equipment and solutions.
   

  

 Today, DeLaval has approximately 4,500 passionate professionals operating in more than 100 markets around the world. DeLaval is part of the Tetra Laval Group.
   

  

 See more at corporate.delaval.com

title: Experienced IT Analyst with Pega Lead Business Architect (LBA) certification
description:
**Job ID: 31610**
 We are seeking a Pega Lead Business Architect (LBA) (job description Expert IT Analyst) to join our growing team within the Corporate Loans Service Domain. You will play a central role in delivering large-scale digital transformation initiatives for our corporate customers, focusing on process optimization, workflow automation, and customer experience enhancement.
   

  

 In today’s world, change is the one thing you can count on. That’s where you come in: working with dedicated colleagues in an inspiring environment to create great solutions for our customers while meeting the expectations Nordea has towards its stakeholders. You’ll have many opportunities to learn and grow as you build your career with us.
   

  

**About Our Team**
 Welcome to the Service Area Corporate Technology. Our team, Requirements & Analysis, within Corporate Loans Service Domain, focuses on delivering digital solutions for corporate lending.
   

  

 We create value by designing and developing future-ready tools within the Pega platform for the corporate loans domain. Working closely with internal stakeholders and experienced consultants, you will play a key role in ensuring our solutions meet today’s business needs and can adapt to rapidly changing customer demands and technological advancements.
   

  

**What you’ll be doing:**
* Lead business architecture and functional design for Pega applications within the corporate lending and credit lifecycle domains.
* Collaborate with Product Owners, business stakeholders and technical teams to translate business requirements into Pega features & user stories.
* Ensure solutions align with enterprise architecture, banking regulations and business objectives.
* Guide and mentor junior Pega Business Architects on best practices & frameworks.
* Develop and maintain detailed business process models, data mappings, and use cases.
* Support backlog grooming, sprint planning and user acceptance testing in an Agile (Scrum) environment.
* Act as a liaison between business users and technical delivery teams, ensuring clarity and alignment throughout the project lifecycle.
* Contribute to continuous improvement initiatives in business architecture and solution design.


 You’ll join a small but highly dedicated team of professionals, that welcomes fresh ideas and thinking. This role may be tailored somewhat based on your competences and capabilities. Location is Stockholm (Lindhagen) or Copenhagen (Taastrup) and we work on hybrid model.
   

  

**Who You Are**
 As the Lead Business Architect, you will bridge the gap between business and technology—supporting the Product Owner, defining business requirements, and ensuring alignment between business needs and Pega application design. You’ll be a key contributor in an Agile delivery setup, working closely with cross-functional teams to deliver high-impact solutions.
   

  

**Your background and skills include:**
* Pega Certified Business Architect (CPBA)
* 5+ years of hands-on experience in Pega platform delivery, with at least 2 years in a Lead Business Architect (LBA) role.
* Strong background in business process re-engineering and workflow automation.
* Proven experience working in Agile environments (Scrum/Kanban).
* Great communication, stakeholder management and documentation skills.
* Ability to collaborate effectively with business, IT and vendor teams in a hybrid delivery setup.
* Demonstrated proactivity and ownership: You take initiative and own outcomes.
* Previous work experience in international company.
* Fluent English skills.


**It is beneficial if you also know/have:**
* Solid understanding of corporate lending, credit origination, loan servicing, and related banking processes.
* Demonstrate proactivity and ownership by taking initiative and being accountable for outcomes.
* Focus on delivering practical, business-oriented solutions that improve speed, transparency, predictability, efficiency, quality, and compliance.
* Worked to shorten customer waiting times; ensured status updates are always available, and the ability to manage expectations.


 Please give practical examples of your skills and motivation on the cover letter/CV.
   

  

**What We Offer**
 Collaboration. Ownership. Passion. Courage. These are the values that guide us in how we work and how we make decisions – and that we imagine you share with us.
   

  

**People** 
 are driven by many different factors. For some, it’s to take their career to the next level. For others, it’s to break new ground within their area of expertise – in other words, with us, you will always move forward.
   

  

**A culture** 
 that fosters performance and growth in one of the largest Nordic banks, offering various opportunities to evolve, develop and learn from brilliant colleagues with diverse backgrounds in a vibrant working environment.
   

  

**Hybrid working model**

title: Product Owner Nordic Assset Development at Intraday Optimisation Nordic
description:
Do you want to help us lead the transition into a fossil free future, to enable electrification and to secure value creation on a changing and dynamic power market? Do you have a curious and analytical mind and a passion for energy markets? Then we might have the perfect position for you!
   

  

 The energy market is rapidly changing and we see an increasing need to adapt and to develop and automate our systems to stay competitive. We are now looking for the right person to strengthen our development capabilities and to boost one of our key development teams.
   

  

**Intraday Optimisation Nordic** 
 is a performance oriented department responsible for optimisation of Vattenfall’s Nordic portfolio of production and customer consumption on all intraday markets. Thus we have a key role for value creation and the realisation of Vattenfall’s strategy to lead the transition into a sustainable energy system by enabling further integration of renewable energy and new investments in fossil free power. The team is expected to be innovative, high performing and flexible – ready to cope with the rapidly changing dynamics of the European Power market.
   

  

**The Role As Product Owner Nordic Asset Development**
 As Product Owner for Nordic Asset Development you will lead a team of 6 full stack developers and 1 Scrum-master aiming to develop, implement and maintain system and tools used for planning and optimisation of Vattenfall Nordic portfolio and for market access to physical power markets. You are also responsible for developing both the HOW (product vision) and the WHAT (backlog) as well as continuously keeping this aligned with internal stakeholders (users, business experts & other IT-teams).
   

  

 You will report to the Director of Intraday Optimisation Nordic, but the Nordic Asset Development-team delivers support also to other stakeholders and the overall objective is to support BU Assets (including Intraday Optimisation Nordic) with systems and tools to enable maximising the value of Vattenfall Nordic portfolio while also coping with new market requirements.
   

  

**Main Tasks And Responsibilities**
* Develops the "WHY"(Product Vision) and the "WHAT" (backlog)
* Align with business and IT stakeholders, set priorities, and propose short- and long-term product goals
* The core duty is to ensure the product delivers the most value to customers, stakeholders, and the business.
* System ownership (compliance, IT security, audits, SLAs, etc.) supporting agile transformation and faster decision-making
* Challenge established solutions and initiate new business improvements.


**Qualifications**
**We are looking for a person with:**
* Relevant University degree of quantitative/financial discipline (e.g. Engineering, IT, Econometrics, Mathematics, Physics or similar)
* A genuine interest for and minimum 5 years of experience from the Nordic physical power market
* Knowledge of agile process frameworks, such as Scrum and Kanban
* Experience from working in large complex organisations
* Fluent in Swedish and English, both verbally and in text


 To succeed in this role you are analytical, structured, and skilled at communicating and adapting messages to different stakeholders. You have a good understanding of the fundamentals of the Nordic power market, a technical understanding of the tools we are using for market optimisation and trading, and enjoy the benefits and challenges from working in a large organisation with many interfaces and areas of collaboration. To fit into the team, we see that you are solution-oriented and have a positive attitude toward both colleagues and tasks.
   

  

 Additional Information
   

  

**Our Offer**
 We offer an interesting and challenging job within one of Europe’s leading energy companies and in a vital business area where we expect substantial growth within the next few years. You will be part of a innovative, dynamic and high performing team active in a rapidly changing market which provides quick feedback and reward. Initially you will work closely together with our market leading experts on market analysis and intraday trading and then your responsibilities will grow gradually as you are building knowledge and expertise. Over time you will have great opportunities to influence and steer your career path according to your own aspirations.
   

  

 At Vattenfall we are convinced that striving for diversity helps to build a more profitable, efficient, and attractive company. Therefore we seek a harmonious balance of employees in terms of age, religion, gender identity & expression, sexual identity, disability and ethnic background. Read more on how we work with diversity and inclusion here: https://careers.vattenfall.com/about-us/diversity-and-inclusion/
   

  

**Location** 
 : Solna
   

  

**For more information** 
 about the position you are welcome to contact recruiting manager Markus Bäck, +46 72 712 28 18. For more information about the recruitment process you are welcome to contact recruiter Peter Blixter +46 72 237 32 02.
   

  

 Trade union representatives Trade union representatives: Lars Erik Näsman (Unionen) and Sven Gunnar Gremlin (Akademikerna). To get in contact with the representatives, please call Vattenfall switchboard +46 8 739 50 00.
   

  

 We welcome your application, including CV and cover letter via the link below, no later than
 **30 November 2025** 
 . As we may conduct interviews on an ongoing basis, we encourage you to apply as soon as possible.
   

  

*Working at Vattenfall means working with critical societal infrastructure. Therefore, many of our positions are security classified, and you may be assigned a wartime placement.
   

  

 If this position is security classified, a security clearance will be carried out before employment, in accordance with the Security Protection Act. Any potential wartime placement is based on the employment contract and the Swedish Total Defence Service Act.*
**We look forward to receiving your application!**
**Company Description**
 Vattenfall is one of Europe’s largest producers and retailers of electricity and heat. Our main markets are Sweden, Germany, the Netherlands, Denmark, and the UK. The Vattenfall Group has approximately 21 000 employees. We have been electrifying industries, powering homes and transforming life through innovation for more than 100 years.

title: Master's thesis; Scalable Federated Learning for Autonomous Driving with Self-Supervision
description:
**Background**
 Autonomous vehicles rely on vast amounts of multi-modal sensor data—including vehicle control signals, GPS, lidar, radar, and camera inputs—to perceive and navigate their environment. Sending all this data to central storage is often impractical due to high bandwidth and storage costs, and annotating it manually is nearly impossible because of the sheer volume. Federated learning (FL) provides a distributed, privacy-preserving alternative, allowing multiple entities to collaboratively train a shared model without exchanging local data.
   

  

 Despite recent advances, FL faces challenges in large-scale, real-time vehicle deployments, particularly the need for labeled data. Deep learning-based perception modules require high-quality annotations, which are costly and complex to obtain. Self-supervised learning (SSL) offers a solution by leveraging mostly unlabeled data with minimal labels. Early studies show that federated self-supervised training can achieve performance comparable to centralized approaches, with potential improvements as larger unlabeled datasets are used.
   

  

 This project aims to advance federated learning for autonomous vehicles by integrating self-supervised methods with robust aggregation techniques to develop models that are efficient, generalizable, and capable of handling both common and rare driving scenarios, while reducing reliance on manual annotation and avoiding the costs of central data storage.
   

  

**Description**
 In this master thesis project, you will focus on:
   

  

* A novel self-supervised learning approach to exploit all available data on the central server, even with limited labels
* A hybrid federated learning scheme combining self-supervised and supervised techniques, adapted to local and global learning rounds
* Validation through extensive comparisons with fully supervised learning within the same federated scheme.
* Demonstration of the efficacy of combining self-supervised and supervised learning on ZoD dataset ((https://github.com/zenseact/zod) under various federated scenarios.
* Present findings to the project partners


**Key Responsibilities**
* Design, implement, and optimize federated learning systems that efficiently scale across heterogeneous devices while maintaining privacy and compliance with data protection regulations.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to integrate machine learning models into distributed environments, ensuring high communication efficiency, fault tolerance, and robustness against model drift.
* Conduct research and development of novel algorithms for secure aggregation, differential privacy, and model compression to enhance scalability, convergence speed, and energy efficiency in federated networks.


**Qualifications**
 We are looking highly motivated students with a good general background in machine learning and computer vision. The following skills would be essential:
   

  

* Deep learning
* Computer vision
* Python programming
* Reading scientific papers
* Handling complex systems
* Federated learning (would be a bonus)


**Terms**
* Industry supervisor:
+ Sima Sinaei, PhD (sima.sinaei@ri.se)
+ Mina Alibeigi, PhD (mina.alibeigi@zenseact.com)

* Location: RISE, Kista, Stockholm
* Application deadline: November 15th, 2025
* Starting date: As soon as possible, not later than December 1st, 2025.
* Credits: 30 points
* Compensation: 30 000 SEK upon a successful completion of a high-quality thesis.


**Welcome with your application!**

title: Master's thesis: Stabilizing Fiber Suspensions with Cellulose Nanofibrils for High-Concentration Processing
description:
Master's thesis: Stabilizing Fiber Suspensions with Cellulose Nanofibrils for High-Concentration Processing
   

  

 Cellulose fibers have long been used in packaging applications, hygiene products, and printed media. Today, there is strong interest in expanding their use to new areas where they can replace plastics—such as in 3D-shaped products like trays.
   

  

 The versatility of cellulose fibers comes from their ability to form strong networks. To create these networks, the fibers are suspended in water and processed at low concentrations, typically below 1 wt%. Even at these levels, fiber flocculation (entanglement) occurs, leading to uneven material structure and reduced mechanical properties. Much effort has gone into developing processing equipment that prevents flocculation by hydrodynamically breaking apart the flocs. However, the need for low processing concentrations still remains.
   

  

 Developing new methods to process fibers into uniform networks at higher concentrations would significantly reduce energy and water usage. It would also lead to stronger load-bearing networks for high-performance fiber products, and enable new material forming processes where flocculation is currently a limiting factor—such as for low-density porous materials.
   

  

 At KTH, we have shown that cellulose nanofibril networks at just 0.1 wt% concentration can effectively prevent the flocculation or sedimentation of nano- and microparticles. These nanofibrils create a fine mesh that hinders particle motion, working efficiently at low concentrations due to their high slenderness. In this master thesis project, you will use nanofibrils to prevent fiber flocculation, enabling processing at higher concentrations—up to 5 wt% or more—for both existing and new fiber-based materials.
   

  

 This master thesis project is part of a collaboration between KTH, RISE, and the Scandinavian pulp and paper industry, under the BioFunChem (BFC) research and education program. BFC focuses on developing biobased paper chemicals and additives for both current and future fiber processes. Project results will be shared at BFC research progress meetings, providing a valuable opportunity for industry connections.
   

  

 Part 1 – Flocculation studies
   

  

 RISE has a flow-loop setup designed for studying flowing fiber suspensions. The first step will be to adapt an existing imaging-based method for characterizing fiber flocculation, making it suitable for the higher concentrations targeted in the project. This will involve designing a modified measurement section for the flow loop, as well as adapting image processing scripts.
   

  

 Once ready, the setup will be used to study fiber suspension flocculation at various concentrations with different levels of added cellulose nanofibrils. This will help quantify how the nanofibrils affect the flocculation state. In parallel, rheological characterization of the suspensions will be performed at KTH.
   

  

 Part 2 – Application to wet-moulded products
   

  

 The potential of using high-concentration pulp suspensions with nanofibrils in wet moulding applications will be evaluated. It is hypothesized that the de-flocculating effect of the nanofibrils, along with their ability to enhance stiffness and strength, will offer significant advantages in both the processability and performance of 3D-shaped cellulose fiber products. This part of the project will make use of RISE’s wet-moulding pilot equipment.
   

  

**The project will be supervised by:**
* Tobias Benselfelt at KTH, Division of Fibre Processes
* Claes Holmqvist at RISE Bioeconomy


**The examiner is:**
 Professor Daniel Söderberg, Division of Fibre Processes
   

  

**Terms**
 Location: RISE, Drottning Kristinas väg 61
   

  

 Application deadline: 2025-12-06
   

  

 Starting date: As soon as possible or at latest January 2026.
   

  

 Contact: Claes Holmqvist, RISE, +46 10 228 45 54 and Anna Sjöstedt, RISE, +46 10 228 45 90.
   

  

 Credits: 30 points
   

  

 Compensation: For an approved thesis project worth 30 credits, we pay a compensation of 39 900.
   

  

**Welcome with your application!**

title: Lecturer - Education Focused
description:
This Job is based in Australia
   

  

**About The Role**
* Employment Type: Part time – 10.5 hours per week (0.3 FTE)
* Duration: 2-year Fixed Term Contract
* Remuneration: Level B from $127,947 + 17% superannuation and annual leave loading (pro rata)
* Location: Kensington Campus, Sydney, New South Wales


**About Us**
 The School of Clinical Medicine encompasses all our clinical campuses and disciplines as well as a number of other affiliated clinical sites. Our goals within this school are to provide the best educational practices across all our clinical campuses, make sure that all our researchers are well supported and that our staff and students flourish. This school may be widely disbursed physically but this gives us a fantastic scale and diversity that only enriches our clinical school.
   

  

 The Medicine Program is the most popular first-preference choice for school leavers in NSW. Our students are highly motivated and enthusiastic learners. Our curriculum is based around a set of graduate capabilities that guide learning and assessment across all six years of the program.
   

  

**Why this role matters**
 As a Lecturer (EF), you will deliver engaging undergraduate and/or postgraduate classes, assess student learning, and provide tailored academic support. You will design innovative learning activities and resources, contribute to the development of experimental teaching approaches, and foster individual and cohort progression to enhance student outcomes. Your role includes managing course administration and quality assurance, maintaining professional development in pedagogy and discipline knowledge, and articulating a clear teaching philosophy that inspires learning.
   

  

 UNSW’s Education Focussed roles (EF) enable academics to specialise in education and devote their time to delivering high-quality teaching and pursuing initiatives to enhance the educational experience of our students. Those who are appointed to this prestigious specialism will be expected to successfully drive educational excellence within the university’s teaching and learning communities.
   

  

 The Lecturer role reports to the Program Director, BMed/MD, with a dotted reporting line to the Phase 1 Convenors, and does not have direct reports.
   

  

**Who You Are**
**(Skills and Experience)**
 To be considered you will hold Australian Working Rights or Australian Citizenship. Visa sponsorship is not available for this appointment.
   

  

* A PhD in a related biomedical or medical discipline (preferred), and/or relevant work experience
* Demonstrated experience in teaching and learning design, development and delivery at undergraduate and/or postgraduate level.
* Experience using and/or designing with educational technologies and online delivery methods
* Evidence of teaching effectiveness and passion for educational excellence (e.g. relevant discipline-based curriculum design and development at a variety of levels and scales)
* Demonstrated knowledge of industry or experience of work-integrated learning (desirable)
* Actively stays up to date with discipline knowledge and professional development
* Evidence of highly developed interpersonal and organisational skills
* Evidence of ability to support and inspire students from diverse backgrounds and support student equity, diversity and inclusion initiatives.


 To learn more about this position, and view the comprehensive responsibilities, skills and criteria list, a copy of the Position Description can be found on JOBS@UNSW.
   

  

**Pre-employment Checks Required For This Position**
* Verification of qualifications.


**Benefits And Culture**
 People are at the core of everything we do. We recognise it is the contributions of our staff who make UNSW one of the best universities in Australia and the world. Our benefits include:
   

  

* 17% Superannuation and leave loading
* Flexible working
* Additional 3 days of leave over the Christmas Period
* Access to lifelong learning and career development
* Progressive HR practices


 More information on the great staff benefits and culture can be found here.

 Please upload your CV and a separate document addressing the selection criteria bullet points listed under the skills and experience heading in the position description.

 Talent Acquisition Consultant

title: Environmental consultant contaminated sites
description:

Do you enjoy mentoring and helping others grow? If so, this could be the perfect next step in your career!**

 We are looking for a Specialist to join our innovative team in delivering key environmental solutions within the infrastructure sectors, including heavy civil, transport, water, and environment. Our team plays a crucial role in driving business development across Sweden, and we’re proud to have contributed to project wins like the Railway Plan Borås, Göteborg-Borås, the detailed design of the new railway through Kolmården (part of the Eastlink), and the Vävra-Marstrand Wastewater Tunnel.
   

  





  

 In our department, 10 highly motivated colleagues work with environmental investigations at various stages. Many of our projects are executed in collaboration with other units within the company, including environmental specialists in Denmark and Norway. COWI offers opportunities to join international networks within your specialty area and even work abroad if that interests you.
   

  





  

 We’re looking for someone who is enthusiastic about delivering high-quality work, enjoys a fun and collaborative team atmosphere, and wants to help us continue to grow.
   

  





  

 Your Key Responsibilities
 


* Lead environmental assessments and investigations related to contaminated sites.
* Collaborate closely with multidisciplinary teams on infrastructure projects.
* Provide guidance and expertise in remediation strategies and regulatory compliance.
* Support business development by contributing to key project proposals and bids.
* Mentor and/or develop technical development in the contaminated sites discipline depending on prior experience



  

**Qualifications**




  

 Success in this role begins with a commitment to teamwork, building strong relationships with colleagues, partners, and clients. You thrive on continuous improvement and always seek new ways to enhance your work.
   

  





  

 Additionally, you will have:
 


* A degree in environmental engineering, geology, or a related field.
* Minimum 5 years of experience within contaminated sites.
* Proven experience working on contaminated sites, including site investigation and remediation.
* Good knowledge of environmental regulations and standards in Sweden.
* Ability to lead projects independently and communicate effectively.
* Fluency in Swedish and English, both written and verbal.



  

**A place to work and so much more**




  

 At COWI, we work together with our customers to shape a sustainable and liveable world. We do it by applying our knowledge and curiosity – and sometimes even our courage – to create the solutions the world needs today to enable a better tomorrow. That is why we say no to fossil-based projects and aspire to have 100% of our revenue come from activities that move our customers towards sustainability.
   

  





  

 We value differences and development and cultivate an environment of belonging and having fun. Because that is what brings out the best in you, at work and at home.
   

  





  

 With offices primarily located in the Nordic region, the UK, North America and India, we are currently 8,000 people who bring their expertise in engineering, architecture, energy and environment into play.
   

  





  

**Got more questions?**




  

 If you have any unanswered questions about the role as Engineering Professionals Contaminated sites engineering or what we have to offer, please reach out to:
   

  





  

 Niclas Eneberg, Head of Discipline; ncen@cowi.com.
   

  





  

 If you want to apply, apply via the link, we are eager to hear from you! Apply directly as the role may be filled before the ad's closing date.
   

  





  

 Get to know us even better at our website, www.cowi.com, where you can learn more about our projects, our strategy, what we want to achieve and what life is like at COWI.
   

  





  

**How to apply**




  

 We would like to hear from you, apply via the link. Apply as soon as possible as the position can be assigned before end date.
   

  





  

**Equal Opportunities for All**




  

 At COWI, we value equal opportunities for all employees and applicants based on individual circumstances without regard to gender, gender identity, gender expression, ethnicity, sexual orientation, disability, or age.
