title: Senior Frontend Developer (React) | Fully Remote
description:
**About The Job**
**Location** 
 : Fully remote, EU timezone (CET +/- 2 hours)
   

  

**Start date:** 
 ASAP
   

  

**Languages** 
 : English is mandatory; French is a plus
   

  

 We are hiring at Pragmatike to expand our team and drive the growth of our internal projects.
   

  

 Our focus is on developing cutting-edge solutions in Cloud Computing, Blockchain, and Artificial Intelligence, while fostering a culture of collaboration and innovation. Joining us means being part of a passionate team where your ideas and skills directly contribute to shaping tomorrow's technologies.
   

  

 If you're excited about working on ambitious projects in a dynamic and flexible environment, we'd love to hear from you!
   

  

**Responsibilities:**
* Collaborate with our Product Designer to conceptualize and execute product designs.
* Develop efficient and reusable front-end components and systems.
* Create clean and maintainable code solutions.
* Engage actively in the application lifecycle management.
* Optimize solutions for enhanced speed and stability.
* Enhance code quality by implementing unit tests and automation.
* Work closely with product and design teams to gain deeper insights into end-user requirements.
* Establish reusable code libraries (UI-ToolKit).
* Identify and resolve performance bottlenecks.
* Participate in design and code reviews.
* Foster collaboration with team members to integrate innovative solutions.
* Promote and communicate best practices for front-end engineering.
* Contribute to all stages of our product pipeline, from inception to delivery.


**Required qualifications:**
* Minimum 5-6 years of experience as a Senior/Lead Frontend Developer.
* Hold an MS degree in Computer Science or a closely related technical field.
* Proficient in coding single-page JavaScript applications (SPA's)
* Experienced with modern front-end frameworks such as React.js, Redux.js, JavaScript, Node.js, or similar technologies.
* Proficiency in HTML5/CSS3.
* Capable of writing high-performance, reusable code for UI components.
* Familiar with Object-Oriented JavaScript Frameworks and TypeScript, but not solely reliant on them.
* Passionate about developing robust, fully unit-tested code.
* Ability to effectively communicate project developments with both internal and customer engineers.


**Preferred qualifications:**
* Proficiency in using UI-testing technologies such as Selenium.
* Familiarity with front-end tooling like ESLint and Prettier.
* Understanding of Micro Frontend Applications.
* Experience in implementing responsive designs using CSS.


**Pragmatike** 
 is dedicated to a fair, transparent, and inclusive recruitment process. We ensure that no applicant is discriminated against based on age, disability, gender, gender identity or expression, marital or civil partner status, pregnancy or maternity, race, religion or belief, sex, or sexual orientation. In accordance with the
 **General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR)** 
 , your personal data will be processed lawfully, fairly, and securely. We collect and use your personal data solely for recruitment purposes, including sharing it with our client(s) for employment consideration. You have the right to request access, correction, or deletion of your data at any time. We are committed to maintaining the confidentiality and security of your information throughout the recruitment process.

title: Senior Data Engineer
description:
**This is Coody**
 We’re one of Sweden’s fastest-growing tech consultancies, expanding in both people and revenue. We attribute our growth to our simple yet powerful approach to Gravity-Free Consulting, combining the freedom and flexibility of freelancing with the security of traditional employment.
   

  

 At Coody, we believe in freedom, trust, and ambition, which means you’ll feel like a freelancer with free rein on assignments that excite you, while enjoying the benefits of being employed by a company that invests in your growth.
   

  

 Our senior sales team has built a vast, carefully curated client network, enabling our consultants to work with some of the most innovative companies in Sweden, Finland, the US, and the UK across Gaming, Fintech, Medtech, AI, SaaS, Aviation, and Automotive, tackling real technical challenges while shaping their own career paths.
   

  

 We’re a
 **diverse community of ambitious tech professionals** 
 , representing more than
 **14 nationalities** 
 .
   

  

**Coody is more of a** 
**platform than a traditional consultancy** 
 . Everything we do is designed to help you work and live according to your own priorities and ambitions. If you’re curious to see how this works in practice,
 **explore our Employee Handbook** 
 and discover a company that truly puts consultants first.
   

  

**Why Coody**
 At Coody, we cut out everything unnecessary to give more back to you as a consultant. And we have done it in the package of a lean and efficient organization, meaning no overpaid managers, no fancy offices and no extravagant conferences. Instead we give you:
   

  

**Maximized Compensation.** 
 Typically a +40% salary increase.
   

  

**Freedom & Flexibility** 
 . No bosses. All digital. Fully remote for those who prefer.
   

  

**Employment Security.** 
 Fixed salary, pension, insurance, paid vacation and a big educational fund.
   

  

**Shape the Future.** 
 Projects and assignments for digital game changers like Spotify, Hemnet, Visa, Tobii, Toca Boca, Mojang, Flightradar24, SJ, and exciting startups and scaleups.
   

  

**What You’ll Be Doing**
 As a
 **Senior Data Engineer** 
 at Coody, you'll dive into technically exciting and intellectually challenging assignments to design and build fully automated data platforms and pipelines that creates real business value. Each assignment is 6–24 months and will give you both broadness and deepness from various industries and companies. As a consultant, you are expected to ramp up fast and deliver value from day one, often in new environments.
   

  

 Who you are
   

  

 We are seeking a
 **Data Engineer with at least 5+ years of experience** 
 . You must have a proven ability to get things done. Here’s what we’re seeking:
   

  

* Experience in designing, developing, and maintaining scalable data pipelines, infrastructure, and tools.
* Professional experience with tools like Python, Snowflake, Airflow, DBT, Tableau, ELT/ETL, BigQuery, Looker Studio, Kafka, Hadoop, Spark, SQL.
* A solid understanding of cloud environments; AWS / Google Cloud / Azure
* A degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or Mathematics (or similar)
* Based in Sweden - You must have Swedish citizenship, a valid work visa, or permanent residency
* Fluent in English (spoken and written)


 How to apply
   

  

 Are you excited to take your career to the next level and meet the criterias? Apply now, and we'll be in touch shortly.

title: Backend Software Engineer
description:
We at Umain are looking for
 **Senior Backend Engineers** 
 with a genuine enthusiasm for building robust solutions that power digital experiences — engineers ready to bring passion, creativity, and dedication with them.
   

  

 The role is broad but centered on backend technologies, offering the opportunity to work on a variety of projects for both Swedish and international companies.
   

  

 We work with many different tech stacks, but most of our projects are written in
 **Kotlin, Go, or TypeScript** 
 . Our approach is to use the tools best suited for each project, ensuring our teams are not locked into a single stack.
   

  

**We Have a Proven Track Record**
* 400M+ total app downloads
* 50M+ monthly active users
* Backends handling tens of thousands of requests per second
* Globally recognized, multi-market applications


 If working at scale with technology that truly makes an impact excites you, we believe you'll be a great fit at Umain.
   

  

**What We Offer**
* A chance to work on a range of diverse and unique projects that explore and push the boundaries of what's possible.
* A fun and fair work environment where you have the opportunity to expand your skills through unique challenges and fantastic colleagues.
* A personal coach, and a setting where you can grow professionally and personally.
* Being part of multidisciplinary teams, participating in agile teams, being an important player in a highly ambitious setting.


 As a Senior Backend Developer at Umain, your role will involve:
   

  

* Building high-performance backend systems using modern languages like Go, NodeJS, Python, and Kotlin to power innovative experiences
* Using modern backend frameworks such as Fiber, Ktor, Express and FastAPI to create robust solutions.
* Designing and implementing cloud-native solutions across AWS, GCP and Azure, using Infrastructure-as-Code (Terraform) for resource management
* Building and maintaining CI/CD pipelines with containerized deployments and scaling strategies
* Developing robust data models and database architectures to support application requirements
* Participating in projects & teams alongside some of the largest and most forward-thinking brands on the planet


**Who You Are**
* You're a developer with a passion for innovation and a knack for problem-solving.
* You're eager to learn, grow, and take on new challenges.
* You value collaboration, diversity, and the opportunity to make a significant impact.
* You believe in the power of technology to shape the future.


 Why Umain?
   

  

**Career Framework**
 We believe in fairness and clarity, which is why we've established a transparent career framework to ensure equal pay and equal opportunities for all. Your growth and success are as important to us as they are to you. Together with your coach, you will build your own development plan and grow in your career.
   

  

**Work-Life Balance**
 At Umain, diversity is our strength. We understand that life doesn’t pause when you walk into the office. That's why we've cultivated an environment that supports an excellent work-life balance. We welcome team members from all walks of life, recognizing the richness that different backgrounds, ages, and life stages bring to our team. We're committed to supporting each other, encouraging a healthy work-life balance that respects your needs, whether it's taking care of your family, your pets, or yourself.
   

  

**Innovations And Learning**
 Technology is always evolving, bringing new challenges and opportunities for collaboration and learning. Our developers work closely with designers, analysts, testers and more to tackle these challenges head-on, sharing knowledge and growing together.
   

  

**Skills Over Degrees**
 We’re more interested in what you can do than in the diplomas you hold. Talent, drive, and creativity are what count at Umain. Here, you’ll find opportunities to grow, learn, and excel in your career, regardless of your educational background. If you have the ambition and commitment to succeed, we have the environment and resources to support your journey.
   

  

 Are you ready to SHAPE, SHIP, and SCALE with us?
   

  

 If you're a developer who thrives on innovation, values a supportive and inclusive workplace, and is eager to make a tangible impact on the future, we’d love to hear from you. Let’s build something awesome together.
   

  

 Umain is a digital product consultancy. We shape, ship and scale digital products at speed. Founded in Stockholm in 2001, we are a growing team of 100+ experts in digital product strategy, design, and technology.
   

  

 We are a part of Eidra, a group of top-notch companies specializing in strategy, creativity, and engineering. As a collective we guide leaders in making meaningful and lasting change.

title: Forward Deployed Engineer
description:
**TL;DR** 
 – We’re looking for an exceptional Forward Deployed Engineer to help build the future of AI-powered software creation. You will be the founding member of our FDE function, working directly with our most ambitious customers to translate impossible ideas into real products. This is a unique opportunity to design a new discipline from scratch and solve problems with AI that no one has solved before.
   

  

 Why Lovable?
   

  

 Lovable lets anyone build software with plain English. From solopreneurs to Fortune 100 teams, millions of people use Lovable to transform raw ideas into real products — fast. We are at the forefront of a fundamental shift in how software is created: from code-first to intelligence-first.
   

  

 Over 2 million people in 200+ countries already use Lovable to launch businesses, automate workflows, and bring their ideas to life. And we’re just getting started.
   

  

 We’re a small, talent-dense team building a generation-defining company from Stockholm. We operate with high ownership, high velocity, and low-ego collaboration. We care deeply, move fast, and are here to build something that outlives us.
   

  

 What makes this role special?
   

  

 This isn’t a traditional software engineering role.
   

  

 You will:
   

  

* Be the first Forward Deployed Engineer at Lovable
* Create a new function at the intersection of engineering, product, customer success, and research
* Partner with customers building never-seen-before AI systems
* Build product features based on real-world behaviors and emerging patterns
* Influence our core product direction and technical roadmap


 If you want to invent new categories, not just improve existing ones - this is that role.
   

  

 What we’re looking for
   

  

* 5+ years of experience building and shipping full-stack products
* Proficiency in modern frontend (React/TypeScript) and robust backend development
* Strong architectural thinking and familiarity with distributed systems
* Ability to rapidly prototype, experiment, and learn from real usage
* Exceptional product intuition and ability to work directly with users
* Comfort operating in high-ambiguity, high-agency environments


 Bonus if you’ve:
   

  

* Worked on agentic AI systems or built with LLMs before
* Led zero-to-one product development
* Worked in a founding or early startup environment


 What you’ll do
   

  

 In one sentence: Deploy intelligence into the real world.
   

  

* Work directly with customers to understand their workflows, needs, and problems
* Design and implement solutions for our customers that integrate with Lovable
* Translate insights from real usage into foundational platform improvements
* Own projects end-to-end — from idea → architecture → shipping → iteration
* Shape how Forward Deployed Engineering works at Lovable (rituals, playbooks, org design)
* Contribute to core product strategy, technical decisions, and cultural foundations


 Our Tech Stack
   

  

 We choose tools that empower both humans and AI:
   

  

* Frontend: React, Typescript
* Backend: Golang & Rust
* Cloud: Cloudflare, GCP, AWS, multiple LLM providers
* Tooling: Github Actions, OTEL, Grafana, Terraform, and more
* Always evolving with what works best.


 How we hire
   

  

* Fill out a short form and hop on a brief intro call with our recruiting team.
* Complete a quick live coding exercise.
* Show us how you approach problems during several technical interviews.
* Show us something you’ve built that makes you proud.


**About Your Application**
* Please submit your application in English - it’s our company language so you’ll be speaking lots of it if you join
* We treat all candidates equally - if you’re interested please apply through our careers portal.

title: Javautvecklare
description:
Vi har nu ett nytt behov och söker därför en konsultkollega med nedan kvalifikationer. Tjänsten är en del av vår konsultverksamhet vilket innebär att du blir anställd av oss och arbetar hos kund alt. interna projekt och åtaganden.
   

  

**Din profil (Skall krav)**
* Ha erfarenhet av javautveckling (minst 5 år)
* Ha erfarenhet av utveckling i Linux-miljö (minst 3 år)
* Ha erfarenhet av Microservice-arkitektur (minst 3 år)
* Ha erfarenhet av Quarkus, Springboot eller liknande (minst 3 år)
* Ha goda kunskaper i Git, Maven och liknande moderna verktyg som Gradle
* Ha erfarenhet av teambaserad utveckling enligt agila principer (minst 3 år)
* Goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska, både i tal och skrift


**Meriterande**
* Ha minst 1 års erfarenhet av utveckling inom KPI, certifikathantering, kryptografiska säkerhetsfunktioner, användning av HSM
* Ha minst 1 års grundläggande kunskaper i app- eller frontendprogrammering
* Ha minst 1 års erfarenhet av att bygg, drifta och övervaka system i cointainerbaserade miljöer som Kubernetes, Openshift eller liknande
* Ha minst 1 års erfarenhet av SAML2, OpenID-familjen eller OAuth 2.0
* Ha minst 1 års kunskaper om SQL-databaser, NoSQL-databaser och cachelösningar
* Ha minst 1 års erfarenhet av Kafka eller liknande asynkrona meddelandeköer
* Ha erfarenhet av att utveckla öppen källkod


**Sista ansökningdatum:** 
 18-11-2025
   

  

**Om Oss**
 Att jobba på Deploja är något helt annat än att arbeta på ett vanligt konsultbolag – och det är vi riktigt stolta över. Vad är det då som gör oss unika?
   

  

 Vi erbjuder helt enkelt mer än bara hög lön och större frihet, det är bara början. Hos oss hittar du den arbetsmiljö och de möjligheter du förtjänar. Här påverkar du din egen lön som helt och hållet som baseras på ditt timpris mot kund.
   

  

 Vår lönemodell är en hybridlösning mellan en fast månadslön och en provisionsbaserad ersättning. Det innebär att din månadslön baseras på ditt timpris, fast om du mot förmodan skulle stå utan uppdrag så behåller du en grund lön fram tills vi hittat ett nytt uppdrag, bra va?
   

  

**Vi erbjuder dig följande, Valet är ditt!**
 🚀 Spännande uppdrag hos våra många kunder. Vi fokuserar på långsiktiga uppdrag, vilket ger dig möjlighet att skapa värde för kunden samtidigt som du utvecklas själv.
   

  

 🌟 En trygg månadslön – tillsammans bestämmer vi en grundlön baserad på dina uppdrag.
   

  

 🚗 Tjänstebil – vi uppmuntrar dig att välja en elbil för en mer hållbar framtid.
   

  

 💼 Tjänstepension och stora möjligheter till löneväxling.
   

  

 🌴 Semester - Önskar du mer än 30 dagar semester, kanske 60 dagar?
   

  

 🏥 Privat sjukvårdsförsäkring, olycksfallsförsäkring och livförsäkring för ökad trygghet.
   

  

 📚 Kompetensutveckling – du får själv sätta din budget och välja vilka utbildningar du vill delta i.
   

  

 🕑 Livskvalitet - Har du kanske svårt att få ihop pusslet i vardagen och önskar arbeta lite mindre och ändå kunna tjäna lika mycket om inte mer?
   

  

* Vi hanterar ansökningar löpande, med hänsyn till höga arbetstrycket är det extra viktigt med en kort motivering för tjänsten som förklarar hur man möter kraven.

title: Senior Full-Stack Engineer
description:
About us:
   

  

 Legora is working to empower lawyers and automate legal work. Our approach is to enable the lawyer of the future: a human-AI lawyer who's an order of magnitude more effective than a team of conventional legal professionals. The human-AI lawyer will iterate at the speed of their judgment, even in the most complex legal scenarios, and will out-smart and out-deliver the best pure AI system.
   

  

 You are joining an early-stage scale-up with exceptional product-market fit that thousands of lawyers use daily at global institutions such as Bird&Bird, Mannheimer Swartling, and Heineken. Backed by $37M in funding from top investors like Benchmark, Redpoint, and Y Combinator, Legora is a group of exceptional engineers, lawyers, and doers. Here, you will have infinite room to grow and rethink how truly worthwhile work gets done.
   

  

**The role:**
 As a Fullstack Engineer at Legora you will build, review and ship amazing products helping legal professionals all over the world in their day-to-day job. You’ll get the chance to work across the entire tech stack with clear ownership and autonomy.
   

  

 What you will be doing:
   

  

* Architect and implement features end-to-end for our web platform
* Take ownership of our codebase, balancing high-quality code, security and speed of development
* Work with technologies such as Python, React, Node.js, AWS, Azure and Kubernetes
* Review code and mentor junior colleagues to support them in their development, making the team even better!
* Drive continuous improvement and challenge us, the industry and yourself


 Who you are:
   

  

* A passionate engineer with several years of experience building great products using cutting-edge technologies
* You feel comfortable working across the entire tech stack, with focus on backend development
* You’re autonomous and take pride in the code you write
* You’re a problem solver who’s not afraid to come up with creative solutions and think holistically about software architecture
* Experience in infrastructure and integrations are a big plus


 What’s in it for you:
   

  

* Career development opportunities in a rapidly evolving entrepreneurial environment.
* Direct collaboration with senior leadership and the opportunity to directly impact company growth and strategy.
* A collaborative, high-energy team environment where your ideas and contributions are valued and implemented.
* Competitive salary complemented with a transparent and highly competitive options program.
* Centrally located offices in Stockholm, London, and NYC, designed as a space for you to do your life's work.


 We founded Legora with the vision of giving lawyers the tools they deserve.
   

  

 We didn't build Legora for how law is practiced today; we built it for how it should be practiced tomorrow.

title: Senior Backend Engineer (TypeScript) [Prisma Postgres]
description:
At Prisma, we’re redefining how developers work with databases. If you’re fascinated by the cutting-edge data infrastructure powering companies like Twitter, Airbnb, and Facebook, but want the agility, ownership, and impact of a fast-moving startup, Prisma is the place for you.
   

  

 Backed by top-tier Silicon Valley investors like Amplify Partners, Kleiner Perkins, and IVP, our small, distributed team is making advanced database technology accessible to developers everywhere. Our open-source tools are trusted by over 400,000 developers each month, with a thriving community on Discord and GitHub, where we’ve earned 43,000+ GitHub Stars.
   

  

 At the heart of our commercial offerings is Prisma Postgres, our flagship product designed to supercharge PostgreSQL with modern developer workflows, performance optimizations, and seamless scaling. Alongside it, Prisma Accelerate, and Studio, provide a world-class tookit for building with data.
   

  

 By combining the power of open-source with cutting-edge commercial solutions, we’re shaping the future of databases, one developer at a time.
   

  

 What would you do at Prisma?
   

  

 You’ll be part of our Prisma Data Platform team which is responsible for Accelerate, Prisma Postgres and the bare metal cloud that those products are build on. You'll be contributing across the stack to the projects of the team.
   

  

 To Give You a Clear Idea Of What The Job Could Entail, Here Are Some Examples Of The Work We’ve Done Lately Or Will Start Soon
   

  

* Design, implement and deploy a websocket server that will allow customers to connect to Prisma Postgres from WASM environments where TCP connections are unavailable.
* Work closely with the ORM team to define the protocol of that server so they can implement the client adapter.
* Choose and deploy a globally distributed configuration store (like etcd, rqlite) for encrypted authentication secrets to enable global routing for Prisma Postgres.
* Work together with an infra engineer to improve automation of our bare metal servers with the goal to reduce the provisioning time of new servers.
* Troubleshoot and fix a bug where a customer experiences sporadic connectivity issues.


 An Ideal Candidate Profile
   

  

 We believe the right candidate for this position should meet a majority of the criteria listed below.
   

  

* 8+ Years experience in agile software engineering teams, delivering robust web applications, using TypeScript, NodeJS and golang.
* Experience in building and scaling distributed systems. Experience with bare metal servers is a plus.
* Experience in database and backend technologies like SQL/NoSQL databases and familiarity with cloud services, APIs (GraphQL/REST).
* High standards for quality, ensuring excellence while balancing pragmatism, purpose, and a strong sense of agency—taking ownership, making thoughtful trade-offs, and driving meaningful impact.
* Strong communication skills in English, both written and verbal—able to articulate complex ideas clearly, adapt messaging to different audiences, give and receive constructive feedback effectively, and foster collaboration across teams.
* You have a structured thought process, approaching problems methodically and making well-reasoned decisions. You plan effectively, setting clear goals, anticipating challenges, and ensuring smooth execution while keeping stakeholders aligned.


 What's it like to work at Prisma?
   

  

 You're likely to be a great fit for the team if you ...
   

  

* ... have an ownership mindset. As a member of the team, you'll have an outsized impact on decisions and the way things are executed.
* ... stay nimble. It's a startup, things change and you are ok with that. Be ready to re-calibrate often and stay flexible.
* ... be kind and collaborative. Come in ready to share your ideas and listen to feedback.


 What's in it for you?
   

  

 We put our people first\*\*.\*\* Strong pay, full flexibility, and benefits that make a difference. Take the time off that you need, grow your career, and do work that matters.
   

  

* An opportunity to lead the team shaping Prisma’s cutting-edge cloud products, driving innovation in modern database tooling and redefining how developers build and scale applications — see what we’re building.
* A Fun and Supportive Team that values collaboration, growth, and continuous learning.
* Competitive Base Salary and Stock Options, including extended post-termination exercise windows.
* Fully Remote Work with flexibility to work from anywhere within our required time zones. If you prefer an office environment, we provide access to a local co-working space for up to ten days per month.
* Generous Time Off, including twenty-four days of paid vacation and paid sick leave.
* Parental Benefits, including twenty weeks of fully paid parental leave and child sick leave.
* Sabbatical Leave, with six weeks of fully paid time off after three years of continuous employment.
* Mental Health Support, including four fully paid Mental Health Days per year and access to professional resources.
* Tech and Ergonomic Budget to equip you with the tools you need, plus an ergonomic chair subsidy for your comfort and well-being.
* Annual Offsites, bringing the team together twice a year with all expenses paid retreats at exciting locations.
* Relocation Support, offering a relocation package for team members moving to Berlin after twelve months, if you choose to relocate.
* [US] Health and Pension Benefits, including comprehensive health, dental, vision, and 401k matching.


 Remote Work
   

  

 To ensure effective collaboration we can currently only accept candidates within the timezone
 ****GMT -2 to GMT +3****
 for this position.
   

  

 What is our hiring process like?
   

  

* Introductory Call with our future manager.
* Take Home Assignment followed by a debrief call
* System Design Interview with one of your peer engineers
* Interview with our Head of Engineering
* Final Interview \*\*with our CEO / COO.
* Offer


 The above serves as a basic outline, we might choose to add or remove steps based on the information that we gather during the process.
   

  

 If you believe that this is the right position for you then please send your resume along with any supporting documentation or information to us via the link provided on this page. We typically respond within 7 business days.
   

  

 In line with our
 **Fair Treatment and Equal Opportunity Policy**
 , as well as our
 **Disability Policy**
 , Prisma follows fair and merit-based hiring practices, ensuring all candidates are evaluated based on their skills, experience, and qualifications. We do not make hiring decisions based on
 **age**
 ,
 **race**
 ,
 **ethnicity, sex, gender identity, parental or caregiver status, trade union membership, disability, religious belief or lack of belief, life expectancy, sexual orientation, genetic information**
 , or
 **veteran or military status.**

title: Fullstack Developer
description:
**Expleo** 
 is seeking a highly skilled and experienced
 **Fullstack Developer** 
 to join our team in
 **Sweden** 
 (located in Gothenburg OR Stockholm).
   

  

 Our
 **ideal** 
 candidate has an always-on mindset with a strong background in designing, configuring, and managing solutions for devices, tools, and applications in a factory/corporate setting.
   

  

 If you are a full-stack engineer looking to expand your skill set, we'd love to hear from you. Join our team today and take the next step in your career!
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* Understand and reflect on the customer needs to bring value to the organization.
* Take part in the development cycle using innovative technologies and frameworks.
* Secure qualitative, efficient and performance deliveries.
* Provide input for the design and construction of test cases and scenarios and help validate executed test results.
* Contribute to boosting the team to continually increase knowledge, competence, performance, and innovation
* Collaborate with suppliers, architects, engineers, developers, and internal stakeholders on upcoming and innovative technologies and standardization.
* Collaborate with the local IT site teams for problem/opportunity analysis.


**Qualifications**
* Hold a bachelor’s degree in information technology, Computer Science or equivalent experience in a relevant field.
* Knowledge and experience in agile development practices, ITIL (incident, problem & change process), collaboration tools (such as Azure DevOps or similar)
* Java development & support, relational databases (Oracle, SQL server, My SQL).
* Eager to learn and grow (yourself and the company) using a modern approach to Software Engineering.
* Ability to work under rapidly changing conditions and have the capability to identify, mitigate and decide on solutions when facing obstacles.
* You are fluent in English, both verbally and written.
* You should have a general understanding of production processes and understand how all these things work together to make end user applications work well.
* Knowledge of the automotive industry is meritorious.


**Experience**
* Knowledge about databases (MS SQL (Azure))
* Development platforms (Java, OpenShift, ...)
* Azure Cloud (App services, AKS Azure Kubernetes Cluster)
* SQL server for database
* Azure Storage, Azure Container Services
* Frameworks (Spring, Springboot, WebFlux, ...)
* Messaging (MQ, Kafka, REST API, ...)
* Front-end (Angular)
* Test Driven Development (Unit testing in Spring Boot and Angular, in memory database testing using Mockito)
* Agile processes (Safe / Scrum / ADO) but also about backlog management, strategic planning, business relationship management, problem analysis and business modelling.
* Bonus points for having relevant experience using docker containers and orchestration with Kubernetes.


**Benefits**
**Who are we?**
 Expleo is a rapidly growing consulting company dedicated to delivering innovative solutions in the fields of AI engineering, digitalization, hyper-automation, cybersecurity, and data science. With a strong commitment to integrity, diversity, sustainability, and societal security, Expleo is at the forefront of creating a better future. Join our dynamic team and be part of our journey to shape the future of technology and business.
   

  

**What do we offer?**
* Collaborative working environment – we stand shoulder to shoulder with our clients and our peers through good times and challenges
* We empower all passionate technology loving professionals by allowing them to expand their skills and take part in inspiring projects
* Expleo Academy - enables you to acquire and develop the right skills by delivering a suite of accredited training courses
* Always working as one team, our people are not afraid to think big and challenge the status quo
* Collective agreement with the union
* Access to a collection of benefits and discounted prices on services and shops.
* Health benefits
* Expleo team activities


 "We are an equal opportunities employer and welcome applications from all suitably qualified persons regardless of their race, sex, disability, religion/belief, sexual orientation or age ”.

title: Computer Vision Engineer
description:
**The role** 




 • Build, optimize, and deploy computer vision models for industrial inspection, tracking, or safety.
 



 • Integrate with cameras/sensors and deploy to edge devices (e.g., NVIDIA Jetson) with containers.
 



 Optimize real-time performance (ONNX/TensorRT/OpenVINO), reliability, and environmental variability.
 



 • Collaborate with Controls/OT teams; integrate with PLC/SCADA/MES where needed.
 



 • Establish data pipelines for annotation, retraining, and continuous improvement.
 



  





**What you bring** 




 • MSc/BSc in Computer Vision/Computer Science/Robotics or similar.
 



 • 3+ years in CV/ML engineering; strong Python (and preferably C++) and OpenCV.
 



 • Experience with PyTorch or TensorFlow, model optimization, and edge deployment.
 



 • Familiarity with camera systems, calibration, image quality, and lighting constraints.
 



 • Cloud, containers, and CI/CD for reproducible builds.
 



  





**Nice to have** 




 • Robotics/ROS, industrial protocols, safety standards, and MLOps for data refresh/retraining.
 



 • Experience in manufacturing, automotive, or logistics environments.
 



  





**Ready for your next career move? Explore opportunities at** 
**Co-Workertech.com** 




**Join our LinkedIn groups for updates on upcoming opportunities! Connect, collaborate, and thrive with industry leaders:** 



* **Co-Worker Technology**
* **Co-Worker Renewable Energy Industry Jobs**



**Follow us to stay updated on the latest news, insights, and exciting announcements from our company.**

title: Functional Consultant – Application Management
description:
**Jobbsammanfattning**
 You’ll be part of a collaborative and dynamic environment where your expertise directly contributes to improving critical business systems. This is an excellent opportunity to grow in a hybrid functional-technical role, working on enterprise-grade applications that support key business operations!
   

  

**Om rollen**
 We are seeking a Functional Consultant (Application Management) to join our team and ensure the optimal performance, stability, and reliability of our enterprise applications. In this role, you will serve as the key link between business users, technical teams, and system administrators — ensuring smooth operation, proactive support, and continuous improvement of our software solutions.
   

  

 You will be responsible for managing application incidents, monitoring performance, implementing updates, and providing expert-level functional support. The ideal candidate combines strong analytical skills with excellent communication and a service-oriented mindset.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Act as the primary point of contact for application-related issues and service requests.
* Provide high-quality functional and technical support to end-users.
* Monitor application performance and ensure system availability and stability.
* Collaborate with development and infrastructure teams to troubleshoot and resolve complex technical problems.
* Document issues, resolutions, and create user-friendly technical guides and knowledge base articles.
* Analyze recurring incidents, identify root causes, and suggest process or system improvements.
* Coordinate and implement application updates, patches, and enhancements.
* Support system testing, change management, and release activities.
* Ensure compliance with company policies, data security, and IT governance standards.


 Your location will be Solna, Stockholm.
   

  

**Har du vad som krävs?**
* Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Business Systems, or a related field.
* Proven experience in application management, functional consulting, or application support.
* Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities with attention to detail.
* Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal.
* Ability to work effectively under pressure and manage multiple priorities.
* Customer-focused mindset with a proactive approach to issue resolution.


**Technical And Functional Skills**
* Solid understanding of database structures, data flows, and system integrations.
* Working knowledge of SQL for data analysis and validation.
* Experience with testing tools and issue tracking systems (e.g., JIRA, ServiceNow, Azure DevOps).
* Familiarity with ITIL principles and Application Lifecycle Management (ALM)
* Experience in Agile or Waterfall project methodologies.
* Strong documentation skills for requirements gathering, fit-gap analysis, and process design.
* Skilled in conducting user workshops, training sessions, and stakeholder presentations.
* Analytical mindset with a disciplined, structured approach to problem-solving.
* Adaptability and eagerness to learn new systems and technologies.


 Proficiency in English required. Swedish is a strong advantage.
   

  

**Vad kan du förvänta dig av oss i gengäld?**
 Kiwa is one of the most successful companies in inspection, testing, certification, and technical consulting, thanks to our employees who, through their dedication and expertise, contribute to safety and sustainability for our customers and society as a whole. That’s why Kiwa invests heavily in its employees and their development. Through your daily work, exciting projects, and training opportunities, you and your skills will continuously grow as part of Kiwa! At Kiwa, teamwork comes before individual interests, and together we create a positive work environment where everyone is part of a greater community—the Kiwa community!
   

  

* Secure and stable employment - Kiwa has collective agreements
* Generous wellness allowance
* Compensation for medical care, vaccinations, and the opportunity for a thorough health analysis
* A time bank so you can take time off when it suits you—not just on public holidays
* The chance to join Kiwa’s ski trip with around 100 fantastic colleagues


**How To Apply**
 Apply via our website and register your CV.
   

  

 Selection and interviews are conducted on an ongoing basis.
   

  

 For questions regarding the position, please contact Unit Manager Fatah Mohammad at +46104793018 or email the recruiter Sofia Kjellström at sofia.kjellstrom@kiwa.com.
   

  

*For this recruitment, we have carefully considered our advertising channels and therefore kindly ask not to be contacted by recruitment or advertising agencies.*
**Om Kiwa/About Kiwa**
 We ARE Kiwa - Are you?
   

  

 At Kiwa, our core values—Ambitious, Reliable, and Engaged (ARE)—are the foundation of everything we do.
   

  

 Do you identify with these values? Do you strive to build trust and credibility with customers and colleagues? Is the safety of individuals and society important to you?
   

  

 Kiwa is currently one of the most successful companies in inspection, testing, certification, and technical consulting. We are a global player with strong local presence. We maintain strong customer relationships and high service standards, with a focus on safety, technology, and sustainability. We offer a wide range of services in process safety, property and lift safety, agriculture, as well as the food and construction industries. As a group, we operate in over 40 countries and have around 12,000 employees worldwide. In Sweden, we have about twenty offices from Kiruna to Malmö, where a total of 900 employees work together for a safer society.
   

  

**Additional Information**
 Kiwa aims to maintain a drug-free workplace. Therefore, random alcohol and drug testing is conducted throughout the year.
   

  

*Background checks may be carried out during the recruitment process*

title: Senior ML / AI Engineer
description:
**Join our global force of 500+ innovators, blending the latest in tech with the greatest in soundtracking, from our Stockholm HQ to offices in London, New York, Los Angeles, Berlin, Oslo, and Seoul. We’re an industry leader with a startup mentality. We take what we do seriously, but we don’t take ourselves too seriously. Creating and collaborating to transform the sound of streaming, content, and culture. Come join us— and let the world feel your work.**
**The role**
 We’re looking for a skilled
 **Senior Machine Learning Engineer** 
 to serve as a technical leader in our
 **Smart Discovery Team** 
 - the group shaping the next generation of discovery experiences at Epidemic.
   

  

 In this role, you’ll architect and lead the development of AI systems that form the core of our discovery experience and uncover music in new, intuitive ways. You’ll work at the intersection of agentic AI, large language models, and traditional search algorithms, creating conversational and context-aware discovery experiences that redefine how people interact with our library.
   

  

 We’re at the start of an exciting journey to deliver the best AI-powered discovery experiences for our users. We’re agile, user-focused, and passionate about building high-quality products.
   

  

**How You’ll Make An Impact**
* Build and evolve the features that power how users discover and connect with our catalog.
* Take ideas from concept to production: your team owns its projects end to end.
* Prototype, experiment, and scale solutions that combine search, personalisation, and conversational AI.
* Design and evaluate retrieval and agentic systems that understand user intent and context.
* Contribute to a curious, collaborative, and explorative team culture.
* Define, implement, and evangelise best practices in ML engineering, code quality, and system design, measurably improving team processes and output
* Coach and mentor other engineers to level up the team's capabilities, acting as a key technical partner to influence product, data, and design roadmaps.


**Who You Are**
* PhD or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Machine Learning, or a related field.
* Proven experience building and deploying production-grade LLM or agentic AI systems (e.g. reasoning, memory, context optimisation, tool use, retrieval).
* Strong background in one or more ML domains: LLMs, NLP, information retrieval, recommendation systems, or reinforcement learning.
* Excellent software engineering fundamentals.
* A proactive and self-directed mindset, thriving in an agile, experiment-driven environment.


**Equal opportunity employer**
 We believe that bringing people together from different backgrounds, experiences and perspectives makes for a healthy workplace, a more successful business and a better world. We value diversity and encourage everyone to come and soundtrack the world with us.
   

  

 Welcome to Tune In - our behind-the-scenes video series where we sit down with the brilliant minds shaping the sound and story of Epidemic Sound. In this episode Oscar Höglund, CEO and Co-Founder of Epidemic Sound sits down with Rikard Herlitz, Chief Tech Officer where he shares what makes developers most happy, what velocity means to him and how Epidemic Sound is in the sweet spot when it comes to AI.Thinking about joining us? Tune in - and see if we sound like your kind of vibe.
   

  

**Join our global force of 500+ innovators, blending the latest in tech with the greatest in soundtracking, from our Stockholm HQ to offices in London, New York, Los Angeles, Berlin, Oslo, and Seoul. We’re an industry leader with a startup mentality. We take what we do seriously, but we don’t take ourselves too seriously. Creating and collaborating to transform the sound of streaming, content, and culture. Come join us—and let the world feel your work.**

title: Senior Data Engineer - Tietoevry Tech Services (m/f/d)
description:
As of 2 September 2025, Tietoevry Tech Services, earlier part of Tietoevry Group, will operate as a standalone company. We'll soon be operating under a new name:
 **Vivicta** 
 . You will discover more about our new brand by the end of the year. Read more.
   

  

 You may apply by selecting Apply and fill your application details to the form. You may also Apply by using LinkedIn and populate details to your application from your LinkedIn profile.
   

  

 Är du passionerad av att bygga skalbara datalösningar och möjliggöra insikter med hjälp av modern teknologi för datahantering? Har du erfarenhet av att utveckla och optimera dataplattformar i moln- och hybridmiljöer?
   

  

 Vi söker en Senior Data Engineer inom Data, Analytics och AI till Tietoevry Tech Services. Vi driver transformationer inom kundernas affärsprocesser, applikationer och infrastruktur på den nordiska marknaden.
   

  

**När du börjar på Tietoevry Tech Services som Senior Data Engineer inom Data, Analytics & AI kommer du att**
* Utveckla och optimera dataplattformar och pipelines för att möjliggöra effektiv datahantering
* Arbeta nära kunder och arkitekter för att förstå krav och omsätta dem till tekniska lösningar
* Implementera dataintegrationslösningar, både med hjälp av realtids- och batchflöden
* Säkerställa datakvalitet, säkerhet och prestanda i hela datahanteringskedjan
* Bidra till teknisk dokumentation och kunskapsdelning inom teamet
* Medverka till kontinuerlig utveckling av gruppen och erbjudanden till den svenska marknaden


**Vi söker dig som har**
* Flera års erfarenhet av att arbeta med moderna dataplattformar i molnet (t.ex. MS Fabric, AWS, GCP, Databricks eller Snowflake) och/eller on-prem
* Gedigen kunskap inom SQL, Python och dataarkitekturprinciper
* Erfarenhet av CI/CD, versionshantering av kod och DevOps-principer för Data och Machine Learning
* Förmåga att kommunicera tekniska lösningar på ett tydligt sätt till både tekniska och icke-tekniska intressenter
* Erfarenhet av hybridleveranser med kombination av lokala resurser och near-/offshore-enheter är meriterande
* Flytande svenska och engelska, både i tal och skrift


**Vi erbjuder dig**
 Vi erbjuder dig professionell tillväxt, meningsfulla projekt, en öppen kultur och en enastående balans mellan arbete och fritid. Vi erbjuder dig även en möjlighet att skapa framtiden för en växande, snabbt utvecklande och viktig sektor. Vi tror att vår organisationskultur är en viktig del av att möjliggöra din framgång. Vi tillhandahåller en flexibel hybrid arbetsmodell som en del av vår kultur och vårt arbetssätt. Slutligen tror vi också på nyfikenhet och lärande som en livsstil där du behöver utmana dig själv och lära dig nya färdigheter varje dag när nya möjligheter uppstår.
   

  

**Låter det inspirerande?**
 Vi ser fram emot din ansökan. Vänligen bifoga ditt CV eller din LinkedIn-profil så kontaktar vi dig. Intervjuer kommer att hållas löpande, så vi uppmuntrar dig att ansöka redan idag. Om du har några frågor angående denna roll, vänligen kontakta rekryteringschef Mikael Johansson, mikael.v.johansson@tietoevry.com .
   

  

 Vi hoppas att höra från dig snart.
   

  

*Vi utför bakgrundskontroller på alla slutkandidater.*
*Tietoevry Tech Services avvisar samtal från rekryteringsföretag.*
**Om Tietoevry Tech Services**
 Tietoevry Tech Services är en ledande leverantör av transformations- och IT-drifttjänster, med fokus på nordiska privata och offentliga kunder inom olika branscher.
   

  

 Med vårt kompletta utbud av digitala lösningar – inklusive applikationer, multicloud, data & AI samt säkerhetstjänster – hjälper vi företag att utvecklas och håller de nordiska samhällena i gång. Vi är ett globalt team med över 7 000 experter från mer än 50 nationaliteter och levererar tjänster till våra kunder genom att kombinera globala kapabiliteter med nordisk närhet. Ledd av våra värderingar – jämlikhet, transparens och tillit – strävar vi efter att vara den bästa möjliga arbetsplatsen.
   

  

 Nu söker vi talangfulla personer som vill följa med oss på vår spännande resa mot att bli ett självständigt bolag och tillsammans forma det digitala landskapet i Norden.

title: System Developer within E-mobility
description:
Scania's R&D department is transforming to become part of TRATON Group R&D. TRATON is a group of strong brands with a shared mission: transforming transportation together to create the future of sustainable transport solutions. Within TRATON, we include MAN, Scania, Volkswagen Truck & Bus, and International. As part of a global team of industry experts, you get to think bigger, experience more, and reach further. Together, we have the power to transform transportation.
   

  

 Our values – customer first, respect, team spirit, responsibility, and elimination of waste – are at the heart of everything we do.
   

  

**Role Summary**
 As a system developer your job is to drive and coordinate development, testing and management of the Electro Mechanical Power Takeoffs according to TRATON Product development process and its breakdown in terms of Embedded systems release process.
   

  

 You will also be responsible for user function development related to electrical power take-offs (PTO) in our battery electric vehicles (BEV). A user function is a complete functionality at the vehicle level viewed from the end-user perspective. It is designed to meet the needs of the end-users, and to enhance their user experience. This role involves collaboration with various departments and teams to ensure seamless integration and functionality of PTO solutions.
   

  

**Job Responsibilities**
* Supervise the integration of EMPTO systems into electric vehicles, ensuring smooth functionality and optimal performance.
* Safety and Security: Ensure the safety, security, and reliability of the system throughout its lifecycle.
* System Documentation: Maintain comprehensive and up-to-date documentation for all system components, processes, and standards.
* Support to Testing, Production & Aftermarket: Collaborate with testing teams to support system validation, and assist production and aftermarket teams with troubleshooting and issue resolution.
* Lifecycle Product Maintenance: Address field quality issues, ensuring the product remains operational throughout its lifecycle with continuous improvements and updates.
* Product Data Management: Manage and update product data, including systems such as OAS (Operational Assessment System).
* Development to Production to Aftermarket Support: Provide ongoing support across the full product life cycle, from development through to production and aftermarket services.


 You also:
   

  

 Develop user functions related to electrical power take-offs, ensuring they meet the needs of the users and align with Scania and TRATON’s needs.
   

  

 Collaborate with various departments and teams to ensure seamless integration and functionality of power take-offs.
   

  

**Who You Are**
 You are probably some or all the following:
   

  

 A person who takes initiative and takes responsibility for your deliveries.
   

  

 A clear communicator.
   

  

 You are interested in how the vehicles work from a system perspective.
   

  

 You have 5+ years of experience in the automotive industry within system- or function development
   

  

 Some valuable skills and experiences that could help in the day-to-day work include:
   

  

 Electric vehicle related experience.
   

  

 Project Management and leadership skills.
   

  

 If you feel that you do not tick all of these boxes but still believe you would be a good fit for the role, please send in your application anyway! We believe that the right person is more important than the exact right experience.
   

  

 We welcome applicants from all backgrounds – your unique experience and perspectives is valuable to us.
   

  

**This Is Us**
 You will become part of a team of 16 people with the plan to grow during the year. We are responsible for developing the charging system and user functions related to charging and electrical power take-offs. Your future colleagues come from all over the world - leading to a very diverse and global work context. Everything we do is focused on electrification and developing solutions for sustainable transport solutions!
   

  

 As a manager I believe in creating value together as a strong and high performing team. Magic does not happen behind a screen in a virtual meeting, but rather at the coffee machine in a fika-break between the meetings. I love seeing people working together to solve complex issues, and I think I have done so since I was young and played a lot of different sports - where being part of a team has always been the common denominator in what I have chosen to do in my free time.
   

  

 Within TRATON Group R&D, you are an important part of something bigger. Joining us means gaining access to the ins and outs of the entire transportation industry. As part of a global team of industry experts, you get to think bigger, experience more, and reach further. Being bigger also means being stronger. Together with our brands, we have the collective power to transform transportation.
   

  

**We Offer**
 We offer a dynamic, flexible workplace with hybrid work options, including Scania Sergel and Midway hubs. With a structured development plan and courses, TRATON Group R&D supports your career growth both locally and internationally.
   

  

 Benefits include wellness allowance, TRATON result bonus, flexible hours, and company car leasing. We also host events for employees and their families, and Stockholm residents enjoy direct access to Södertälje via Scania Job express buses.
   

  

**Application**
 Your application should include a CV and any relevant certificates. We welcome all applicants and strive for diversity in our recruitment processes.
   

  

 Apply as soon as possible, no later than 2025-11-15. Screening will take place on an ongoing basis during the application period. Logical and personality tests may be used as part of the selection process, and a background check may be required for this role.
   

  

 If you have questions or would like more information, please contact:
   

  

 Johanna Lehander, Unit manager, johanna.lehander@scania.com
   

  

 We look forward to your application!

title: Design Specialist
description:
**Packet Core Design Expert / Architect – 5G CNF Onboarding (Nokia CMM, CMG, HLD, LLD, CiOs, EU passport)** 




  





 For our Scandinavian Client we need a Nokia skilled Packet Core expert - Design or Architect level !
 



 for a 5G CNF Onboarding project to work on CMM and CMG design documents as HLD, LLD, CiQs,
 



  





**Packet Core Design Expert / Architect** 




**Start ASAP ( project has started)** 




 Length: 6 month +
 



 Location: Scandinavia / Sweden preferable
 



 (Must be willing to travel to Sweden 1 - 2x per month)
 



  





**A candidate shall hold EU citizenship / Work permit** 




  





  





 Project info
 



 To ensure the successful onboarding, configuration, and functional validation of Nokia CMM and CMG Cloud-Native Functions (CNFs) on VMware Telco Cloud Automation (TCA), enabling high-performance, standards-compliant 5G Packet Core operations. The Packet Core Expert will lead efforts in CNF behavior analysis, configuration strategy, E2E testing, and automation alignment, while mentoring teams and driving continuous improvement.
 



  





 Required Expertise
 


* 8+ years in EPC/5GC Packet Core domain
* Good experience in the use of GitLab to manage CICD Pipelines for automated Integration and Deployment
* Hands-on experience with
 **Nokia CMM and CMG CNFs**
* Proficiency in packet-capture tools (
 **Wireshark, TShark** 
 ) and traffic generators
* Familiarity with common tools for Source Code Archival, Configuration Management, Test Automation.
* Prior CNF onboarding experience on VMware TCA.
* Familiarity with Python scripting for test automation.

title: SAP S/4HANA Developer
description:

 About Company: US3 Consulting is a leading European IT recruitment agency dedicated to connecting top tech talent with innovative companies across the continent. With decades of experience and a fresh approach, we specialize in rapid, cost-effective candidate sourcing across all tech industry sectors. Our expert consultants are committed to building strong, productive relationships, ensuring the perfect fit between candidates and employers.
 



  





 Job Title: SAP S/4HANA Developer

 Relevant Experience Required: 8+ years in SAP ABAP development including significant exposure to S/4HANA implementation projects.
 



 Job Type: Contract
 



 Contract Duration: A minimum duration of 6 months, with the possibility of extension up to 18 months or beyond, depending on project requirements.
 



 Workplace Type: On-site (5 days a week at office)

1. Candidates must hold a valid work permit or visa to work in the Sweden
2. If you currently possess a valid work visa for Europe or the UK, we can support the process of securing work authorization for the Netherlands

 About Client: Client offers a dynamic environment where innovation and professional growth are at the forefront. With a strong emphasis on continuous learning, the company provides employees access to extensive training programs, including LinkedIn Learning and an Education Assistance Program.
 



 The company champions a balanced work-life culture, promoting flexible work hours and a supportive atmosphere that values diversity and inclusion. As a part of the esteemed group, it combines global opportunities with a commitment to employee well-being, making it an ideal workplace for those seeking both professional excellence and personal fulfillment.
 



  





**Key Responsibilities** 



* Design, develop, test, and support ABAP objects within an S/4HANA greenfield implementation.
* Collaborate closely with SAP functional consultants to deliver, maintain, and enhance system functionalities.
* Build professional working relationships with team members and stakeholders to ensure smooth delivery of solutions.

* Experience in Fiori Launchpad configuration and adaptation projects.
* Knowledge of OPD Forms and UI design principles.



  





 Interested? Apply Now!

 🔗 Follow us on LinkedIn for more exciting opportunities: https://www.linkedin.com/company/us3-consulting

title: Experienced Backend Developer - Tracking Information Team, Solna
description:
*Are you ready to make an impact on millions of lives every day? Join us at PostNord, where your work will help shape the future of logistics across the Nordics!*
*In our team, we build and run the central event manager - the engine that handles millions of events every day. What we do is at the heart of PostNord’s digital ecosystem, enabling everything from parcel tracking to future innovations. We care deeply about quality, ownership, and making life easier for our users - whether they’re customers, colleagues, or developers in other teams. You’ll join a group of curious, collaborative people who enjoy solving real problems together.*
**Be part of the Tracking Information Team**
* We deliver services that impact millions of customers and recipients in the Nordics daily, ensuring they are accessible through platforms like our website and the PostNord app.
* You’ll help build backend solutions that keep things running smoothly for millions of people — making deliveries more reliable and everyday life a little easier, one package at a time. We care about quality and user experience, and you’ll play a key role in making sure our systems live up to that.
* We develop microservices in Kubernetes.
* Our infrastructure is hosted on AWS.
* We prioritize quality and robustness in our deliveries, as they directly affect our customers.
* We take full ownership of our services—from design and development to security, monitoring, and business metrics. With DevOps, we ensure quality at every step.
* We deploy multiple times a week, seeing the value of our work immediately.
* Our team takes responsibility for optimizing our work processes, using practices like mob and pair programming to enhance collaboration, quality, and collective knowledge.
* We collaborate closely with IT teams at PostNord, as well as production units, management, customers, and partners, to capture requirements and ensure our deliveries meet expectations. We’re passionate about what we do, and we want you to join us in shaping the future of logistics!


 ,
   

  

**Who are you?**
 You're a developer with a solid foundation — whether that comes from formal studies or hands-on experience - and you're always looking to grow. You like solving real and complex problems, working in agile teams, and building things that actually help people.
   

  

* You’re into backend development and curious about building robust systems with a great user experience.
* You’re interested in cloud technologies (like AWS) and Java is one of your go-to languages — or one you’re excited to learn more about.
* You take ownership of what you build — from first commit to production and beyond.
* You’re driven by making everyday life simpler for customers, colleagues, and users.


 You’re someone who communicates clearly and openly — whether it’s in code reviews, standups, or just helping a teammate out.
   

  

**Valuable Skills And Experience**
**AWS:** 
 Sound/Basic experience with AWS components such as DynamoDB, Lambda, S3 bucket and CDK/Cloudformation. SQS/Kinesis will be bonus.
   

  

**What we value:** 
 Hands-on experience is great, but a willingness to learn and build serverless solutions is just as important.
   

  

**Java:** 
 We work with Java 21/SE+ and Spring Boot, and we emphasize writing stable, well-tested code.
   

  

**What we value:** 
 Basic knowledge is essential, and we’ll support you in deepening your expertise. Good understanding of Java 21+ and Spring Boot for developing backend applications. I am eager to learn and grow skills for developing cloud native applications using AWS.
   

  

 Kafka (or real data streaming tools) will be bonus
   

  

**Github/Docker and (AWS EKS):** 
 These tools help us scale and orchestrate our applications.
   

  

**What we value:** 
 Some familiarity is helpful, but not required—we’ll help you get up to speed.
   

  

 Basic knowledge will suffice from the task completion via code development till production deployment
   

  

**REST API Services And OpenAPI Documentation (aka Swagger)**
 We use REST APIs and Swagger for defining and documenting secure web services.
   

  

**What we value:** 
 If you’ve worked with APIs before, great! If not, we’ll guide you through it.
   

  

**Prometheus And Grafana**
 Monitoring and visualization tools that help us ensure performance and reliability.
   

  

**What we value** 
 : No prior experience needed—we’ll provide on-the-job training.
   

  

 Knowledge of prometheus/grafana will be bonus
   

  

 You’ve probably studied something like Computer Science or Information Systems — or maybe you’ve picked up your skills in other ways. What matters most is that you know your stuff. You’re comfortable communicating in both Swedish and English, whether it’s in writing or in conversation.
   

  

**What We Offer**
* Step into a dynamic hybrid workplace where collaboration, creativity, and innovation are at the heart of everything we do.
* Grow with us! We support your development with opportunities for career advancement—including sponsorship for AWS certifications.
* Feel secure with comprehensive insurance and pension plans that have you covered.
* Stay healthy and energized with a wellness allowance to Arkens gym and pool.
* Enjoy exclusive perks through PostNord Plus, giving you access to a wide range of employee benefits.


**Making everyday life easier**
 PostNord is the leading provider of communication and logistics solutions to, from, and within the Nordics. We ensure postal services for individuals and businesses in Sweden and Denmark. Our goal is to make everyday life simpler and more sustainable for everyone in the Nordics.
   

  

 We are accountable, courageous, and committed, effectively leading change for ourselves and others. We value teamwork, honesty, and positive relationships in the workplace. By embracing diversity, we create better outcomes for the business.
   

  

**Apply Now**
 What are you waiting for? Take the next step in your career and join us in creating extraordinary solutions for millions across the Nordics! Selections and interviews are conducted on an ongoing basis, so apply as soon as possible. If you have any questions about the position, feel free to email robert.svensson-eshraghi@postnord.com

title: Principal Salesforce Developer
description:
At Optimizely, we're on a mission to help people unlock their digital potential. We do that by reinventing how marketing and product teams work to create and optimize digital experiences across all channels. With Optimizely One, our industry-first operating system for marketers, we offer teams flexibility and choice to build their stack their way with our fully SaaS, fully decoupled, and highly composable solution.
   

  

 We are proud to help more than 10,000 businesses, including H&M, PayPal, Zoom, and Toyota, enrich their customer lifetime value, increase revenue and grow their brands. Our innovation and excellence have earned us numerous recognitions as a leader by industry analysts such as Gartner, Forrester, and IDC, reinforcing our role as a trailblazer in MarTech.
   

  

 At our core, we believe work is about more than just numbers -- it's about the people. Our culture is dynamic and constantly evolving, shaped by every employee, their actions and their stories. With over 1500 Optimizers spread across 12 global locations, our diverse team embodies the "One Optimizely" spirit, emphasizing collaboration and continuous improvement, while fostering a culture where every voice is heard and valued.
   

  

 Join us and become part of a company that's empowering people to unlock their digital potential!
   

  

 To get a sneak peek into our culture, find us on Instagram: @optimizely
   

  

**Introduction**
 Optimizely is seeking an Salesforce Developer who will report to the Director of Business Enablement, Information Technology. This role will primarily work with the Sales Operations team as well as other departmental system administrators of enterprise software applications.
   

  

 This role will ensure that Optimizely’s Salesforce instance is both scalable and meeting the needs of the business operations. You will requiore extensive experience in designing and implementing CPQ solutions within Salesforce for subscription-based business operations.
   

  

 You will guide our Salesforce strategy by championing the best practice usage of the system and its integrations with other systems like NetSuite, Gainsight, and Marketo as well as satellite software and third-party integration tools like Celigo and Workato.
   

  

**Job Responsibilities**
* Gather (or work closely with business analysts) requirements from various stakeholders relating to changes in integrations for projects related to enterprise systems, integrations, processes, change control, and operations
* Facilitate discussions with business owners in working sessions to understand requirements, find common ground, and evaluate acceptable solutions
* Create and maintain documentation on enterprise systems and satellite system integrations
* Create/update and maintain documentation in partnership with cross-departmental teams related to process and operations when related to specific work
* Develop User Acceptance Testing scenarios, identify test criteria and test new functionality/enhancements
* Identify gaps in process, operations, and systems
* Work with IT Infrastructure, enterprise system subject matter experts, and other resources to design and review technical designs and project plans for fit and purpose in accordance with system best practices
* Understand data flows between enterprise systems, in collaboration with our Enterprise Architect
* Develop and maintain trust cross-departmentally
* Work with Enterprise Architect on enterprise system roadmap
* Maintain backlog of work for IT business system analysts and project team members as appropriate
* Research, pilot, and recommend emerging technology to the IT Software Portfolio Manager
* Stay current with technological developments within the Salesforce platform, monitoring and planning for the organization to utilize new release functionality as it becomes available
* Log and track work in a structured ticketing system (JIRA) and manages changes sets in accordance with best practice
* Lead the design and implementation of CPQ solutions to optimize pricing strategies and streamline quote processes
* Work in conjunction with product development teams to ensure Salesforce solutions align with product offerings and business goals
* Design and implement integrations between Salesforce ,CPQ and NetSuite to enhance data accuracy and streamline operations
* Provide support and be available for collaboration with team members and stakeholders across different time zones, ensuring coverage until 3 PM EST/9 PM CET.


**Knowledge And Experience**
* 5+ years in administrating Salesforce
* 2+ years in deep knowledge and practice of Apex code
* Salesforce certifications as Administrator and Platform Developer and/or an architect track certification
* Experience in building complex Salesforce solution designs and reviewing/enhancing solution designs from other SFDC delivery teammates; including a working knowledge of Salesforce platform limits, order of execution, data storage impacts, and sharing and visibility
* Solid knowledge of Agile development methodologies
* Experience with Sales Cloud, Service Cloud, CPQ, & Communities required
* Knowledge of what can and should be done with configuration vs. code and adheres to a “configuration before code” mindset to minimize cost and complexity and maximize scalability
* Experience designing or building Salesforce integrations with third-party applications
* Ability to create webhooks and work with API


**Education**
* Salesforce Certifications:
* Platform Developer I and II Advanced Administrator
* Bonus: SFDC certifications: CPQ Specialist, Application Architect, System Architect; Celigo Certifications


 Optimizely is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Optimizely is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status.

title: Thesis work in Machine Learning 30 hp - Multimodal Modeling for Vehicle Fault Diagnosis
description:
**Introduktion:**
 Scania is undergoing a transformation from being a supplier of trucks, buses and engines to a supplier of complete and sustainable transport solutions. A critical success factor in the shift to becoming a world-leading provider of transport solutions is the operational availability of vehicles. The belief is that the importance of uptime will be even further accentuated going forward.
   

  

**Background:**
 At Scania, fault diagnosis plays a central role in ensuring vehicle uptime, reliability, and customer satisfaction. Current diagnostic systems often rely on single-modality data (e.g. sensor signals or textual descriptions), which limits their ability to capture the full context of complex vehicle faults. Scania’s vehicles and service systems generate a rich set of multimodal data sources, including sensor measurements, fault codes, service records, images, and technician comments. The growing availability of multimodal data opens new opportunities to improve diagnostic coverage and model interpretability by learning from multiple perspectives simultaneously.
   

  

 Recent advances in multimodal machine learning, such as models like CLIP (Contrastive Language–Image Pretraining) and BLIP (Bootstrapped Language–Image Pretraining), have demonstrated the potential of combining visual and textual information for more robust understanding and prediction. Extending these ideas to the automotive domain could enable new ways of diagnosing complex faults by integrating text, image, and sensor data into a unified representation.
   

  

**Assignment:**
 This thesis project aims to develop knowledge and methods that advance data-driven diagnostics. By exploring how different types of data contribute to predictive performance, the project will help build more accurate, explainable, and intelligent diagnostic systems for Scania vehicles.
   

  

**The work will involve:**
* Investigating how diverse data modalities can be effectively fused and aligned.
* Benchmarking state-of-the-art multimodal alignment and fusion models.
* Evaluating model performance using established metrics and explainability analyses.
* Building a multimodal pipeline that integrates different data types (text, image, sensor, etc.) for vehicle fault diagnosis.
* Proposing potential improvements or extensions for future applications.


**Education And Skills:**
 We are looking for a master’s student in Machine Learning, Data Science, Computer Science, or a related field, who possesses knowledge or experience in:
   

  

  

* Machine learning algorithms and deep learning concepts.
* Python and machine learning frameworks such as TensorFlow or PyTorch.
* Experience with cloud platforms such as AWS is considered a merit.


 An analytical, communicative, and collaborative mindset will ensure you thrive in our supportive and dynamic team. Fluency in English is required.
   

  

**Contact:**
 Supervisor: Hsiao-Chun Hu, Advanced Analytics & AI Solutions (TGROSSA)
   

  

 hsiao-chun.hu@se.traton.com
   

  

**Application:**
 Number of students: 1-2
   

  

 Start date: Spring 2026
   

  

 Estimated time needed: 20 weeks (30 credits), Full-time
   

  

 Language: English
   

  

 Location: Södertälje, hybrid work possible
   

  

 Your application must include a CV, personal letter and transcript of grades.
   

  

**A background check might be conducted for this position. We are conducting interviews continuously and may close the recruitment earlier than the date specified.**
