title: Head of Cybersecurity Strategy & Transformation
description:
**Securitas Group**


Securitas is a world-leading safety and security solutions partner that **helps make your world a safer place**. By leveraging technology in partnership with our clients, we offer a broad portfolio of value-enhancing services and solutions integrated across the security value chain – from on-site services to advanced monitoring, comprehensive risk prediction and advisory services.


With around 336 000 employees in 44 markets, our innovative, holistic approach with local and global expertise makes us a trusted business partner to many of the world’s best-known companies. Benefitting from almost nine decades of deep experience and guided by our values of integrity, vigilance, and helpfulness, we create sustainable value by helping our clients optimize their operations and protect what matters most - their people and assets.

 **Securitas IT**


Securitas vision is to become the Intelligent Protective Services Partner through being client centric, data driven, and people focused. Our protective services help make your world a safer place.


Securitas IT is a global function that creates the capabilities of a modern and powerful IT technology needed to fulfil Securitas business strategy. We develop and invest in technology and people. Our co-workers support digital products and services for clients and transforming and protecting our existing IT landscape, making sure our colleagues all over the world can work efficiently in a modern IT environment.


We are now looking for the **Head of Cybersecurity Strategy & Transformation** who would work directly with the Group CISO to define, drive, and execute the global cybersecurity strategy. As a core member of the CISO leadership team, the role shapes and steers the organization’s cybersecurity direction, ensuring that the CISO’s vision is translated into cohesive transformation initiatives, measurable results, and strong alignment across all business and technology domains. Acting as both a **strategic leader and a transformation supervisor**, this position bridges global strategy and execution — fostering collaboration, efficiency, and shared accountability across cybersecurity and business teams.

**Responsibilities**

**1. Strategic Definition & Alignment**

* Define and evolve the global cybersecurity strategy in alignment with corporate objectives, business priorities, and regulatory expectations, under the leadership of the Group CISO.
* Build and maintain a multi-horizon roadmap that balances short-term delivery, mid-term competitiveness, and long-term resilience.
* Challenge assumptions, shape priorities, and guide strategic decision-making based on risk, business impact, and value creation.
* Shape and align the Cybersecurity Operating Model to position cybersecurity as a global services platform, ensuring coherence, scalability, and relevance to business needs across the enterprise.
* Define a unified cybersecurity vision that integrates technology initiatives, business enablement, and organizational transformation as core pillars of the Group CISO’s strategy.
* Drive executive communication and governance activities, including board reporting and strategic committees, ensuring clarity, alignment, and transparency.

**2. Transformation & Execution Leadership**

* Collaborate closely with the Group CISO and the CISO leadership team to lead the execution of the cybersecurity strategy across all domains and geographies.
* Mobilize, align, and inspire cybersecurity teams around the CISO’s strategic direction, fostering shared accountability and a unified execution model.
* Oversee global cybersecurity transformation programs and governance structures to drive agility, coherence, and measurable impact.
* Ensure the global coherence and strategic alignment of all cybersecurity programs including core initiatives such as Zero Trust, Cloud Security, Identity & Access Management, and Cyber Resilience as well as business-driven projects and organizational transformation initiatives within the cybersecurity function.
* Oversee the implementation and continuous improvement of the Cybersecurity Operating Model, ensuring its efficiency, scalability, and alignment with business priorities.
* Drive the evolution and delivery of cybersecurity as a global services platform, enabling consistent, value-driven, and cost-effective capabilities available to all business entities.
* Promote an integrated, enterprise-wide vision that connects cyber maturity, business value, and operational excellence, while improving efficiency, resource optimization, and cost-effectiveness across the cybersecurity portfolio.
* Define and track strategic KPIs and KRIs to measure maturity, progress, and outcomes, ensuring visibility and alignment across leadership levels.
* Represent the Group CISO in selected internal and external forums to reinforce strategic consistency and executive visibility.

  

**3. Governance, Communication & Engagement**  



* Ensure a consistent governance model for the cybersecurity department and reporting framework across global and regional cybersecurity functions to ensure alignment with the group CISO vision.
* Act as a link and integrator between the Group CISO and the broader cybersecurity community, ensuring that priorities and transformation objectives are clearly communicated and collectively owned.
* Facilitate stakeholder alignment across IT, Risk, Compliance, Audit, Data Protection, and business units.
* Cascade the cybersecurity strategy across all levels of the organization and ensure clarity of purpose and accountability.
* Promote a results-oriented, change-driven culture that encourages openness, collaboration, and constructive challenge.
* Communicate effectively on the strategic value and impact of cybersecurity to business and executive stakeholders.

**4. Strategic Partnerships, Business Enablement & Innovation**  



* Develop and promote cybersecurity strategies that directly support business objectives, enabling growth, trust, and digital innovation.
* Identify and shape strategic initiatives and partnerships that strengthen the organization’s cybersecurity posture while creating business value such as secure-by-design services, customer trust programs, or ecosystem collaboration.
* Serve as a central point of coordination for cross-company cybersecurity strategy and innovation initiatives.
* Collaborate with corporate strategy, digital transformation, product, and business teams to embed cybersecurity as a competitive advantage in products, platforms, and services.
* Represent the organization in industry, innovation, and regulatory forums, influencing the evolution of cybersecurity standards and fostering external visibility and trust.

**Requirements**

  

* Extensive experience in cybersecurity, strategy, or **transformation leadership roles**, including exposure to complex, **multinational environments.**
* Strong **background in consulting or strategic advisory**, ideally focused on cybersecurity, digital transformation, or enterprise risk.
* **Master’s degree** in Cybersecurity, Information Systems, Strategy, Management, or Risk.
* Solid understanding of cyber risk management, governance frameworks (ISO 27001, NIS2, DORA, GDPR), and large-scale technology ecosystems.
* Proven ability to supervise and orchestrate a global portfolio of cybersecurity programs, ensuring strategic coherence and alignment across technology, risk, operations, and business.
* Demonstrated experience in designing, evolving, and governing a Cybersecurity Operating Model, ensuring global consistency and efficiency
* Ability to engage with senior executives and aligning global stakeholders around common goals, metrics, and transformation priorities.

**Working conditions**


The role is open for candidates based in **Europe**. It involves regular travelling.

 **WHAT WE OFFER**


At Securitas we believe in doing the right thing and doing it well. For our customers and our employees. Our employees come from all walks of life and bring with them a multitude of talents and perspectives. We aim for diverse representation throughout the company, and we are committed to equal pay, safe working conditions, gender balance and an inclusive work environment with a wide range of skills and development opportunities.

  

If it all **sounds good** to you, don’t hesitate to **apply!**

title: Chief Product Officer
description:
**About Net Insight**  

Net Insight is a leading media technology and network solutions company enabling broadcasters, service providers, and enterprises to deliver the highest-quality live video, data, and cloud services worldwide.


Headquartered in Stockholm, Net Insight has long been recognised for innovation in synchronisation, media transport, and cloud-based production workflows. Customers include many of the world’s most prominent broadcasters, telcos, and sports rights holders.


Following a strategic realignment five years ago the product offering has gone through significant modernization which has seen the Net Insight business grow significantly. The company is now from a solid platform entering an exciting new phase, continuing to evolve into a market- and product-led business. All with the aim of continuing the growth of the business. The Chief Product Officer will play a pivotal role in driving this transformation.

**The Opportunity**  

The Chief Product Officer (CPO) will lead the strategic evolution of Net Insight’s product and technology portfolio. This is both a transformational and hands-on role — bringing discipline, transparency, and commercial focus to product strategy while fostering innovation and collaboration across teams.


Reporting directly to the CEO and sitting on the Executive Management Team, the CPO will integrate product and technology strategy, ensuring that innovation, customer insight, and business goals move in lockstep.

**What You’ll Do**

* Lead the Product and Technology organisation, aligning strategy with commercial growth and customer outcomes
* Define and execute the long-term product roadmap with structured yet agile processes
* Champion the transition from hardware-led to software, cloud, and services-driven solutions
* Build a culture of transparency, collaboration, and shared ownership across Product, R&D, and Sales
* Connect technology vision with business opportunity and financial outcomes
* Mentor and empower a high-performing team of Product Managers and technical specialists
  

**What You’ll Bring**

* Senior experience leading cross-functional product organisations in broadcast, media technology, or adjacent B2B tech sectors.
* Proven record of implementing product processes and frameworks from the ground up.
* Experience balancing hardware and SaaS/cloud transitions, with strong commercial awareness and product P&L insight.
* Track record of driving a product- and market-led approach for product development.
* Collaborative, emotionally intelligent leadership that builds trust through transparency and engagement.
* Ability to unite global, cross-functional teams — creating clarity and enabling innovation.
* Inclusive and open-minded approach that promotes collaboration and shared success.

 **The Impact**


This is a rare opportunity to shape the future of product and technology leadership of a respected media tech company at a pivotal inflection point. The CPO will shape not only Net Insight’s product strategy but its culture and trajectory as it becomes a modern, commercially focused, and innovation-driven organisation.

**Location:** Based in Sweden or the UK, with flexibility across the Nordics  

**Reports to:** CEO  

**Contract:** Permanent, full-time  

**Search managed by 808 Talent**

**Disclaimer:**  

This search has been exclusively retained by 808 Talent. All applications, resumes, and candidate introductions, whether submitted directly to the hiring company or through third parties, will be re-routed to 808 Talent for consideration. No fees or payments will be made to unauthorised third-party recruiters or agencies.

 **ABOUT NET INSIGHT**

*Net Insight (Nasdaq: NETI B) provides the highest performing, most open video transport and media cloud technology for content providers as the industry standard for flexibility and service across live contribution, distribution and remote production media workflows.*

*For over 25 years, the world’s leading content owners, broadcasters, production companies, service providers and enterprises have trusted Net Insight’s Emmy Award winning Nimbra technology to guarantee media delivery. Today, Net Insight partners with hundreds of customers in over 70 countries to ensure media flows across managed and unmanaged IP networks, and the cloud – from anywhere, to everywhere. It enables customers to get the best from any mix of virtualized, cloud and IP technology and is the only platform to support all the major industry standards, protocols and clouds.*

 *Welcome to Net Insight, where* ***innovation****,* ***collaboration****, and* ***trust*** *are the cornerstones of our success. As one team, we are committed to delivering value to our customers, contributing to the growth and success of our company. Together we create a dynamic and positive workplace where everyone is valued, engaged and empowered to make an impact*

title: Handelsbanken söker jurist till Group Privacy Office
description:
*Group Privacy Office har ett koncernövergripande operativt verksamhetsansvar för integritets- och dataskyddsfrågor och samordnar det lokala integritets- och dataskyddsarbetet. Vi har påbörjat en spännande förändringsresa mot ett effektivare och förbättrat integritets- och dataskyddsarbete i Handelsbankenkoncernen. Vi söker nu ytterligare en jurist till teamet. Vill du vara med på resan?*

**Arbetsbeskrivning**


Group Privacy Office, GPO, har ett koncernövergripande operativt verksamhetsansvar för integritets- och dataskyddsfrågor i den s.k. första linjen på Handelsbanken. GPO stödjer och samordnar också det lokala integritets- och dataskyddsarbetet som utförs av lokala Privacy Officers. GPO ger råd och stöd till organisationen i deras behandlingar av personuppgifter samt ansvarar för styrning, processer och verktyg för säkerställande av ett kontinuerligt, systematisk och riskbaserat integritets- och dataskyddsarbete.


Som jurist på GPO kommer du ge råd och stöd till organisationen i hanteringen av personuppgifter. Fokus är bland annat följande områden: DPIA, ROPA, personuppgiftsincidenter, säkerställande av registrerades rättigheter (framför allt rätten till information och rätten till tillgång), inbyggt dataskydd och dataskydd som standard, tredjelandsöverföring och DPA. Du kommer också arbeta med styrning och processer för säkerställande av ett kontinuerligt, systematisk och riskbaserat integritets- och dataskyddsarbete. Vidare kommer du arbeta med utbildning och åtgärder för ökad awareness i organisationen, analys och utredning samt bevakande av rättsutvecklingen inom integritets- och dataskyddsområdet.


**Vem är du?**


Du har en svensk juristexamen och minst ett par års arbetslivserfarenhet av integritets- och dataskyddsfrågor från advokatbyrå, bolag, myndighet eller motsvarande. Du har ett stort intresse för integritets- och dataskyddsfrågor och vi ser också gärna att du har ett lika stort intresse för IT. Har du erfarenhet av att arbeta med IT, såväl cloud-tjänster som on-prem lösningar, är det starkt meriterande.


Då vi samarbetar med hela koncernen behöver du behärska god svenska och engelska i både tal och skrift.


Som jurist är du van att arbeta strukturerat enligt processer men kan även omprioritera ditt arbete vid behov. Du trivs med att självständigt ta ansvar och hitta lösningar på uppsatta mål. Du är lyhörd och pedagogisk i din kommunikation som anpassas till situationen och mottagaren, samtidigt som du bidrar till en inkluderande arbetsmiljö genom att ta tillvara på olika perspektiv. Du har hög integritet och ger råd utifrån verksamheten och regelverkskrav.

**Vi erbjuder**


Som jurist hos oss blir du en central del av vår spännande förändringsresa mot ett effektivare och förbättrat integritets- och dataskyddsarbete i Handelsbankenkoncernen. Du kommer få många kontaktytor internt och ges ett stort ansvar och också stora möjlighet att individuellt men också i tätt samarbete med dina kollegor driva olika frågor i bankens integritets- och dataskyddsarbete.


Utöver detta erbjuder vi:

* en trygg och stabil arbetsgivare
* ett dynamiskt och stimulerande arbete
* work-life balance
* kompetens- och karriärutveckling
* inkluderande- och jämställd arbetsmiljö
* konkurrenskraftigt förmånspaket

**Ansökan**


I denna rekrytering samarbetar Handelsbanken med Law Recruitment. För mer information, vänligen kontakta ansvarig rekryteringskonsult Helena Woodcock på helena.woodcock@lawrecruitment.se samt 070-260 36 96. Urval och intervjuer kommer att genomföras löpande så vi ser fram emot din ansökan så snart som möjligt! Observera att vi inte tar emot ansökningar via mail.


Fackliga kontaktpersoner är för Finansförbundet: Per Almshult, per.almshult@handelsbanken.se och Akademikerföreningen: Magdalena Rehnberg, magdalena.rehnberg@handelsbanken.se


Varmt välkommen med din ansökan!

***Vi är Handelsbanken***

*Hos oss får du ett stort eget ansvar och möjlighet att påverka din egen och bankens framtida utveckling. Våra olika perspektiv, insikter och innovativa idéer utgör en grund för hur vi tillsammans bygger vidare banken för framtiden. För oss är utveckling allt och när du utvecklas, utvecklas banken.*

*Vi har ett unikt sätt att bedriva bank som bygger på en stark tilltro och respekt för den enskilda människan. Våra värderingar och starka företagskultur har en avgörande betydelse för vår framgång och guidar oss om hur vi uppnår våra mål, samarbetar och stöttar varandra. Genom stark lokal förankring, ett decentraliserat arbetssätt och ett långsiktigt perspektiv skapar vi hållbara relationer genom livets olika skeenden. Hos oss på Handelsbanken är alla viktiga. Vi kommer från olika platser med olika bakgrund, erfarenhet och utbildning.* *Tillsammans är vi Handelsbanken.*

title: Strategic Product Manager Access (M/F/X)
description:
**ABOUT THE ROLE**

As a Strategic Product Manager, you will play a key role in shaping the direction of a product or portfolio of products. This position requires a strategic thinker with strong leadership skills who can anticipate market shifts, define long-term priorities, and work closely with senior stakeholders to ensure product success.


**YOUR ROLE AND RESPONSIBILITIES**

* You strategize and drive the roadmap for a product portfolio, balancing business goals with customer needs.
* You explore new business opportunities by analysing market dynamics and emerging technologies.
* You translate market insights into actionable product concepts and validate them with stakeholders.
* You establish innovative approaches, including new business models, to strengthen competitiveness.
* You give strategic direction to the Access portfolio, as a trusted advisor internally and externally.
* You inspire teams across Engineering, Sales, Marketing, and Customer support to deliver results, even without direct reporting lines.
* You share best practices and provide guidance to less experienced colleagues, creating a collaborative and growth-oriented environment.
**YOUR PROFILE**

Core Skills :



* You have a proven ability to set a long-term vision and translate it into tangible outcomes.
* You have a strong analytical mindset, with experience in evaluating complex opportunities and making informed decisions.
* You have business acumen, with knowledge of pricing strategies, go-to-market planning, and digital business models (such as SaaS).
* You have excellent communication and influencing skills, with the ability to engage effectively at all levels internal and external to the organization.

Personal Qualities :



* You have an ability to know what is strategic versus non-strategic.
* You are a forward-thinker who thrives in complex and fast-changing environments.
* You have natural leadership through influence, able to unite teams around a common goal.
* You have a customer-focused mindset with an emphasis on delivering value.
* You are enthusiast in developing people and building a culture of innovation.

Background & Experience :



* You have proven success in product management in a high technology focused company, or a related strategic role.
* You have successful track record of bringing innovative products or services to market.
* You are credible in your field, either through experience with customers, partners, or industry peers.
* You have a master’s degree in business, Engineering, Marketing, or a related discipline.

  


**WHAT WE OFFER**
* A strategic position in a company that has been growing the last years.
* A long-term secure job and a permanent contract in the future market of industrial communication and industry 4.0.
* An attractive salary and fringe benefits.
* Opportunities for continuous professional training and development relating to your skills and experience.

**WHO WE ARE**

The HMS Networks Group, which employs more than 1200 people in 20 countries, is an internationally leading provider in the field of Industrial Information & Communication Technology (Industrial ICT).



You will be joining HMS Networks’ Industrial Data Solutions division (IDS), which brings together connected solutions from leading brands such as Ewon®, Red Lion® and N-Tron®.



Driven by a strong customer-centric approach and dynamic growth, HMS has unparalleled expertise in Industrial Data and IIoT—from secure remote connectivity to real-time data visualization and advanced diagnostics.



With a comprehensive industrial vision, HMS delivers solutions that connect machines and devices to the cloud, enable local operational control, and provide clear, actionable data insights. Security and reliability are at the core of every offering, with robust technologies built to meet the demands of harsh industrial environments.



HMS is also a driver of innovation and expansion, following the recent integration of Red Lion® and PEAK-System®, and the launch of Ewon Cloud and Ewon Edge in early 2025.


**We also like to say that we put Heart, Mind and Soul into our work. That's how we create our shared culture and it's a pretty good acronym for that too.**



At HMS, we believe that equal treatment and equal opportunity shall apply to everyone, regardless of ethnicity, nationality, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, religion or other belief, political opinion, social origin, disability, age or any other status protected by applicable laws.



We believe the best ideas come from diverse perspectives working together in a respectful, balanced environment.



Our culture is built on **trust, empathy, and collaboration**, where everyone feels safe to grow, share ideas and find meaning in their work.  

Whether you're seeking **innovation, development**, or **a healthy work-life balance**, you’ll find a place where you can truly thrive.



We value **listening, mentoring**, and **supportive leadership**, and our working conditions are designed to reflect the realities of life, because **success looks different for everyone**.



This commitment applies throughout the employee journey, across all HMS locations.  

  

**Welcome to HMS!**

title: Cloud Architect
description:
Att välja Capgemini innebär att välja en arbetsplats där du ges möjlighet att forma din karriär på det sätt du själv önskar, där du ingår i en stödjande och inspirerande gemenskap med engagerade kollegor världen över, och där du får chansen att omdefiniera vad som är möjligt. Våra Cloud & Custom applications-team fokuserar på att utveckla skräddarsydda cloudapplikationer, integrera IT-system och driva affärstransformation, med leverans av affärskritiska cloudlösningar i hög kvalitet och hastighet, möjliggjort av Generative AI. Bli en del av oss och hjälp världsledande organisationer att frigöra teknikens värde och bygga en mer hållbar och inkluderande framtid!
   

  

**Om rollen**
 Vi söker en Cloud Architect som vill ta molnlösningar till nästa nivå med Amazon Web Services (AWS). Hos oss får du arbeta med det senaste inom säkerhet, infrastruktur, DevSecOps, generativ AI och agentisk AI – och vara med och skapa lösningar som påverkar miljoner människor världen över. I rollen blir du en nyckelperson som förvandlar idéer till verklighet. Du kommer att leda strategiska initiativ på nordisk nivå, inspirera kunder och agera som deras trusted advisor, delta i molnkonferenser, bidra i pre-sales och nätverka med våra partners Amazon, Microsoft och Google.
   

  

 Vi erbjuder karriärmöjligheter i världsklass, projekt inom exempelvis självkörande bilar, livräddande robotar, autonoma system och framtidens AI-lösningar. Du blir en del av ett engagerat team som värdesätter innovation och samarbete – med månatliga aktiviteter och en kultur där vi har kul tillsammans. Vi letar efter fler kollegor som vill hänga med på vår AWS-resa till vårt kontor i Stockholm.
   

  

 Vi arbetar med tekniker som AWS Bedrock, Amazon Q, AWS Quick Suite, AWS Lambda, AWS Control Tower och programmeringsspråk som Java, Python, Node, React, Angular, TypeScript, Kafka, Golang, Kotlin, Terraform och Ansible.
   

  

*I den här rollen kommer du att ha en nyckelroll i:*
* Driva strategi och initiativ inom cloud på nordisk nivå.
* Hjälpa våra kunder med molnarkitektur och cloud native lösningar.
* Använda dig utav generativ och agentisk AI.


**Din profil**
* Minst 6 års erfarenhet av molntjänster som AWS eller GCP.
* Kunskap i ett eller flera programmeringsspråk, t.ex. Python, Java, Kotlin, Golang eller Node.
* Erfarenhet som molnarkitekt eller av att leda molntransformationer.
* Intresse för DevSecOps, generativ AI, agentisk AI och cloud-native lösningar.
* Mycket goda kunskaper i AWS services.
* Flytande svenska och engelska kunskaper, i både tal och skrift.


**Vad vi tror kommer få dig att trivas**
* Arbeta med de senaste teknologierna och påverka på nordisk nivå. Du samarbetar med andra specialister, kompetensväxlar och bidrar till att bygga AWS-kapabilitet i Norden – samtidigt som du påverkar några av världens största bolag.
* Utvecklas genom utbildningar, certifieringar och interna initiativ- Du får tillgång till utbildningar och certifieringar inom AI och AWS samt möjlighet att engagera dig i Capgeminis fokusområden som Diversity & Inclusion, Sustainability, Wellness Club och Art Club.
* Njut av en engagerande arbetsplats med starkt stöd och förmåner. Vi erbjuder friskvårdsbidrag, tjänstepension, bonusprogram, företagshälsovård och sjukvårdsförsäkring – samt en inkluderande kontorskultur med sociala aktiviteter och teambuilding.


**Ansökan**
*Redo att ta din karriär till nästa nivå? Ansök nu och bli en del av Capgemini Sveriges innovativa AWS-team! Ansök redan idag – vi hanterar ansökningarna löpande. Under processen får du chansen att kika in på vårt kontor, prata med vår rekryterande chef och självklart ställa alla dina nyfikna frågor till vår rekryterare. Varmt välkommen in med din ansökan!*
*Som en del av vår rekryteringsprocess kommer identitetskontroll att genomföras genom granskning av ditt ID-kort, och bakgrundskontroller kan utföras vid behov.*
 Till denna roll söker vi medarbetare för säkerhetsklassat uppdrag placerad hos kund.
   

  

 Hos våra kunder arbetar vi i leveranser som kan ha bland annat #AWS, #GCP, #Google, Azure, AliCloud, Java, Go/Golang, Python, Kotlin, Node, HTML, TypeScript, JavaScript, CSS, Java, CloudFormation, Terraform, Docker, Kafka, React, Angular, Vue, Bash, Spring, GenAI, GraphQL, Backstage, Kubernetes, LLM, RAG, Copilot, GitHub Actions, SonarQube, BlackDuck, Apache Beam, Kong, Jenkins, Apigee, OpenShift, Ansible, DevSecOps, cloud architecture, cloud assessments, integration, Snowflake, Elastic Search, Grafana, Kibana, Splunk, Databricks, HelmChart, CloudFoundry.'
   

  

 #Innovation #creativity #future #careers #AWS
   

  

**Om Capgemini**
 Capgemini är en global partner inom affärs- och tekniktransformation som hjälper organisationer att påskynda övergången till en digital och hållbar värld, och samtidigt gör skillnad för företag och samhälle. Det är en ansvarsfull och mångsidig organisation med 340 000 medarbetare i över 50 länder. Med ett starkt arv som sträcker sig över 55 år tillbaka har Capgemini sina kunders förtroende att hjälpa dem frigöra värdet av teknik för att tillgodose hela deras affärsbehov. Capgemini levererar helhetslösningar som utnyttjar styrkan från strategi och design till teknik. Allt drivet av en marknadsledande kapacitet inom AI, generativ AI, moln och data, kombinerat med en djup branschexpertis och ett ekosystem av partners. År 2024 rapporterade Capgemini Group globala intäkter på 22,1 miljarder euro.
   

  

**Get The Future You Want** 
 | www.capgemini.com

title: TechOps Data and Process Excellence lead
description:
**Company Description**
***Statistics show that women and underrepresented groups tend to apply to jobs only if they meet 100% of the qualifications. Sobi encourages you to change that statistic and apply. Rarely do candidates meet 100% of the qualifications. We look forward to your application!***
 At Sobi, the work we do every day redefines the standards of care and transform the lives of people living with rare diseases.
   

  

 As a diverse team of entrepreneurial people, we are passionate about our growth journey towards becoming a global leader, making a difference for rare disease patients, moving quickly and always challenging the status quo.
   

  

 We are committed to an inclusive, sustainable and flexible workplace that fosters growth and development.
   

  

**Job Description**
 The TechOps Data and Process Excellence lead drives operational excellence and digital transformation across Sobi’s Technical Operations. The role ensures optimized and robust work processes, effective use of digital tools and systems, and reliable performance analysis. By leading cross-functional collaboration, the role enables TechOps to achieve its long-term ambition of delivering cost-efficient, compliant, and sustainable products to patients.
   

  

 This position is based at our Global Headquarters in Stockholm, Sweden or Global hub in Basel, Switzerland, reporting directly to VP Head of Tech Ops Product and Program management.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Define and deliver the TechOps Operational Excellence and Digitalization roadmap.
* Drive and develop a network of Operational Excellence and Digitalization champions across TechOps through education and coaching.
* Lead the improvement of TechOps process landscape, systems, and tools by Identifying, evaluating (benefit vs. cost/effort) and track cross functional improvement opportunities; project manage where appropriate.
* Embed the Global Business Process Ownership structure; act as Process Owner where required
* Develop the TechOps organization with regards to data utilization and digital innovation
* Partner with the TO leadership team to evaluate, design, and execute strategic improvement initiatives. Analyze data, visualize organizational performance, and support senior stakeholder communication.
* Promote a strong culture of continuous improvement by leading root cause analyses, learning reviews, and global knowledge sharing.
* Ensure efficient training programs across TechOps.


**Qualifications**
**About you**
 You are an experienced leader in the pharmaceutical industry who thrives on driving transformation and building collaborative ways of working. You combine a strong foundation in operational excellence with a passion for digitalization and data-driven decision-making. You are comfortable working in a matrixed environment, influencing senior stakeholders, and developing teams and leaders across functions. You are ambitious, strategic, and analytical, with a genuine interest in people and fostering a culture of continuous improvement.
   

  

**Key Qualifications**
* University degree in manufacturing, supply chain, or equivalent experience.
* Minimum 10 years of pharmaceutical industry experience, including organizational development.
* Proven expertise in Operational Excellence methodologies (Lean, Six Sigma, or similar) in a virtual setting.
* Experience in digital tool and system optimization, including AI application.
* Strong capability in data analysis, performance visualization, and business reporting.
* Demonstrated success in collaborative leadership, team development, and cross-functional influence.
* Excellent strategic planning, operational, and analytical skills.
* Strong business drive with solid influencing and negotiation abilities.
* Ability to work independently, take initiative, and drive results.
* Proven ability to motivate and collaborate across functional areas, including at Executive Committee level.
* Strong interpersonal, organizational, and communication skills (written, oral, listening).
* Fluent in English.


 Here at Sobi we live by our core values: Care, Ambition, Urgency, Ownership and Partnership!
   

  

**Additional Information**
**How to apply**
 We have an ongoing selection process in this recruitment and ask you to send your application as soon as possible. Click apply and include your resume in English.
   

  

**Why Join Us?**
 Here At Sobi, Our Mission And Culture Get Us Excited To Come To Work Every Day, But Here Are a Few More Reasons To Join Our Team
   

  

* Emphasis on work/life balance
* Collaborative and team-oriented environment
* Opportunities for professional growth
* Diversity and Inclusion
* Competitive compensation for your work
* Making a positive impact to help ultra-rare disease patients who are in need of life saving treatments


 We are a global company with over 1,900 employees in more than 30 countries and are committed to the societies where we operate. With a deeply skilled management team directing our day-to-day wins, and a Board with a stellar track record, we’re ready to take on the world’s diseases, ailments and adversity. Our people believe they have the power to make a positive impact in others’ lives because that’s exactly what we do here. If you’re seeking a career that taps into your talents in a way that makes the world a better, healthier place, we just may have a job for you.
   

  

 We know our employees are our most valuable asset, and our culture conveys that. We offer a competitive benefits package, to support the health and happiness of our staff.
   

  

**Sobi Culture**
 At Sobi, we refuse to accept the status quo. This is because we have witnessed first-hand the challenges facing those affected by rare diseases and have used this knowledge to shape our business to find new ways of helping them.
   

  

 As a specialized biopharmaceutical company, we are dedicated to rare diseases. And we see this focus as a strength. By effectively turning our research into ground-breaking treatments, we help make medicine more accessible and open up more possibilities for patients and more opportunities for those caring for them. This has been our approach since day one, but we know we can’t change the world of rare diseases on our own. Accomplishing this requires strong partnerships with patients, partners and stakeholders across the entire value chain. Together, we define how our business can create solutions that serve the needs of those affected by rare diseases while facilitating sustainable growth.

title: Customer Success Manager
description:
🌍
 **Customer Success Manager | SaaS Unicorn (Legal Tech)** 




  





 📍 Stockholm (On-site) | 💼 Fast-Growth SaaS | 💰 Competitive + Equity
 



  





 🚀
 **Europe’s next SaaS unicorn is hiring.** 




  





 Founded in 2023, this legal tech scale-up has already achieved
 **413% YoY growth** 
 , is on track for
 **200 employees by end of 2025** 
 and
 **400 by 2026** 
 , and is quickly becoming one of the most talked-about success stories in European SaaS.
 



  





 They’re now looking for a
 **Customer Success Manager** 
 to join their Stockholm HQ and take ownership of a portfolio of high-value clients in the legal and professional services sector.
 



  





 💡 What You’ll Be Doing
 



  




* Own a portfolio of
 **5–15 strategic accounts** 
 worth €2.5M–€3M ARR
* Build strong, long-term relationships with senior stakeholders at top law firms & professional services companies
* Drive onboarding, adoption, renewals, and expansion opportunities
* Run QBRs, identify upsell/cross-sell potential, and act as the
 **trusted advisor** 
 for your clients
* Partner closely with Product & Engineering to make the customer voice heard
* Roll up your sleeves and help
 **shape the CS function** 
 as one of the early hires



  





 ✅ What We’re Looking For
 



  




* **Fluent in English + one of:** 
 French, Spanish, German, Portuguese, Polish, or Arabic
* **4–6 years’ experience** 
 in SaaS, consulting, or the legal/professional services world
* Strong track record in
 **client-facing roles** 
 with senior stakeholders
* Commercially minded, relationship-driven, and comfortable in a high-growth, ever-changing environment
* Someone who wants to make an
 **impact at ground level** 
 and grow as the company scales



  





 🌟 Why This Role?
 



  




* Join a company on track to unicorn status within just a few years
* Early equity participation — benefit from the scale-up’s success story
* Huge career trajectory: early hires will shape the function and the culture
* Work in a
 **fast-paced, entrepreneurial environment** 
 where your ideas matter

title: Azure Architect
description:
We now have a new requirement and are looking for a consultant colleague with the qualifications listed below. The position is part of our consulting business, which means you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments.
   

  

*As part of your application, you may be presented to clients/partners as part of the recruitment process. If selected for the assignment, you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments as part of our consulting business.*
**Your Profile (Must-have Requirements)**
 Solid experience as an Azure Architect in complex system landscapes
   

  

 Proven track record designing integration solutions involving D365 Finance & Operations
   

  

 Strong proficiency in:
   

  

 Azure Logic Apps
   

  

 Azure Functions
   

  

 API Management
   

  

 Azure Key Vault
   

  

 Azure Service Bus
   

  

 Experience with Azure DevOps, CI/CD, and Git version control
   

  

 Ability to translate business requirements into robust technical architecture
   

  

 Excellent communication skills and the ability to work cross-functionally
   

  

**Meritorious**
 Experience supporting D365 implementations from an architectural perspective
   

  

 Microsoft certifications within Azure and/or D365
   

  

**Application deadline:** 
 20-11-2025
   

  

**About Us**
 We currently employ experienced consultants in areas such as System Development, AI, Machine Learning, Testing, Cloud, Infra DevOps, and IT Project Management.
   

  

 Working at Deploja is something entirely different from working at an ordinary consulting company—and we are really proud of that. So, what makes us unique?
   

  

 We simply offer more than just a high salary and greater freedom; that’s just the beginning. With us, you’ll find the work environment and opportunities you deserve. Welcome to Deploja, where the grass is indeed greener!
   

  

**Vi erbjuder dig följande, Valet är ditt!**
 🚀 Exciting assignments with our many clients. We focus on long-term projects, which gives you the opportunity to create value for the client while also developing yourself.
   

  

 🌟 A secure monthly salary – together we’ll agree on a base salary depending on your assignments.
   

  

 🚗 Company car – we encourage you to choose an electric car for a more sustainable future.
   

  

 💼 Occupational pension and great opportunities for salary conversion.
   

  

 🌴 Vacation – Would you like more than 30 days of vacation, perhaps 60 days?
   

  

 🏥 Private health insurance, accident insurance, and life insurance for increased security.
   

  

 📚 Skills development – you set your own budget and choose the training you wish to attend.
   

  

 🕑 Quality of life – Are you struggling to balance everyday life and wish to work a little less while still earning as much, if not more?
   

  

*We handle applications continuously, and due to the high workload, it's especially important to include a short motivation for the position, explaining how you meet the requirements.*

title: AI Security & Governance Lead
description:
**The role** 




 • Define and lead AI governance: policies, standards, model risk management, and review processes.
 



 • Implement security and privacy controls for data and models (secrets, access, PII handling, auditing).
 



 • Align with legal/compliance on GDPR and emerging frameworks (e.g., EU AI Act, NIST AI RMF).
 



 • Introduce evaluation, documentation, and approvals for AI releases (model cards, DPIAs, playbooks).
 



 • Drive training and awareness; partner with Product/Engineering to balance velocity and safety.
 



  





**What you bring** 




 • MSc/BSc in Information Security/Computer Science/Law & Tech or similar.
 



 • 7+ years in security, risk, or compliance; 3+ years in data/AI or model-driven systems.
 



 • Experience with ISO 27001/SOC 2 controls, cloud security, identity, and secrets management.
 



 • Strong stakeholder management and ability to implement pragmatic, developer-friendly policies.
 



 • Professional English; Swedish or Finnish is a plus.
 



  





**Nice to have** 




 • Hands-on red teaming for LLMs, safety evals, or adversarial testing.
 



 • Certifications (e.g., CISSP, CISM, CCSK) or experience establishing governance boards.

title: AWS Solution Architect
description:
**Job Description**
 De säger att "det är inte raketvetenskap." Vi håller inte med.
   

  

 Välkommen till SSC – Swedish Space Corporation, den perfekta arbetsplatsen för dig som brinner för teknik i allmänhet och rymden i synnerhet.
   

  

 Med rymdorganisationer, forskningsinstitut, institutionella och kommersiella aktörer som kunder, erbjuder vi specialistkompetens inom satellitkommunikation, rymdkonsulttjänster, raket- och ballongsystem, flygtesttjänster, framdrivningssystem för satelliter och mycket mer.
   

  

 SSC har dessutom ett av världens största globala nätverk av markstationer för satellitkommunikation. Vi äger och driver rymdbasen Esrange i Kiruna i norra Sverige, med sikte att i närtid kunna skjuta upp satelliter.
   

  

 Är du driven av en passion för människor och med ambitionen att skapa en fantastisk arbetsplats? Är du redo att ge dig ut på en spännande resa med oss för att hjälpa jorden att dra nytta av rymden?
   

  

 Om du svarar ja på dessa frågor, uppmanar vi dig att ta vara på denna möjlighet.
   

  

 På SSC designar och driver vi IT-system som stödjer allt från satellitstyrning till avancerad rymdforskning. Vi söker nu en AWS-lösningsarkitekt som kan koppla samman strategi och genomförande, någon som älskar att omvandla komplexa behov till skalbara, säkra och eleganta AWS-arkitekturer.
   

  

  

  

**Job Requirements**
 DIN ROLL
   

  

 Som AWS Solution Architect kommer du att vara designexpert för AWS-baserade lösningar inom SSC. Du kommer att arbeta nära teknik-, säkerhets- och produktteam för att säkerställa att våra molnsystem är robusta, kompatibla och byggda för framtiden.
   

  

 Vad du kommer att göra
   

  

* Designa AWS-molnarkitekturer som stöder affärs- och verksamhetskritiska system
* Skapa designdokument, referensarkitekturer och arkitektoniska beslutsprotokoll
* Driva arkitekturanpassning mellan team och initiativ
* Konsultera om bästa praxis för säkerhet, nätverk och kostnadsoptimering
* Stödja koncepttestning och moln-migreringar
* Samarbeta med utvecklare ochDevSecOps-ingenjörer kring molnbaserade lösningar
* Delta i våra forum för IT-styrning och arkitektur
* Håll dig uppdaterad om AWS-tjänster och nya mönster


* Praktiska färdigheter inom scripting etc.
+ Terraform/terragrunt
+ CloudFormation


**Job Responsibilities**
 VEM DU ÄR
   

  

 Du brinner för god design, är pragmatisk när det gäller teknikval och alltid redo att förklara "varför" något är viktigt. Du kan zooma ut till arkitektur och in till CLI när det behövs. Du är en systemtänkare med ett praktiskt tankesätt som kombinerar struktur och metod med flexibilitet och öppenhet. Du är också skicklig på att navigera intressenters behov och bygga starka samarbeten mellan team, samt kommunicera tydligt och säkert på både svenska och engelska..
   

  

 Vad vi söker:
   

  

* 5+ års erfarenhet av att designa molnbaserade arkitekturer, varav minst 3 med AWS
* God förståelse för AWS-tjänster inom beräkning, lagring, nätverk och säkerhet
* Erfarenhet av välstrukturerade ramverk och molnstyrning
* God förståelse för principerna för infrastruktur som kod, CI/CD ochDevSecOps
* Utmärkta kommunikations- och dokumentationsförmåga


**Vi Värdesätter Erfarenhet Av**
* AWScertification(s)
* Erfarenhet av multi-account förvaltning och Control Tower
* Bakgrund i reglerade eller högsäkerhetsmiljöer.


**Job Benefits**
 VI ERBJUDER DIG
   

  

* En av världens mest spännande och snabbast växande branscher inom rymdbranschen.
* En spännande och dynamisk arbetsplats med medarbetare och kunder över hela världen.
* Utrymme att utvecklas i takt med företagets tillväxt och framtidsmål.
* 30 dagars semester samt traditionella helgdagar – vi erbjuder dessutom extra lediga dagar.
* Friskvårdsbidrag (5 000 SEK/år).
* Attraktiv tjänstepension (ITP) och möjlighet att löneväxla till pension.
* En internationell arbetsplats som präglas av en öppen atmosfär och ett utmanande arbetsklimat i ständig utveckling.


  

  

 PLACERING
   

  

 Detta är en tillsvidareanställning på 40 timmar/vecka, med placering på vårt kontor i Solna Strand.
   

  

 MER INFORMATION
   

  

 Vid frågor som rör anställningsvillkor eller fackliga frågor är du välkommen att kontakta våra fackliga representanter:
   

  

 Sveriges Ingenjörer: af@sscspace.com
   

  

 Unionen: unionen@sscspace.com
   

  

  

  

 NÄSTA STEG
   

  

 Om denna möjlighet väcker ditt intresse så är du varmt välkommen med din ansökan! Vi går igenom ansökningar löpande och intervjuer genomförs under processens gång. Vänligen bifoga ditt CV i samband med ansökan. Du har möjlighet att komplettera med ett personligt brev, men vår bedömning kommer i första hand att utgå från din kompetens och erfarenhet som framgår av CV:t, i syfte att säkerställa en rättvis och objektiv rekryteringsprocess.
   

  

 Observera att annonsen kan komma att stängas i förtid om vi får in ett stort antal ansökningar, för att kunna säkerställa en effektiv process och ge varje kandidat rättvis uppmärksamhet.
   

  

  

  

 Detta är en säkerhetsklassad position och kommer att kräva en bakgrundskontroll före anställning.
   

  

 Välkommen med din ansökan till och med 2025-12-08.
   

  

 VI HJÄLPER JORDEN ATT DRA NYTTA AV RYMDEN
   

  

 Swedish Space Corporation (SSC) är en ledande global leverantör av avancerade rymdtjänster med mer än 50 års erfarenhet. Vi hjälper rymdorganisationer, forskningsinstitut, kommersiella och institutionella aktörer från hela världen att få tillgång till rymden.
   

  

 Med lokal närvaro på alla kontinenter och cirka 700 engagerade medarbetare erbjuder vi specialistkompetens inom satellitkommunikation och satellitkontrolltjänster, rymdfarkostoperationer, raket- och ballongsystem, uppskjutningstjänster och flygtesttjänster, samt ingenjörs-, drift- och konsulttjänster för rymduppdrag.
   

  

 We help Earth benefit from space. Läs mer på sscspace.com

title: Customer Success Manager
description:
At Stratsys, we offer a SaaS platform that streamlines compliance within business-critical areas such as sustainability, GRC and quality management. Unlike other compliance tools, we take it one step further by moving organizations from reporting to action and effectively distributing responsibilities internally.
   

  

 We are looking for a driven and relationship-oriented Customer Success Manager to join our team in either Gothenburg or Stockholm. In this role, you will work with customers within the public sector and manage a broad spectrum of customer relationships.
   

  

 As Customer Success Manager, you will focus on both our customers and our platform. You will be the main point of contact for both small and large customers and take overall responsibility for their use of Stratsys as well as for their growth together with us. This role is about combining platform knowledge with relationship building, so we are looking for someone who enjoys working directly with our platform, being close to customers and identifying new opportunities. You drive growth by capturing needs and developing collaborations. A data-driven approach helps you find ways to improve and create strategic solutions that deliver real value to our customers.
   

  

**WHAT’S IN IT FOR YOU?** 
 💡
   

  

* An engaging work environment with people who share a common mindset to deliver a world-class product in important and impactful areas.
* Work within an important and well-established field where we have a strong reputation. The public sector is a central focus for us, with a well-developed pipeline and significant marketing support.
* Challenging, varied and engaging work tasks with room and encouragement for independence and innovation.
* Join a high-energy, close-knit team where every success is celebrated together. Please look at our Instagram to get an insight into our culture.
* Work from a fantastic and centrally located office at A House the Ark in Stockholm or at Kungsportsplatsen in Gothenburg.
* Be part of a company with great benefits – read more about our benefits here!


**THE ROLE** 
**📌**
 As a Customer Success Manager at Stratsys, you will play a key role in our growth journey. You will guide customers within the public sector from adoption to expansion, ensuring their success while driving new business opportunities. Working closely with Project Managers and Sales Specialists, you’ll ensure clients fully utilize the platform, strengthening loyalty and opening doors for further sales.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities:**
* Build long-term customer relationships based on trust, engagement and clear results – in collaboration with both senior decision-makers and operational teams.
* Ensure that customers achieve their goals and gain full value from our platform by identifying needs and turning them into business opportunities.
* Drive customer dialogues such as check-ins, strategy meetings and product demos, as well as support with platform adjustments and improvements.
* Advise customers, increase awareness and interest in our products and develop the product knowledge that makes you a trusted advisor.
* Take sales responsibility together with Sales Specialists by proactively managing sales activities, achieving revenue targets and creating new opportunities within existing accounts.
* Manage your own budget with clear sales and growth targets, including negotiations, renewals and procurement agreements to secure long-term partnerships.
* Analyze product usage to identify growth opportunities, optimize utilization and drive increased use of the Stratsys platform.


**YOUR BACKGROUND** 
**✔️**
* Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in a relevant field, such as Business Administration or Information Systems.
* 1–3 years of relevant work experience, preferably as a Customer Success Manager within SaaS or tech.
* Strong interest in systems and digitization with experience in handling and learning new systems.
* Fluent in Swedish with excellent English skills


**Bonus Qualifications:**
* Experience from the public sector or large/complex organizations with an understanding of business planning or quality processes.
* Prior involvement in public procurement and procurement processes


**About You 👀**
 To thrive in this role, we see that you are a driven and curious person with a genuine interest in customer-oriented work and smart digital solutions. You are independent, proactive and have a positive attitude. You are unafraid, make sure tasks are completed and involve the necessary people along the way. You want to grow within sales, customer relations and are eager to learn and embrace new developments in the ever-changing tech landscape. You value a positive team environment and the opportunity to be part of a growth journey. You are simply ready for your next adventure with Stratsys!
   

  

**About Us 🚀**
 Does this look like a role for you? Do not hesitate, show your interest today since we are working ongoing with selection of candidates.
   

  

 Is this particular role not quite right for you -  Show your interest for future openings by connecting with us. We look forward to hearing from you!
   

  

 Do you want to read more about us and your future colleagues and take part in our everyday life here at Stratsys? Go to jobs.stratsys.com or follow us on LinkedIn or Instagram.

title: Customer Architect - Sweden
description:
Elastic, the Search AI Company, enables everyone to find the answers they need in real time, using all their data, at scale — unleashing the potential of businesses and people. The Elastic Search AI Platform, used by more than 50% of the Fortune 500, brings together the precision of search and the intelligence of AI to enable everyone to accelerate the results that matter. By taking advantage of all structured and unstructured data — securing and protecting private information more effectively — Elastic’s complete, cloud-based solutions for search, security, and observability help organizations deliver on the promise of AI.
   

  

**What Is The Role**
 We are actively seeking a Customer Architect with an understanding of technology and hands-on experience in key IT domains, notably Observability, Cybersecurity, and Enterprise Search. You should possess a strong technical background, preferably with experience in cloud-based software solutions.
   

  

 We value individuals who are passionate about staying at the forefront of technology trends with a growth mindset and excited to learn and implement new technologies. While previous experience with Elastic solutions is not a prerequisite, an eagerness to adopt our suite of solutions and apply them effectively to solve our customers' challenges is critical. This key role involves not only driving the consumption of our Elastic solutions by aligning them with customer business objectives but also onboarding customers, securing adoption, and facilitating expansion.
   

  

 As a Customer Architect, you will be the Trusted Technical Advisor, working in tandem with the customer and complementary groups like Field and Services Teams to ensure that Elastic solutions are exceeding customer’s expectations. . Your technical expertise, eye for business, and ability to deliver value will accelerate and improve the customer experience leading to customer continued satisfaction and expansion within the elastic portfolio.
   

  

 In your role, a crucial part of your responsibility is defining and communicating the technical success criteria for our customers. This involves crafting detailed Technical Success Plans tailored to the specific customers goals and critical metrics.
   

  

 The Technical Success Plans act as a roadmap, outlining the optimal consumption and deployment of Elastic solutions in the customer's environment. They detail the necessary steps for implementation, highlight achievements for successful consumption or expansion, and provide and effectiveness aligned to the customer’s business goals. By actioning this plan , you will be seen as the trusted advisor, guiding the customer towards achieving their desired outcomes, thereby ensuring their success and satisfaction.
   

  

 From providing technical guidance and sharing standard methodologies to aligning technical objectives with the customers' business goals, your work is instrumental in facilitating smooth adoption, sustained usage, and increased consumption of our solutions. This hands-on role requires you to be proactive, with a keen understanding of our customers' technical landscape and a commitment to making their journey with Elastic solutions successful and valuable.
   

  

 Your chief aim will be to ensure the customer derives significant value, eliminate technical frictions, and propel the uptake and application of Elastic solutions, with the ultimate goal of growing annual recurring revenue (ARR).
   

  

**What Will You Be Doing**
* Collaborate closely with the account team, including the Account Executive and the Solutions Architect (Pre-sales engineer), to provide ongoing technical coverage and support, while the account team focuses on identifying new deals.
* Define the technical success plan for each customer, outlining the optimal use of Elastic solutions to achieve their business objectives.
* Ensure a successful technical customer journey, from onboarding to adoption, while continuously driving the consumption of Elastic solutions.
* Understand and articulate the value proposition of Elastic solutions and align them with the customer's business goals.
* Work closely with customers to identify and eliminate technical frictions, promoting a smoother adoption and implementation of Elastic solutions.
* Liaise between customers and support, as necessary, to ensure an optimized support resolution experience smoothing the adoption curve for the customer.
* As a hands-on technical authority, collaborate with the Service Team to deliver personalized, frictionless solutions that meet the unique needs of each customer.
* Develop a comprehensive understanding of the customer's business needs and translate these into technical requirements for Elastic solutions.
* Find opportunities for expansion, at which point the account team takes over to expand the subscription, aiming to grow annual recurring revenue (ARR).
* Foster ongoing customer relationships, ensuring that customers continue to increase their utilization of Elastic solutions, further driving ARR.
* Continuously review and assess customer consumption of Elastic solutions, proactively suggesting upgrades and enhancements that increase value and drive further consumption.
* The nature of the work that you will be doing will require a high percentage of work onsite with customers, and you should be expected to travel as a result of this requirement


**What You Bring**
* Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Information Systems, or a related field highly preferred.
* Validated experience in a similar role such as Solutions Architect, Technical Consultant, or Pre-sales Engineer, with hands-on experience with Elastic solutions or equivalent technologies.
* Experienced with one or more Elastic solutions (Observability, Security, Enterprise Search) or the Elastic stack (Elasticsearch, Logstash, Kibana) and how to align them with business objectives is a plus.
* Excellent communication and presentation skills.
* Strong social skills, with the ability to establish relationships with customers and team members.
* Demonstrated problem-solving skills, with a track record of delivering innovative solutions.
* Ability to lead multiple projects simultaneously and meet deadlines.


**Additional Information - We Take Care Of Our People**
 As a distributed company, diversity drives our identity. Whether you’re looking to launch a new career or grow an existing one, Elastic is the type of company where you can balance great work with great life. Your age is only a number. It doesn’t matter if you’re just out of college or your children are; we need you for what you can do.
   

  

 We strive to have parity of benefits across regions and while regulations differ from place to place, we believe taking care of our people is the right thing to do.
   

  

* Competitive pay based on the work you do here and not your previous salary
* Health coverage for you and your family in many locations
* Ability to craft your calendar with flexible locations and schedules for many roles
* Generous number of vacation days each year
* Increase your impact - We match up to $2000 (or local currency equivalent) for financial donations and service
* Up to 40 hours each year to use toward volunteer projects you love
* Embracing parenthood with minimum of 16 weeks of parental leave


 Different people approach problems differently. We need that. Elastic is an equal opportunity employer and is committed to creating an inclusive culture that celebrates different perspectives, experiences, and backgrounds. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, ethnicity, color, religion, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender perception or identity, national origin, age, marital status, protected veteran status, disability status, or any other basis protected by federal, state or local law, ordinance or regulation.
   

  

 We welcome individuals with disabilities and strive to create an accessible and inclusive experience for all individuals. To request an accommodation during the application or the recruiting process, please email candidate\_accessibility@elastic.co. We will reply to your request within 24 business hours of submission.
   

  

 Applicants have rights under Federal Employment Laws, view posters linked below: Family and Medical Leave Act (FMLA) Poster; Pay Transparency Nondiscrimination Provision Poster; Employee Polygraph Protection Act (EPPA) Poster and Know Your Rights (Poster)
   

  

 Elasticsearch develops and distributes encryption software and technology that is subject to U.S. export controls and licensing requirements for individuals who are located in or are nationals of the following sanctioned countries and regions: Belarus, Cuba, Iran, North Korea, Russia, Syria, the Crimea Region of Ukraine, the Donetsk People’s Republic (“DNR”), and the Luhansk People’s Republic (“LNR”). If you are located in or are a national of one of the listed countries or regions, an export license may be required as a condition of your employment in this role. Please note that national origin and/or nationality do not affect eligibility for employment with Elastic.
   

  

 Please see here for our Privacy Statement.
   

  

 Different people approach problems differently. We need that. Elastic is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer committed to diversity, equity, and inclusion. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, ethnicity, color, religion, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender perception or identity, national origin, age, marital status, protected veteran status, disability status, or any other basis protected by federal, state or local law, ordinance or regulation.
   

  

 We welcome individuals with disabilities and strive to create an accessible and inclusive experience for all individuals. To request an accommodation during the application or the recruiting process, please email candidate\_accessibility@elastic.co We will reply to your request within 24 business hours of submission.
   

  

 Applicants have rights under Federal Employment Laws, view posters linked below:
   

  

 Family and Medical Leave Act (FMLA) Poster; Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) Poster; and Employee Polygraph Protection Act (EPPA) Poster.
   

  

 Please see here for our Privacy Statement.

title: Konsult - Newsec Interim Solutions
description:
*Är du konsult inom fastighetsbranschen eller går i tankarna om att ta steget dit? Anslut dig till vårt konsultnätverk och ta del av spännande uppdragsmöjligheter!*
 Newsec Interim Solutions erbjuder kvalificerade och erfarna konsulter för tillfälliga uppdrag inom fastighetsbranschen. Vi har ett brett nätverk av kompetenta interimskonsulter som hjälper våra kunder med allt från projektledning och förvaltning till affärsutveckling och strategi.
   

  

 Med över 40 kontrakterade konsulter hos företag som Castellum, Vasakronan och Corem är vi specialiserade på lösningar inom fastighetsbranschen.
   

  

 Vi tillsätter uppdrag inom:
   

  

* Fastighetsförvaltning
* Uthyrning
* Management
* Etablering
* Projektledning
* Projektutveckling
* Ekonomi/controlling
* Hyresadministration


 Oavsett roll ser vi till att ha rätt konsult tillgänglig i rätt tid och vi arbetar för att vara det självklara valet för både kunder och konsulter.
   

  

**Hur arbetar vi?**
 Varje uppdrag är unikt och vi strävar efter att göra den bästa matchningen av konsult för att uppfylla det specifika behovet i din organisation. Vi kvalitetssäkrar våra konsulter genom intervjuer, bakgrundskontroll, tester samt referenstagning för att säkerställa hög standard och långsiktiga relationer med både våra konsulter och våra uppdragsgivare.
   

  

**Vill du bli en del av vårt konsultnätverk?**
 Vi söker efter dig som vill arbeta som konsult inom fastighetsbranschen och delar vår vision om att leverera högkvalitativa resultat. Som konsult ser vi att du är en prestigelös individ som trivs i en föränderlig miljö och snabbt kan sätta dig in i verksamheten och leverera. Du är även självgående och uppskattar att dela med dig av dina erfarenheter.
   

  

 Som uppdragspartner vill vi erbjuda dig som konsult kompetensutveckling, kunskapsutbyte och samhörighet. Därmed bjuder vi löpande in våra konsulter till bland annat gästföreläsningar, kurser och nätverksträffar. Bli en del av vårt nätverk så är du varmt välkommen att delta vid nästa tillfälle!
   

  

*Vi ser fram emot att lära känna dig och utforska de möjligheter som väntar. Tillsammans skapar vi framgångsrika interimslösningar inom fastighetsbranschen.*

title: Manager - Enterprise Solutions | BCG Platinion
description:
Who We Are
   

  

 Do you want to turn the challenges of digitalization into the solutions of the future? Join BCG Platinion in tackling the core IT issues of leading global companies. Deploy customized platforms, architectures, strategies, and organizations to leverage the digital potential of our customers and drive true innovation, with state-of-the-art tools such as cloud computing, AI, blockchain, microservices, and containerization. Add your individual strengths to our unique team, always there to support you. Together with Boston Consulting Group and our clients, we turn digital visions into reality.
   

  

 What You'll Do
   

  

 For our Nordic offices (Stockholm, Oslo, Helsinki and Copenhagen), we are looking for Managers for our Enterprise Solutions chapter! About The Job At BCG Platinion, we provide sound advice on all relevant IT issues. In particular, the migration to the SAP S/4HANA solution against the background of the planned mainstream maintenance presents our customers with special challenges. The typical questions our customers have range from justification and business benefits of the SAP S/4 HANA Transition to optimized roadmaps taking into account the implications on overall architecture and also alternative solutions and platforms. To serve our customers even better, we would like to strengthen our Enterprise Solutions team. You work together with colleagues from Platinion and/or the Boston Consulting Group on local and international customer projects. Together with our customers, you actively develop superior, business value driven ERP and application architecture strategies, concepts and roadmaps and apply your sound technical and process-related understanding. Last but not least, you enjoy your work and embody the 'BCG Platinion Spirit' with your hands-on manner.
   

  

 What You'll Bring
   

  

**This Is How You Can Make a Difference**
* An above-average degree in computer science, business informatics, business administration or a related field
* At least 6 years of relevant experience in the context of strategic ERP/CRM/SCM projects

* Overview on modern, data-driven overall architectures, in particular the overall integration of different individual modules to end-to-end processes (Purchase-2-Pay, Order-2-Cash, Lead-2-Quote, Record-2-Report, Hire-2-Retire etc.)
* Exceptional analytical and conceptual skills
* Fluent in one Nordic Language and English (written and spoken)
* Strong client and result orientation
* Team spirit, communication and presentation skills as well as intellectual agility
* Ability to align individuals and organizations to a common goal


 Who You'll Work With
   

  

**Shape The World Of Tomorrow**
* Operational management of large-scale ERP/CRM/SCM projects, leading the BCG Platinion team
* Interacting with the client's leadership team (board, board, senior management) together with the BCG Platinion leadership team
* Development of ERP/CRM/SCM implementation and rollout strategies and plans in complex application landscapes and client environments
* Preparation and presentation of offers for major Enterprise Solutions projects
* Taking over internal tasks as part of the Nordic BCG Platinion Enterprise Solutions leadership (e.g., leadership of colleagues, driving content topics, ...)
* Participation in leadership meetings and practice group meetings of BCG Platinion in the Nordics


 Additional info
   

  

**How You Can Grow With Us**
 We guarantee constant development incentives in an open and rewarding work environment! Together with a dedicated team of talented colleagues, you get to work on new challenges every day. Individual training offers and a culture of open feedback will provide the framework needed to explore and perfect personal strengths. Our modern structures allow focusing on the essence of our work - with easy travel booking, an excellent back-office support and comprehensive Knowledge Center. With our regular office Fridays and legendary events, we nurture a strong and close team network beyond our case work.
   

  

**Become a Part Of Our Team**

title: Chief Information Security Officer (CISO)
description:
**Stillfront Group** 
 is a global games company founded in 2010. We develop digital games for a diverse gaming audience and our broad games portfolio is enjoyed by almost 70 million people every month. Stillfront is focused on realizing synergies by connecting and empowering game teams globally through our Stillops platform. We are a fast-growing company and an active global strategic acquirer. Our 1,500+ professionals thrive in an organization that embodies the spirit of entrepreneurship.
 



  





 We are on a mission to protect its global digital ecosystem and ensure the security of our portfolio of gaming experiences. We are seeking an experienced and hands-on Chief Information Security Officer (CISO) to lead our cybersecurity efforts. The CISO will play a pivotal role in shaping the future of our cybersecurity strategy, driving risk management, and ensuring the highest level of information security across all studios and operations. This position reports directly to the CIO and will be based in our Stockholm headquarters, with the flexibility to collaborate globally with our diverse and dynamic teams.
 



  





  





**YOUR MISSION** 



* Developing and executing a comprehensive information security strategy that aligns with Stillfront's business objectives and risk appetite
* Overseeing the implementation of security measures, ensuring protection across our infrastructure, platforms, and game development studios
* Leading a global security team in the identification, assessment, and mitigation of cybersecurity risks, including security architecture, governance, and incident response
* Monitoring and ensuring compliance with cybersecurity regulations and standards across our global operations
* Collaborating with internal stakeholders, including IT, Legal, and Product Development teams, to integrate security into every phase of product, game and service development
* Managing relationships with external security vendors, consultants, and partners to ensure the most up-to-date security solutions are in place
* Providing executive leadership with regular reporting on the status of cybersecurity threats, vulnerabilities, and remediation efforts
* Leading incident response efforts, including investigation, reporting, and remediation of security incidents, breaches, and threats
* Championing a culture of security awareness across the organization through training and best practices



  





**YOUR BACKSTORY** 



* A minimum of 10 years of experience in information security, risk management, or a related field, with at least 5 years in a senior leadership role
* Proven experience in developing and implementing security strategies, frameworks, and policies for global organizations
* A deep understanding of cybersecurity threats, vulnerabilities, and countermeasures, with expertise in incident response and crisis management
* Strong knowledge of information security standards such as ISO 27001, NIST, and GDPR compliance
* Hands-on experience with security technologies, including WAF, intrusion detection systems, endpoint protection, encryption, and cloud security
* Experience working with regulatory bodies and compliance requirements in a global context
* Excellent leadership, communication, and interpersonal skills, with the ability to influence and collaborate with senior stakeholders and cross-functional teams
* A proactive, strategic thinker, with the ability to operate in a fast-paced, ever-evolving environment. Relevant certifications, such as CISSP, CISM, or CISA, are desirable
* Fluent in English, with Swedish as a plus

title: Growth Engineer
description:
**Tl;dr:** 
 We’re looking for a full-stack growth engineer who’s product-obsessed. One month you’ll ship a feature that users can’t stop talking about. The next, you’ll tear into funnels, loops, and onboarding to make them 10x tighter. You think in code, but your instinct is always: will this make the product better and our users more successful?
   

  

**Coding skills + excellent taste + growth instincts + product obsession = you.**
**Why Lovable?**
 Lovable lets anyone build software with plain English. From solopreneurs to Fortune 100 teams, millions of people use Lovable to transform raw ideas into real products - fast. We are at the forefront of a foundational shift in software creation, which means you have an unprecedented opportunity to change the way the digital world works. Over 2 million people in 200+ countries already use Lovable to launch businesses, solve complex problems, and bring their dreams to life. And we’re just getting started.
   

  

 We’re a small, talent-dense team building a generation-defining company from Stockholm. We value high ownership, high velocity and low-ego collaboration. We seek people who care deeply, challenge us, and are driven to build something of lasting impact.
   

  

**What We’re Looking For**
* 5+ years of experience building and growing products with high-performing teams
* Skilled at designing, measuring, and iterating experiments based on evidence
* Thorough and detail-oriented in setting up growth systems “right” from the start
* Strong product sense with ability to frame problems, prioritize bets, and push the right ones forward
* Motivated by technology that makes a difference and by seeing impact through measurable results


**What You’ll Do**
 In one sentence: Do what it takes to build a predictable, sustainable, and competitively defensible growth model for Lovable.
   

  

* Build new product features & experiences
* Build and run A/B tests to optimize product-led growth loops (viral, referral, UGC).
* Deploy the fastest solution possible to validate ideas and scale the ones that work.
* Help manage integrations with other apps - MCP and API based.
* Keep the product experience relentlessly Lovable while making growth the engine, not the afterthought.


**Our tech stack**
 We're building with tools that both humans and AI love:
   

  

* Frontend: React
* Backend: Golang and Rust
* Cloud: Cloudflare, GCP, AWS, Many LLM providers
* DevOps & Tooling: Github Actions, Grafana, OTEL, infra-as-code (Terraform)


 And always on the lookout for what's next!
   

  

**How Applying Works**
* Fill in a short form then jump on an initial exploratory call.
* Join us for a round of technical interviews
* Team intro calls with the team


 Apply by clicking the link below.

title: LIA opportunities for   autumn 2025 to spring 2026
description:
LIA opportunities for autumn 2025 to spring 2026
   

  

 Beskrivning av tjänsten
   

  

 From Autumn 2025 to spring 2026, we will be offering LIA students positions in the following areas/projects/teams.
   

  

 We follow most schools’ LIA planning periods.
   

  

 To be an integer part of the team or as part of a project to develop new functionalities in current systems and tools or if need be, develop a new set of tools.
   

  

 Most of the work will be Office-based. All students will have at least one buddy or Team leader. In the case of projects, they will be managed by a Project manager and supervised by one of our managers. We also provide technical competence wherever needed.
   

  

 We value: Competence, Ability to work in teams and your own drive to accomplish the task. As always, it is a combination of working alone to solve your assignment and to work in a team to build a great solution together.
   

  

 All roles are subject to background checks as our customers demand that.
   

  

**To apply:**
 In the application, please add what role/s you are interested in so we can handle all applicants as quickly as possible. You can add several roles of course – in the single application.
   

  

 Do not forget to personalize your application, add things like hobbies, interests, what you do in your free time, and what motivates and drives you forward in your career.
   

  

 Good luck with your application!
   

  

 Dina framtida arbetsuppgifter
   

  

**Compliance**
 In this project we are looking for several positions.
   

  

 Be a part of our LIA team to build our onprem AI platform.
   

  

* Continue with our PolicyPilot initiative to integrate all frameworks: ESMF and external NIS2, SOC2, DORA, ISOxxxx, etc…

**Knowledge:**

* Linux

* With PolicyPilot extend to incorporate all our Supplier contracts as well as all Client contracts.

**Data Management and Reporting**
 In this project we are looking for several positions.
   

  

 Be a part of our Operations Support team to develop automated reporting for our management teams, add new features, combine reporting and automation tasks.

 In this project we are looking for several positions.
   

  

 Be a part of our Helix ITSM team. To develop new functionalities using both built-in AI and on-prem AI in AI projects on our ITSM platform. For our upgrade and AIOPS + Helix GPT introduction, data structure, data cleaning etc... And, development of new dashboards using Helix components and data structure.
   

  

* AIOPS

**Datacenter move**
 In this project we are looking for several positions.
